member.name: M:Rhino.Runtime.HostUtils.InPlaceConstCast(Rhino.Geometry.GeometryBase,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
DO NOT USE UNLESS YOU ARE CERTAIN ABOUT THE IMPLICATIONS.
This is an expert user function which should not be needed in most cases. This function is similar to a const_cast in C++ to allow an object to be made temporarily modifiable without causing RhinoCommon to convert the class from const to non-const by creating a duplicate.
You must call this function with a true parameter, make your modifications, and then restore the const flag by calling this function again with a false parameter. If you have any questions, please contact McNeel developer support before using!

member.returns: true if the RDK is loaded; false if the RDK is not loaded. Note that the will hinder the retrieval of any return value.

member.name: T:Rhino.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: The Rhino namespace contains fundamental types that define commonly-used value types and classes used in Rhino.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.NamespaceDoc
member.summary:
The Geometry namespace contains geometric types used in Rhino.
Examples are lines, curves, meshes and boundary representations.

member.name: T:Rhino.DocObjects.NamespaceDoc
member.summary:
The DocObjects namespace contains types that correspond to geometry that is found in a document.
Generally, these types reference an attribute and have a distinctive ID.

Represents a contruction plane inside the document.
Use Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.NamedConstructionPlaneTable methods and indexers to add and access a .

member.summary: Gets or sets the distance between grid lines.

member.summary: when "grid snap" is enabled, the distance between snap points. Typically this is the same distance as grid spacing.

member.summary: Gets or sets the total amount of grid lines in each direction.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ConstructionPlane.ThickLineFrequency
member.summary:
Gets or sets the recurrence of a wider line on the grid.
0: No lines are thick, all are drawn thin.
1: All lines are thick.
2: Every other line is thick.
3: One line in three lines is thick (and two are thin).
4: ...

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ConstructionPlane.DepthBuffered
member.summary:
Gets or sets whether the grid is drawn on top of geometry.
false=grid is always drawn behind 3d geometry
true=grid is drawn at its depth as a 3d plane and grid lines obscure things behind the grid.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewInfo.Finalize
member.summary: Passively reclaims unmanaged resources when the class user did not explicitly call Dispose().

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewInfo.Dispose
member.summary: Actively reclaims unmanaged resources that this instance uses.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewInfo.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
For derived class implementers.
This method is called with argument true when class user calls Dispose(), while with argument false when the Garbage Collector invokes the finalizer, or Finalize() method.
You must reclaim all used unmanaged resources in both cases, and can use this chance to call Dispose on disposable fields if the argument is true.
Also, you must call the base virtual method within your overriding method.
member.param: true if the call comes from the Dispose() method; false if it comes from the Garbage Collector finalizer.

member.returns: A plane value. This might be invalid on error.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.EarthAnchorPoint.GetModelToEarthTransform(Rhino.UnitSystem)
member.summary: Gets a transformation from model coordinates to earth coordinates. This transformation assumes the model is small enough that the curvature of the earth can be ignored.
member.returns: Transform on success. Inalid Transform on error.
member.remarks:
If M is a point in model coordinates and E = model_to_earth*M, then E.x = latitude in decimal degrees E.y = longitude in decimal degrees E.z = elevation in meters above mean sea level Because the earth is not flat, there is a small amount of error when using a linear transformation to calculate oblate spherical coordinates. This error is small. If the distance from P to M is d meters, then the approximation error is latitude error <= longitude error <= elevation error <= 6379000*((1 + (d/6356000)^2)-1) meters
In particular, if every point in the model is within 1000 meters of the m_model_basepoint, then the maximum approximation errors are latitude error <= longitude error <= elevation error <= 8 centimeters.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.RenderSettings.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
For derived class implementers.
This method is called with argument true when class user calls Dispose(), while with argument false when the Garbage Collector invokes the finalizer, or Finalize() method.
You must reclaim all used unmanaged resources in both cases, and can use this chance to call Dispose on disposable fields if the argument is true.
Also, you must call the base virtual method within your overriding method.
member.param: true if the call comes from the Dispose() method; false if it comes from the Garbage Collector finalizer.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.GeometryBase.DuplicateShallow
member.summary: Constructs a light copy of this object. By "light", it is meant that the same underlying data is used until something is done to attempt to change it. For example, you could have a shallow copy of a very heavy mesh object and the same underlying data will be used when doing things like inspecting the number of faces on the mesh. If you modify the location of one of the mesh vertices, the shallow copy will create a full duplicate of the underlying mesh data and the shallow copy will become a deep copy.
member.returns:
An object of the same type as this object.
This behavior is overridden by implementing classes.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.GeometryBase.Duplicate
member.summary: Constructs a deep (full) copy of this object.
member.returns: An object of the same type as this, with the same properties and behavior.

member.summary: Transforms the geometry. If the input Transform has a SimilarityType of OrientationReversing, you may want to consider flipping the transformed geometry after calling this function when it makes sense. For example, you may want to call Flip() on a Brep after transforming it.
member.returns: true if geometry successfully transformed.

member.summary: Rotates the object about the specified axis. A positive rotation angle results in a counter-clockwise rotation about the axis (right hand rule).
member.param: Direction of the axis of rotation.
Point on the axis of rotation.
member.returns: true if geometry successfully rotated.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.GeometryBase.MemoryEstimate

member.returns: An estimated memory footprint.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.GeometryBase.GetBoundingBox(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Boundingbox solver. Gets the world axis aligned boundingbox for the geometry.
member.param: If true, a physically accurate boundingbox will be computed. If not, a boundingbox estimate will be computed. For some geometry types there is no difference between the estimate and the accurate boundingbox. Estimated boundingboxes can be computed much (much) faster than accurate (or "tight") bounding boxes. Estimated bounding boxes are always similar to or larger than accurate bounding boxes.
member.returns: The boundingbox of the geometry in world coordinates or BoundingBox.Empty if not bounding box could be found.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.GeometryBase.GetBoundingBox(Rhino.Geometry.Transform)
member.summary: Aligned Boundingbox solver. Gets the world axis aligned boundingbox for the transformed geometry.
member.param: Transformation to apply to object prior to the BoundingBox computation. The geometry itself is not modified.
member.returns: The accurate boundingbox of the transformed geometry in world coordinates or BoundingBox.Empty if not bounding box could be found.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.GeometryBase.GetBoundingBox(Rhino.Geometry.Plane)
member.summary: Aligned Boundingbox solver. Gets the plane aligned boundingbox.
member.returns: A BoundingBox in plane coordinates.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.GeometryBase.GetBoundingBox(Rhino.Geometry.Plane,Rhino.Geometry.Box@)
member.summary: Aligned Boundingbox solver. Gets the plane aligned boundingbox.
member.returns: A BoundingBox in plane coordinates.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.ArcCurve
member.summary:
Represent arcs and circles.
ArcCurve.IsCircle returns true if the curve is a complete circle.

remarks.para: an ArcCurve is a subcurve of a circle, with a constant speed parameterization. The parameterization is an affine linear reparameterzation of the underlying arc m_arc onto the domain m_t.
A valid ArcCurve has Radius()>0 and 0<AngleRadians()<=2*PI and a strictly increasing Domain.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.Curve
member.summary:
Represents a base class that is common to most RhinoCommon curve types.
A curve represents an entity that can be all visited by providing a single parameter, usually called t.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.CreateTweenCurves(Rhino.Geometry.Curve,Rhino.Geometry.Curve,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates curves between two open or closed input curves. Uses the control points of the curves for finding tween curves. That means the first control point of first curve is matched to first control point of the second curve and so on. There is no matching of curves direction. Caller must match input curves direction before calling the function.
member.param: Number of tween curves to create.
member.returns: An array of joint curves. This array can be empty.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.CreateTweenCurvesWithMatching(Rhino.Geometry.Curve,Rhino.Geometry.Curve,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates curves between two open or closed input curves. Make the structure of input curves compatible if needed. Refits the input curves to have the same structure. The resulting curves are usually more complex than input unless input curves are compatible and no refit is needed. There is no matching of curves direction. Caller must match input curves direction before calling the function.
member.param: Number of tween curves to create.
member.returns: An array of joint curves. This array can be empty.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.CreateTweenCurvesWithSampling(Rhino.Geometry.Curve,Rhino.Geometry.Curve,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates curves between two open or closed input curves. Use sample points method to make curves compatible. This is how the algorithm workd: Divides the two curves into an equal number of points, finds the midpoint between the corresponding points on the curves and interpolates the tween curve through those points. There is no matching of curves direction. Caller must match input curves direction before calling the function.
member.param: Number of tween curves to create.
Number of sample points along input curves.
member.returns: >An array of joint curves. This array can be empty.

member.summary: Joins a collection of curve segments together.

Joining tolerance, i.e. the distance between segment end-points that is allowed.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.JoinCurves(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Rhino.Geometry.Curve},System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Joins a collection of curve segments together.
member.param: An array, a list or any enumerable set of curve segments to join.
Joining tolerance, i.e. the distance between segment end-points that is allowed.

param.name: preserveDirection
param.para: If true, curve endpoints will be compared to curve startpoints.
If false, all start and endpoints will be compared and copies of input curves may be reversed in output.

member.returns: An array of joint curves. This array can be empty.
member.exception: If inputCurves is null.

member.summary: Makes adjustments to the ends of one or both input curves so that they meet at a point.
member.param: Which end of the 1st curve to adjust: true is start, false is end.
which end of the 2nd curve to adjust true==start, false==end.
member.returns: true on success.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.GetFilletPoints(Rhino.Geometry.Curve,Rhino.Geometry.Curve,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double@,System.Double@,Rhino.Geometry.Plane@)
member.summary: Finds points at which to cut a pair of curves so that a fillet of given radius can be inserted.
member.param: Parameter value for base point on curve0.
Parameter value for base point on curve1.
Parameter value of fillet point on curve 0.
Parameter value of fillet point on curve 1.
The fillet is contained in this plane with the fillet center at the plane origin.
member.returns: true on success, false on failure.
member.remarks: A fillet point is a pair of curve parameters (t0,t1) such that there is a circle of radius point3 tangent to curve c0 at t0 and tangent to curve c1 at t1. Of all possible fillet points this function returns the one which is the closest to the base point t0Base, t1Base. Distance from the base point is measured by the sum of arc lengths along the two curves.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.CreateFillet(Rhino.Geometry.Curve,Rhino.Geometry.Curve,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Computes the fillet arc for a curve filleting operation.
member.param: Parameter on curve0 where the fillet ought to start (approximately).
Parameter on curve1 where the fillet ought to end (approximately).
member.returns: The fillet arc on success, or Arc.Unset on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.CreateFilletCurves(Rhino.Geometry.Curve,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,Rhino.Geometry.Curve,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,System.Double,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Creates a tangent arc between two curves and trims or extends the curves to the arc.
member.param: A point on the first curve that is near the end where the fillet will be created.
A point on the second curve that is near the end where the fillet will be created.
Trim copies of the input curves to the output fillet curve.

Applies when arcs are filleted but need to be extended to meet the fillet curve or chamfer line. If true, then the arc is extended maintaining its validity. If false, then the arc is extended with a line segment, which is joined to the arc converting it to a polycurve.
The tolerance, generally the document's absolute tolerance.
member.returns: The results of the fillet operation. The number of output curves depends on the input curves and the values of the parameters that were used during the fillet operation. In most cases, the output array will contain either one or three curves, although two curves can be returned if the radius is zero and join = false. For example, if both join and trim = true, then the output curve will be a polycurve containing the fillet curve joined with trimmed copies of the input curves. If join = false and trim = true, then three curves, the fillet curve and trimmed copies of the input curves, will be returned. If both join and trim = false, then just the fillet curve is returned.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
For derived class implementers.
This method is called with argument true when class user calls Dispose(), while with argument false when the Garbage Collector invokes the finalizer, or Finalize() method.
You must reclaim all used unmanaged resources in both cases, and can use this chance to call Dispose on disposable fields if the argument is true.
Also, you must call the base virtual method within your overriding method.
member.param: true if the call comes from the Dispose() method; false if it comes from the Garbage Collector finalizer.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.ChangeClosedCurveSeam(System.Double)
member.summary: If this curve is closed, then modify it so that the start/end point is at curve parameter t.
member.param: Curve parameter of new start/end point. The returned curves domain will start at t.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.IsClosable(System.Double)
member.summary: Decide if it makes sense to close off this curve by moving the endpoint to the start based on start-end gap size and length of curve as approximated by chord defined by 6 points.
member.param: Maximum allowable distance between start and end. If start - end gap is greater than tolerance, this function will return false.
member.returns: true if start and end points are close enough based on above conditions.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.IsClosable(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Decide if it makes sense to close off this curve by moving the endpoint to the start based on start-end gap size and length of curve as approximated by chord defined by 6 points.
member.param: Maximum allowable distance between start and end. If start - end gap is greater than tolerance, this function will return false.
If greater than 0.0 and none of the interior sampled points are at least minimumAbsoluteSize from start, this function will return false.
If greater than 1.0 and chord length is less than minimumRelativeSize*gap, this function will return false.
member.returns: true if start and end points are close enough based on above conditions.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.MakeClosed(System.Double)
member.summary: If IsClosed, just return true. Otherwise, decide if curve can be closed as follows: Linear curves polylinear curves with 2 segments, Nurbs with 3 or less control points cannot be made closed. Also, if tolerance > 0 and the gap between start and end is larger than tolerance, curve cannot be made closed. Adjust the curve's endpoint to match its start point.
member.param: If nonzero, and the gap is more than tolerance, curve cannot be made closed.
member.returns: true on success, false on failure.

member.returns: The orientation of this curve with respect to a defined up direction.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.ClosedCurveOrientation(Rhino.Geometry.Plane)
member.summary: Determines the orientation (counterclockwise or clockwise) of a closed planar curve in a given plane. Only works with simple (no self intersections) closed planar curves.
member.param: The plane in which to solve the orientation.
member.returns: The orientation of this curve in the given plane.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.ClosedCurveOrientation(Rhino.Geometry.Transform)
member.summary: Determines the orientation (counterclockwise or clockwise) of a closed planar curve. Only works with simple (no self intersections) closed planar curves.
member.param: Transformation to map the curve to the xy plane. If the curve is parallel to the xy plane, you may pass Identity matrix.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.ClosestPoint(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,System.Double@)
member.summary: Finds parameter of the point on a curve that is closest to testPoint. If the maximumDistance parameter is > 0, then only points whose distance to the given point is <= maximumDistance will be returned. Using a positive value of maximumDistance can substantially speed up the search.
member.returns: true on success, false on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.ClosestPoint(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,System.Double@,System.Double)
member.summary: Finds the parameter of the point on a curve that is closest to testPoint. If the maximumDistance parameter is > 0, then only points whose distance to the given point is <= maximumDistance will be returned. Using a positive value of maximumDistance can substantially speed up the search.
member.param: parameter of local closest point returned here.

The maximum allowed distance.
Past this distance, the search is given up and false is returned.
Use 0 to turn off this parameter.
member.returns: true on success, false on failure.

Finds the object (and the closest point in that object) that is closest to this curve.

The point on curve. This out parameter is assigned during this call.
The point on geometry. This out parameter is assigned during this call.
The index of the geometry. This out parameter is assigned during this call.
Maximum allowable distance. Past this distance, the research is given up and false is returned.
member.returns: true on success; false if no object was found or selected.
member.exception: If geometry is null.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.GetPerpendicularFrames(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Double})
member.summary: Gets a collection of perpendicular frames along the curve. Perpendicular frames are also known as 'Zero-twisting frames' and they minimize rotation from one frame to the next.
member.param: A collection of strictly increasing curve parameters to place perpendicular frames on.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.IsContinuous(Rhino.Geometry.Continuity,System.Double)
member.summary: Test continuity at a curve parameter value.
member.param: Type of continuity to test for.
member.returns: true if the curve has at least the c type continuity at the parameter t.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.GetNextDiscontinuity(Rhino.Geometry.Continuity,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double@)
member.summary: Searches for a derivative, tangent, or curvature discontinuity.
member.param: Type of continuity to search for.
Search begins at t0. If there is a discontinuity at t0, it will be ignored. This makes it possible to repeatedly call GetNextDiscontinuity() and step through the discontinuities.
(t0 != t1) If there is a discontinuity at t1 it will be ignored unless continuityType is a locus discontinuity type and t1 is at the start or end of the curve.
If a discontinuity is found, then t reports the parameter at the discontinuity.
member.returns:
Parametric continuity tests c = (C0_continuous, ..., G2_continuous): true if a parametric discontinuity was found strictly between t0 and t1. Note well that all curves are parametrically continuous at the ends of their domains.
Locus continuity tests c = (C0_locus_continuous, ...,G2_locus_continuous): true if a locus discontinuity was found strictly between t0 and t1 or at t1 is the at the end of a curve. Note well that all open curves (IsClosed()=false) are locus discontinuous at the ends of their domains. All closed curves (IsClosed()=true) are at least C0_locus_continuous at the ends of their domains.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.Simplify(Rhino.Geometry.CurveSimplifyOptions,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary:
Returns a geometrically equivalent PolyCurve.
The PolyCurve has the following properties
1. All the PolyCurve segments are LineCurve, PolylineCurve, ArcCurve, or NurbsCurve.
2. The Nurbs Curves segments do not have fully multiple interior knots.
3. Rational Nurbs curves do not have constant weights.
4. Any segment for which IsLinear() or IsArc() is true is a Line, Polyline segment, or an Arc.
5. Adjacent Colinear or Cocircular segments are combined.
6. Segments that meet with G1-continuity have there ends tuned up so that they meet with G1-continuity to within machine precision.
member.param: A distance tolerance for the simplification.
An angle tolerance for the simplification.
member.returns: New simplified curve on success, null on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.SimplifyEnd(Rhino.Geometry.CurveEnd,Rhino.Geometry.CurveSimplifyOptions,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Same as SimplifyCurve, but simplifies only the last two segments at "side" end.
member.param: If CurveEnd.Start the function simplifies the last two start side segments, otherwise if CurveEnd.End the last two end side segments are simplified.
A distance tolerance for the simplification.
An angle tolerance for the simplification.
member.returns: New simplified curve on success, null on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.Fair(System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Fairs a curve object. Fair works best on degree 3 (cubic) curves. Attempts to remove large curvature variations while limiting the geometry changes to be no more than the specified tolerance.
member.param: Maximum allowed distance the faired curve is allowed to deviate from the input.
(in radians) kinks with angles <= angleTolerance are smoothed out 0.05 is a good default.

The number of (control vertices-1) to preserve at start.
0 = preserve start point
1 = preserve start point and 1st derivative
2 = preserve start point, 1st and 2nd derivative
The number of iteratoins to use in adjusting the curve.
member.returns: Returns new faired Curve on success, null on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.Fit(System.Int32,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Fits a new curve through an existing curve.
member.param: The degree of the returned Curve. Must be bigger than 1.
The fitting tolerance. If fitTolerance is RhinoMath.UnsetValue or <=0.0, the document absolute tolerance is used.

The kink smoothing tolerance in radians.
If angleTolerance is 0.0, all kinks are smoothed
If angleTolerance is >0.0, kinks smaller than angleTolerance are smoothed
If angleTolerance is RhinoMath.UnsetValue or <0.0, the document angle tolerance is used for the kink smoothing
member.returns: Returns a new fitted Curve if successful, null on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.Rebuild(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Rebuild a curve with a specific point count.
member.param: Number of control points in the rebuild curve.
Degree of curve. Valid values are between and including 1 and 11.
If true, the end tangents of the input curve will be preserved.
member.returns: A Nurbs curve on success or null on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.HasNurbsForm
member.summary: Does a NURBS curve representation of this curve exist?
member.returns: 0 unable to create NURBS representation with desired accuracy. 1 success - NURBS parameterization matches the curve's to the desired accuracy 2 success - NURBS point locus matches the curve's and the domain of the NURBS curve is correct. However, This curve's parameterization and the NURBS curve parameterization may not match. This situation happens when getting NURBS representations of curves that have a transendental parameterization like circles.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.ToNurbsCurve
member.summary: Constructs a NURBS curve representation of this curve.
member.returns: NURBS representation of the curve on success, null on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.ToNurbsCurve(Rhino.Geometry.Interval)
member.summary: Constructs a NURBS curve representation of this curve.
member.param: The NURBS representation for this portion of the curve is returned.
member.returns: NURBS representation of the curve on success, null on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.ToPolyline(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets a polyline approximation of a curve.
member.param: If mainSegmentCount <= 0, then both subSegmentCount and mainSegmentCount are ignored. If mainSegmentCount > 0, then subSegmentCount must be >= 1. In this case the nurb will be broken into mainSegmentCount equally spaced chords. If needed, each of these chords can be split into as many subSegmentCount sub-parts if the subdivision is necessary for the mesh to meet the other meshing constraints. In particular, if subSegmentCount = 0, then the curve is broken into mainSegmentCount pieces and no further testing is performed.
( 0 to pi ) Maximum angle (in radians) between unit tangents at adjacent vertices.
Maximum permitted value of (distance chord midpoint to curve) / (length of chord).

If maxAspectRatio < 1.0, the parameter is ignored. If 1 <= maxAspectRatio < sqrt(2), it is treated as if maxAspectRatio = sqrt(2). This parameter controls the maximum permitted value of (length of longest chord) / (length of shortest chord).
If tolerance = 0, the parameter is ignored. This parameter controls the maximum permitted value of the distance from the curve to the polyline.
If maxEdgeLength = 0, the parameter is ignored. This parameter controls the maximum permitted edge length.
If true the starting point of the curve is added to the polyline. If false the starting point of the curve is not added to the polyline.
member.returns: PolylineCurve on success, null on error.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.ToPolyline(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Boolean,Rhino.Geometry.Interval)
member.summary: Gets a polyline approximation of a curve.
member.param: If mainSegmentCount <= 0, then both subSegmentCount and mainSegmentCount are ignored. If mainSegmentCount > 0, then subSegmentCount must be >= 1. In this case the nurb will be broken into mainSegmentCount equally spaced chords. If needed, each of these chords can be split into as many subSegmentCount sub-parts if the subdivision is necessary for the mesh to meet the other meshing constraints. In particular, if subSegmentCount = 0, then the curve is broken into mainSegmentCount pieces and no further testing is performed.
( 0 to pi ) Maximum angle (in radians) between unit tangents at adjacent vertices.
Maximum permitted value of (distance chord midpoint to curve) / (length of chord).

If maxAspectRatio < 1.0, the parameter is ignored. If 1 <= maxAspectRatio < sqrt(2), it is treated as if maxAspectRatio = sqrt(2). This parameter controls the maximum permitted value of (length of longest chord) / (length of shortest chord).
If tolerance = 0, the parameter is ignored. This parameter controls the maximum permitted value of the distance from the curve to the polyline.
If maxEdgeLength = 0, the parameter is ignored. This parameter controls the maximum permitted edge length.
If true the starting point of the curve is added to the polyline. If false the starting point of the curve is not added to the polyline.
This subdomain of the NURBS curve is approximated.
member.returns: PolylineCurve on success, null on error.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.PullToMesh(Rhino.Geometry.Mesh,System.Double)
member.summary: Makes a polyline approximation of the curve and gets the closest point on the mesh for each point on the curve. Then it "connects the points" so that you have a polyline on the mesh.
member.param: Input tolerance (RhinoDoc.ModelAbsoluteTolerance is a good default)
member.returns: A polyline curve on success, null on failure.

member.summary:
For derived class implementers.
This method is called with argument true when class user calls Dispose(), while with argument false when the Garbage Collector invokes the finalizer, or Finalize() method.
You must reclaim all used unmanaged resources in both cases, and can use this chance to call Dispose on disposable fields if the argument is true.
Also, you must call the base virtual method within your overriding method.
member.param: true if the call comes from the Dispose() method; false if it comes from the Garbage Collector finalizer.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.Extrusion
member.summary: Represents an extrusion, or objects such as beams or linearly extruded elements, that can be represented by profile curves and two miter planes at the extremes.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.Surface
member.summary:
Represents a base class that is common to most RhinoCommon surface types.
A surface represents an entity that can be all visited by providing two independent parameters, usually called (u, v), or sometimes (s, t).

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Surface.CreateRollingBallFillet(Rhino.Geometry.Surface,Rhino.Geometry.Surface,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Constructs a rolling ball fillet between two surfaces.
member.returns: A new array of rolling ball fillet surfaces; this array can be empty on failure.
member.exception: If surfaceA or surfaceB are null.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Surface.CreateRollingBallFillet(Rhino.Geometry.Surface,System.Boolean,Rhino.Geometry.Surface,System.Boolean,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Constructs a rolling ball fillet between two surfaces.
member.param: A value that indicates whether A should be used in flipped mode.
A value that indicates whether B should be used in flipped mode.
member.returns: A new array of rolling ball fillet surfaces; this array can be empty on failure.
member.exception: If surfaceA or surfaceB are null.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Surface.CreateRollingBallFillet(Rhino.Geometry.Surface,Rhino.Geometry.Point2d,Rhino.Geometry.Surface,Rhino.Geometry.Point2d,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Constructs a rolling ball fillet between two surfaces.
member.param: A point in the parameter space of FaceA near where the fillet is expected to hit the surface.
A point in the parameter space of FaceB near where the fillet is expected to hit the surface.
A tolerance value used for approximating and intersecting offset surfaces.
member.returns: A new array of rolling ball fillet surfaces; this array can be empty on failure.
member.exception: If surfaceA or surfaceB are null.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Surface.CreateExtrusion(Rhino.Geometry.Curve,Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d)
member.summary: Constructs a surface by extruding a curve along a vector.
member.returns: A surface on success or null on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Surface.CreateExtrusionToPoint(Rhino.Geometry.Curve,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d)
member.summary: Constructs a surface by extruding a curve to a point.
member.returns: A Surface on success or null on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Surface.CreatePeriodicSurface(Rhino.Geometry.Surface,System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructs a periodic surface from a base surface and a direction.
member.param: 0 is first parameter, 1 is second parameter.
member.returns: A new surface; or null on error.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Surface.#ctor
member.summary: Protected constructor for internal use.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Surface.#ctor(System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo,System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext)
member.summary: Protected constructor for internal use.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Surface.Domain(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the domain in a direction.
member.param: 0 gets first parameter, 1 gets second parameter.
member.returns: An interval value.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Surface.SetDomain(System.Int32,Rhino.Geometry.Interval)
member.summary: Sets the domain in a direction.
member.param: 0 sets first parameter's domain, 1 sets second parameter's domain.
A new domain to be assigned.
member.returns: true if setting succeeded, otherwise false.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Surface.Degree(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the maximum algebraic degree of any span (or a good estimate if curve spans are not algebraic).
member.param: 0 gets first parameter's domain, 1 gets second parameter's domain.
member.returns: The maximum degree.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Surface.GetSurfaceSize(System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary: Gets an estimate of the size of the rectangle that would be created if the 3d surface where flattened into a rectangle.
member.param: corresponds to the first surface parameter.
corresponds to the second surface parameter.
member.returns: true if successful.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Surface.SpanCount(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets number of smooth nonempty spans in the parameter direction.
member.param: 0 gets first parameter's domain, 1 gets second parameter's domain.
member.returns: The span count.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Surface.GetSpanVector(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets array of span "knots".
member.param: 0 gets first parameter's domain, 1 gets second parameter's domain.
member.returns: An array with span vectors; or null on error.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Surface.ClosestSide(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Gets the side that is closest, in terms of 3D-distance, to a U and V parameter.
member.returns: A side.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Surface.Extend(Rhino.Geometry.IsoStatus,System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Extends an untrimmed surface along one edge.
member.param: Edge to extend. Must be North, South, East, or West.
true for smooth (C-infinity) extension. false for a C1- ruled extension.
member.returns: New extended surface on success.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Surface.Rebuild(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Rebuilds an existing surface to a given degree and point count.
member.param: The number of points in the output surface u direction. Must be bigger than uDegree (maximum value is 1000)
The number of points in the output surface v direction. Must be bigger than vDegree (maximum value is 1000)
member.returns: new rebuilt surface on success. null on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Surface.Reverse(System.Int32)
member.summary: Reverses parameterization Domain changes from [a,b] to [-b,-a]
member.param: 0 for first parameter's domain, 1 for second parameter's domain.
member.returns: a new reversed surface on success.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Surface.Reverse(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Same as Reverse, but if inPlace is set to true this Surface is modified instead of a new copy being created.
member.param: 0 for first parameter's domain, 1 for second parameter's domain.
member.returns: If inPlace is False, a new reversed surface on success. If inPlace is true, this surface instance is returned on success.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Surface.Transpose
member.summary: Transposes surface parameterization (swap U and V)
member.returns: New transposed surface on success, null on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Surface.Transpose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Transposes surface parameterization (swap U and V)
member.returns: New transposed surface on success, null on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Surface.PointAt(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Evaluates a point at a given parameter.
member.returns: Point3d.Unset on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Surface.NormalAt(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary:
Computes the surface normal at a point.
This is the simple evaluation call - it does not support error handling.
member.returns: The normal.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Surface.FrameAt(System.Double,System.Double,Rhino.Geometry.Plane@)
member.summary:
Computes the orient plane on a surface given a U and V parameter.
This is the simple evaluation call with no error handling.
member.param: A frame plane that will be computed during this call.
member.returns: true if this operation succeeded; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Surface.CurvatureAt(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Computes the curvature at the given UV coordinate.
member.returns: Surface Curvature data for the point at uv or null on failure.

member.summary: Determines if a 2D curve is iso-parameteric in the parameter space of this surface.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Surface.IsIsoparametric(Rhino.Geometry.Curve)
member.summary: Determines if a 2d curve is iso-parameteric in the parameter space of this surface.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Surface.IsIsoparametric(Rhino.Geometry.BoundingBox)
member.summary: Determines if a 2d bounding box is iso-parameteric in the parameter space of this surface.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Surface.IsClosed(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a value indicating if the surface is closed in a direction.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Surface.IsPeriodic(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a value indicating if thr surface is periodic in a direction (default is false).
member.returns: The indicating boolean value.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Surface.IsSingular(System.Int32)
member.summary: true if surface side is collapsed to a point.
member.param: side of parameter space to test 0 = south, 1 = east, 2 = north, 3 = west.
member.returns: True if this specific side of the surface is singular; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Surface.IsAtSingularity(System.Double,System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Tests if a surface parameter value is at a singularity.
member.param: If true, test if (u,v) is exactly at a singularity. If false, test if close enough to cause numerical problems.
member.returns: true if surface is singular at (s,t)

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Surface.IsAtSeam(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Tests if a surface parameter value is at a seam.
member.returns: 0 if not a seam, 1 if u == Domain(0)[i] and srf(u, v) == srf(Domain(0)[1-i], v) 2 if v == Domain(1)[i] and srf(u, v) == srf(u, Domain(1)[1-i]) 3 if 1 and 2 are true.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Surface.IsContinuous(Rhino.Geometry.Continuity,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Tests continuity at a surface parameter value.
member.returns: true if the surface has at least the specified continuity at the (u,v) parameter.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Surface.GetNextDiscontinuity(System.Int32,Rhino.Geometry.Continuity,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double@)
member.summary: Searches for a derivative, tangent, or curvature discontinuity.
member.param: If 0, then "u" parameter is checked. If 1, then the "v" parameter is checked.
Search begins at t0. If there is a discontinuity at t0, it will be ignored. This makes it possible to repeatedly call GetNextDiscontinuity and step through the discontinuities.
(t0 != t1) If there is a discontinuity at t1 is will be ingored unless c is a locus discontinuity type and t1 is at the start or end of the curve.
if a discontinuity is found, then t reports the parameter at the discontinuity.
member.returns:
Parametric continuity tests c = (C0_continuous, ..., G2_continuous): TRUE if a parametric discontinuity was found strictly between t0 and t1. Note well that all curves are parametrically continuous at the ends of their domains.
Locus continuity tests c = (C0_locus_continuous, ...,G2_locus_continuous): TRUE if a locus discontinuity was found strictly between t0 and t1 or at t1 is the at the end of a curve. Note well that all open curves (IsClosed()=false) are locus discontinuous at the ends of their domains. All closed curves (IsClosed()=true) are at least C0_locus_continuous at the ends of their domains.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Surface.IsoCurve(System.Int32,System.Double)
member.summary: Gets isoparametric curve.
member.param:
0 first parameter varies and second parameter is constant e.g., point on IsoCurve(0,c) at t is srf(t,c) This is a horizontal line from left to right
1 first parameter is constant and second parameter varies e.g., point on IsoCurve(1,c) at t is srf(c,t This is a vertical line from bottom to top.
The parameter that was constant on the original surface.
member.returns: An isoparametric curve or null on error.
member.remarks: In this function "direction" indicates which direction the resulting curve runs. 0: horizontal, 1: vertical In the other Surface functions that take a "direction" argument, "direction" indicates if "constantParameter" is a "u" or "v" parameter.

member.summary: Converts the surface into a Brep.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Surface.HasNurbsForm
member.summary: Is there a NURBS surface representation of this surface.
member.returns: 0 unable to create NURBS representation with desired accuracy. 1 success - NURBS parameterization matches the surface's 2 success - NURBS point locus matches the surface's and the domain of the NURBS surface is correct. However, This surface's parameterization and the NURBS surface parameterization may not match. This situation happens when getting NURBS representations of surfaces that have a transendental parameterization like spheres, cylinders, and cones.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Surface.ToNurbsSurface
member.summary: Gets a NURBS surface representation of this surface. Default tolerance of 0.0 is used.
member.returns: NurbsSurface on success, null on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Surface.ToNurbsSurface(System.Double,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Gets a NURBS surface representation of this surface.
member.param: tolerance to use when creating NURBS representation.

param.name: accuracy
param.para: 0 = unable to create NURBS representation with desired accuracy.
1 = success - returned NURBS parameterization matches the surface's to the desired accuracy.

2 = success - returned NURBS point locus matches the surface's to the desired accuracy and the domain of the NURBS surface is correct. However, this surface's parameterization and the NURBS surface parameterization may not match to the desired accuracy. This situation happens when getting NURBS representations of surfaces that have a transendental parameterization like spheres, cylinders, and cones.

member.returns: NurbsSurface on success, null on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Extrusion.Create(Rhino.Geometry.Curve,System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates an extrusion of a 3d curve (which must be planar) and a height.
member.param: If the height > 0, the bottom of the extrusion will be in plane and the top will be height units above the plane. If the height < 0, the top of the extrusion will be in plane and the bottom will be height units below the plane. The plane used is the one that is returned from the curve's TryGetPlane function.
If the curve is closed and cap is true, then the resulting extrusion is capped.
member.returns: If the input is valid, then a new extrusion is returned. Otherwise null is returned

member.returns: Extrusion on success. null on failure.

If true, the end at cylinder.Height2 will be capped.
member.returns: Extrusion on success. null on failure.

member.returns: A brep with a similar shape like this extrustion, or null on error.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.BezierCurve.Finalize
member.summary: Passively reclaims unmanaged resources when the class user did not explicitly call Dispose().

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.BezierCurve.Dispose
member.summary: Actively reclaims unmanaged resources that this instance uses.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.BezierCurve.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
For derived class implementers.
This method is called with argument true when class user calls Dispose(), while with argument false when the Garbage Collector invokes the finalizer, or Finalize() method.
You must reclaim all used unmanaged resources in both cases, and can use this chance to call Dispose on disposable fields if the argument is true.
Also, you must call the base virtual method within your overriding method.
member.param: true if the call comes from the Dispose() method; false if it comes from the Garbage Collector finalizer.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.BezierCurve.GetBoundingBox(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Boundingbox solver. Gets the world axis aligned boundingbox for the curve.
member.param: If true, a physically accurate boundingbox will be computed. If not, a boundingbox estimate will be computed. For some geometry types there is no difference between the estimate and the accurate boundingbox. Estimated boundingboxes can be computed much (much) faster than accurate (or "tight") bounding boxes. Estimated bounding boxes are always similar to or larger than accurate bounding boxes.
member.returns: The boundingbox of the geometry in world coordinates or BoundingBox.Empty if not bounding box could be found.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.LoftType
member.summary: Specifies enumerated constants for all supported loft types.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.LoftType.Normal
member.summary: Uses chord-length parameterization in the loft direction.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.LoftType.Loose
member.summary: The surface is allowed to move away from the original curves to make a smoother surface. The surface control points are created at the same locations as the control points of the loft input curves.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.LoftType.Tight
member.summary: The surface sticks closely to the original curves. Uses square root of chord-length parameterization in the loft direction.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.LoftType.Straight
member.summary: The sections between the curves are straight. This is also known as a ruled surface.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.LoftType.Developable
member.summary: Constructs a separate developable surface or polysurface from each pair of curves.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.LoftType.Uniform
member.summary: Constructs a uniform loft. The object knot vectors will be uniform.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Brep.CreatePatch(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Rhino.Geometry.GeometryBase},Rhino.Geometry.Surface,System.Double)
member.summary:
Constructs a brep patch.
This is the simple version of fit that uses a specified starting surface.
member.param: Combination of Curves, BrepTrims, Points, PointClouds or Meshes. Curves and trims are sampled to get points. Trims are sampled for points and normals.
Tolerance used by input analysis functions for loop finding, trimming, etc.
member.returns: Brep fit through input on success, or null on error.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Brep.CreatePatch(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Rhino.Geometry.GeometryBase},System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Double)
member.summary:
Constructs a brep patch.
This is the simple version of fit that uses a plane with u x v spans. It makes a plane by fitting to the points from the input geometry to use as the starting surface. The surface has the specified u and v span count.
member.param: A combination of curves, brep trims, points, point clouds or meshes. Curves and trims are sampled to get points. Trims are sampled for points and normals.
The number of spans in the U direction.
The number of spans in the V direction.
Tolerance used by input analysis functions for loop finding, trimming, etc.
member.returns: A brep fit through input on success, or null on error.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Brep.CreatePatch(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Rhino.Geometry.GeometryBase},Rhino.Geometry.Surface,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Boolean[],System.Double)
member.summary: Constructs a brep patch using all controls
member.param: A combination of curves, brep trims, points, point clouds or meshes. Curves and trims are sampled to get points. Trims are sampled for points and normals.
Number of surface spans used when a plane is fit through points to start in the U direction.
Number of surface spans used when a plane is fit through points to start in the U direction.
If true, try to find an outer loop from among the input curves and trim the result to that loop
If true, try to find brep trims in the outer loop of curves and try to fit to the normal direction of the trim's surface at those locations.
Basic distance between points sampled from input curves.

Determines the behavior of the surface in areas where its not otherwise controlled by the input. Lower numbers make the surface behave more like a stiff material; higher, less like a stiff material. That is, each span is made to more closely match the spans adjacent to it if there is no input geometry mapping to that area of the surface when the flexibility value is low. The scale is logrithmic. Numbers around 0.001 or 0.1 make the patch pretty stiff and numbers around 10 or 100 make the surface flexible.
Tends to keep the result surface where it was before the fit in areas where there is on influence from the input geometry
Array of four elements. Flags to keep the edges of a starting (untrimmed) surface in place while fitting the interior of the surface. Order of flags is left, bottom, right, top
Tolerance used by input analysis functions for loop finding, trimming, etc.
member.returns: A brep fit through input on success, or null on error.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Brep.CreatePipe(Rhino.Geometry.Curve,System.Double,System.Boolean,Rhino.Geometry.PipeCapMode,System.Boolean,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Creates a single walled pipe
member.param: the path curve for the pipe

If True, Local (pipe radius stays constant at the ends and changes more rapidly in the middle) is applied. If False, Global (radius is linearly blended from one end to the other, creating pipes that taper from one radius to the other) is applied
If the curve is a polycurve of lines and arcs, the curve is fit and a single surface is created; otherwise the result is a polysurface with joined surfaces created from the polycurve segments.
The sweeping and fitting tolerance. If you are unsure what to use, then use the document's absolute tolerance
The angle tolerance. If you are unsure what to use, then either use the document's angle tolerance in radians
member.returns: Array of created pipes on success

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Brep.CreatePipe(Rhino.Geometry.Curve,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Double},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Double},System.Boolean,Rhino.Geometry.PipeCapMode,System.Boolean,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Creates a single walled pipe
member.param: the path curve for the pipe
one or more normalized curve parameters where changes in radius occur. Important: curve parameters must be normalized - ranging between 0.0 and 1.0.
An array of radii - one at each normalized curve parameter in railRadiiParameters.

If True, Local (pipe radius stays constant at the ends and changes more rapidly in the middle) is applied. If False, Global (radius is linearly blended from one end to the other, creating pipes that taper from one radius to the other) is applied
If the curve is a polycurve of lines and arcs, the curve is fit and a single surface is created; otherwise the result is a polysurface with joined surfaces created from the polycurve segments.
The sweeping and fitting tolerance. If you are unsure what to use, then use the document's absolute tolerance
The angle tolerance. If you are unsure what to use, then either use the document's angle tolerance in radians
member.returns: Array of created pipes on success

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Brep.CreateFromLoft(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Rhino.Geometry.Curve},Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,Rhino.Geometry.LoftType,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Constructs one or more Breps by lofting through a set of curves.
member.param: The curves to loft through. This function will not perform any curve sorting. You must pass in curves in the order you want them lofted. This function will not adjust the directions of open curves. Use Curve.DoDirectionsMatch and Curve.Reverse to adjust the directions of open curves. This function will not adjust the seams of closed curves. Use Curve.ChangeClosedCurveSeam to adjust the seam of closed curves.
Optional starting point of loft. Use Point3d.Unset if you do not want to include a start point.
Optional ending point of loft. Use Point3d.Unset if you do not want to include an end point.
true if the last curve in this loft should be connected back to the first one.
member.returns: Constructs a closed surface, continuing the surface past the last curve around to the first curve. Available when you have selected three shape curves.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Brep.CreateFromLoftRebuild(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Rhino.Geometry.Curve},Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,Rhino.Geometry.LoftType,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructs one or more Breps by lofting through a set of curves. Input for the loft is simplified by rebuilding to a specified number of control points.
member.param: The curves to loft through. This function will not perform any curve sorting. You must pass in curves in the order you want them lofted. This function will not adjust the directions of open curves. Use Curve.DoDirectionsMatch and Curve.Reverse to adjust the directions of open curves. This function will not adjust the seams of closed curves. Use Curve.ChangeClosedCurveSeam to adjust the seam of closed curves.
Optional starting point of loft. Use Point3d.Unset if you do not want to include a start point.
Optional ending point of lost. Use Point3d.Unset if you do not want to include an end point.
true if the last curve in this loft should be connected back to the first one.
A number of points to use while rebuilding the curves. 0 leaves turns this parameter off.
member.returns: Constructs a closed surface, continuing the surface past the last curve around to the first curve. Available when you have selected three shape curves.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Brep.CreateFromLoftRefit(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Rhino.Geometry.Curve},Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,Rhino.Geometry.LoftType,System.Boolean,System.Double)
member.summary: Constructs one or more Breps by lofting through a set of curves. Input for the loft is simplified by refitting to a specified tolerance.
member.param: The curves to loft through. This function will not perform any curve sorting. You must pass in curves in the order you want them lofted. This function will not adjust the directions of open curves. Use Curve.DoDirectionsMatch and Curve.Reverse to adjust the directions of open curves. This function will not adjust the seams of closed curves. Use Curve.ChangeClosedCurveSeam to adjust the seam of closed curves.
Optional starting point of loft. Use Point3d.Unset if you do not want to include a start point.
Optional ending point of lost. Use Point3d.Unset if you do not want to include an end point.
true if the last curve in this loft should be connected back to the first one.
A distance to use in refitting, or 0 if you want to turn this parameter off.
member.returns: Constructs a closed surface, continuing the surface past the last curve around to the first curve. Available when you have selected three shape curves.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Brep.ClosestPoint(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d@,Rhino.Geometry.ComponentIndex@,System.Double@,System.Double@,System.Double,Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d@)
member.summary: Finds a point on a brep that is closest to testPoint.
member.param: base point to project to surface.
location of the closest brep point.
Component index of the brep component that contains the closest point. Possible types are brep_face, brep_edge or brep_vertex.
If the ci type is brep_edge, then s is the parameter of the closest edge point.
If the ci type is brep_face, then (s,t) is the parameter of the closest edge point.
If maximumDistance > 0, then only points whose distance is <= maximumDistance will be returned. Using a positive value of maximumDistance can substantially speed up the search.
The normal to the face if ci is a brep_face and the tangent to the edge if ci is brep_edge.
member.returns: true if the operation succeeded; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Brep.IsPointInside(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Determines if point is inside Brep. This question only makes sense when the brep is a closed manifold. This function does not not check for closed or manifold, so result is not valid in those cases. Intersects a line through point with brep, finds the intersection point Q closest to point, and looks at face normal at Q. If the point Q is on an edge or the intersection is not transverse at Q, then another line is used.
member.param: 3d distance tolerance used for intersection and determining strict inclusion. A good default is RhinoMath.SqrtEpsilon.
if true, point is in if inside brep by at least tolerance. if false, point is in if truly in or within tolerance of boundary.
member.returns: true if point is in, false if not.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Brep.Join(Rhino.Geometry.Brep,System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: If any edges of this brep overlap edges of otherBrep, merge a copy of otherBrep into this brep joining all edges that overlap within tolerance.
member.param: Brep to be added to this brep.
3d distance tolerance for detecting overlapping edges.
if true, set brep flags and tolerances, remove unused faces and edges.
member.returns: true if any edges were joined.
member.remarks: if no edges overlap, this brep is unchanged. otherBrep is copied if it is merged with this, and otherBrep is always unchanged Use this to join a list of breps in a series. When joining multiple breps in series, compact should be set to false. Call compact on the last Join.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Brep.Trim(Rhino.Geometry.Brep,System.Double)
member.summary: Trims a brep with an oriented cutter. The parts of the brep that lie inside (opposite the normal) of the cutter are retained while the parts to the outside (in the direction of the normal) are discarded. If the Cutter is closed, then a connected component of the Brep that does not intersect the cutter is kept if and only if it is contained in the inside of cutter. That is the region bounded by cutter opposite from the normal of cutter, If cutter is not closed all these components are kept.
member.param: A tolerance value with which to compute intersections.
member.returns: This Brep is not modified, the trim results are returned in an array.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Brep.Trim(Rhino.Geometry.Plane,System.Double)
member.summary: Trims a Brep with an oriented cutter. The parts of Brep that lie inside (opposite the normal) of the cutter are retained while the parts to the outside ( in the direction of the normal ) are discarded. A connected component of Brep that does not intersect the cutter is kept if and only if it is contained in the inside of Cutter. That is the region bounded by cutter opposite from the normal of cutter, or in the case of a Plane cutter the halfspace opposite from the plane normal.
member.param: A tolerance value with which to compute intersections.
member.returns: This Brep is not modified, the trim results are returned in an array.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Brep.IsSurface
member.summary:
Returns true if the Brep has a single face and that face is geometrically the same as the underlying surface. I.e., the face has trivial trimming.
In this case, the surface is the first face surface. The flag Brep.Faces[0].OrientationIsReversed records the correspondence between the surface's natural parametric orientation and the orientation of the Brep.
trivial trimming here means that there is only one loop curve in the brep and that loop curve is the same as the underlying surface boundary.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.BrepTrimType
member.summary: Each brep trim has a defined type.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.BrepTrimType.Unknown
member.summary: Unknown type

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.BrepTrimType.Boundary
member.summary: Trim is connected to an edge, is part of an outer, inner or slit loop, and is the only trim connected to the edge.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.BrepTrimType.Mated
member.summary: Trim is connected to an edge, is part of an outer, inner or slit loop, no other trim from the same loop is connected to the edge, and at least one trim from a different loop is connected to the edge.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.BrepTrimType.Seam
member.summary: trim is connected to an edge, is part of an outer, inner or slit loop, and one other trim from the same loop is connected to the edge. (There can be other mated trims that are also connected to the edge. For example, the non-mainfold edge that results when a surface edge lies in the middle of another surface.) Non-mainfold "cuts" have seam trims too.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.BrepTrimType.Singular
member.summary: Trim is part of an outer loop, the trim's 2d curve runs along the singular side of a surface, and the trim is NOT connected to an edge. (There is no 3d edge because the surface side is singular.)

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.BrepTrimType.CurveOnSurface
member.summary: Trim is connected to an edge, is the only trim in a crfonsrf loop, and is the only trim connected to the edge.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.BrepTrimType.PointOnSurface
member.summary: Trim is a point on a surface, trim.m_pbox is records surface parameters, and is the only trim in a ptonsrf loop. This trim is not connected to an edge and has no 2d curve.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.BrepTrim
member.summary: Brep trim information is stored in BrepTrim classes. Brep.Trims is an array of all the trims in the brep. A BrepTrim is derived from CurveProxy so the trim can supply easy to use evaluation tools via the Curve virtual member functions. Note well that the domains and orientations of the curve m_C2[trim.m_c2i] and the trim as a curve may not agree.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.BrepTrim.IsReversed
member.summary: Get orientation of trim with respect to it's corresponding edge.
member.returns: true if the 2d trim and 3d edge have opposite orientations

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.BrepTrim.GetTrimParameter(System.Double,System.Double@)
member.summary: Get corresponding trim parameter at given edge parameter.
member.returns: true on success

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.BrepTrim.GetTolerances(System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary: The values in tolerance[] record the accuracy of the parameter space trimming curves.

remarks.para: tolerance[0] = accuracy of parameter space curve in first ("u") parameter
tolerance[1] = accuracy of parameter space curve in second ("v") parameter

A value of RhinoMath.UnsetValue indicates that the tolerance should be computed. If the value >= 0.0, then the tolerance is set. If the value is RhinoMath.UnsetValue, then the tolerance needs to be computed.

If the trim is not singular, then the trim must have an edge. If P is a 3d point on the edge's curve and surface(u,v) = Q is the point on the surface that is closest to P, then there must be a parameter t in the interval [m_t[0], m_t[1]] such that |u - curve2d(t)[0]| <= tolerance[0] and |v - curve2d(t)[1]| <= tolerance[1]
If P is the 3d point for the vertex brep.m_V[m_vi[k]] and (uk,vk) is the corresponding end of the trim's parameter space curve, then there must be a surface parameter (u,v) such that:

item.description: the distance from the 3d point surface(u,v) to P is <= brep.m_V[m_vi[k]].m_tolerance,

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.BrepTrim.SetTolerances(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: The values in tolerance[] record the accuracy of the parameter space trimming curves.

remarks.para: tolerance[0] = accuracy of parameter space curve in first ("u") parameter
tolerance[1] = accuracy of parameter space curve in second ("v") parameter

A value of RhinoMath.UnsetValue indicates that the tolerance should be computed. If the value >= 0.0, then the tolerance is set. If the value is RhinoMath.UnsetValue, then the tolerance needs to be computed.

If the trim is not singular, then the trim must have an edge. If P is a 3d point on the edge's curve and surface(u,v) = Q is the point on the surface that is closest to P, then there must be a parameter t in the interval [m_t[0], m_t[1]] such that |u - curve2d(t)[0]| <= tolerance[0] and |v - curve2d(t)[1]| <= tolerance[1]
If P is the 3d point for the vertex brep.m_V[m_vi[k]] and (uk,vk) is the corresponding end of the trim's parameter space curve, then there must be a surface parameter (u,v) such that:

item.description: the distance from the 3d point surface(u,v) to P is <= brep.m_V[m_vi[k]].m_tolerance,

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.BrepFace.TrimAwareIsoIntervals(System.Int32,System.Double)
member.summary: Gets intervals where the iso curve exists on a BrepFace (trimmed surface)
member.param:
Direction of isocurve.
0 = Isocurve connects all points with a constant U value.
1 = Isocurve connects all points with a constant V value.
Surface parameter that remains identical along the isocurves.
member.returns: If direction = 0, the parameter space iso interval connects the 2d points (intervals[i][0],iso_constant) and (intervals[i][1],iso_constant). If direction = 1, the parameter space iso interval connects the 2d points (iso_constant,intervals[i][0]) and (iso_constant,intervals[i][1]).

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.BrepFace.TrimAwareIsoCurve(System.Int32,System.Double)
member.summary: Similar to IsoCurve function, except this function pays attention to trims on faces and may return multiple curves.
member.param:
Direction of isocurve.
0 = Isocurve connects all points with a constant U value.
1 = Isocurve connects all points with a constant V value.
Surface parameter that remains identical along the isocurves.
member.returns: Isoparametric curves connecting all points with the constantParameter value.
member.remarks: In this function "direction" indicates which direction the resulting curve runs. 0: horizontal, 1: vertical In the other Surface functions that take a "direction" argument, "direction" indicates if "constantParameter" is a "u" or "v" parameter.

member.summary: Expert user tool that replaces the 3d surface geometry use by the face.
member.param: brep surface index of new surface.

member.remarks: If the face had a surface and new surface has a different shape, then you probably want to call something like RebuildEdges() to move the 3d edge curves so they will lie on the new surface. This doesn't delete the old surface; call Brep.CullUnusedSurfaces() or Brep.Compact() to remove unused surfaces.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Collections.BrepFaceList.Add(System.Int32)
member.summary: Create and add a new face to this list. An incomplete face is added. The caller must create and fill in the loops used by the face.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Collections.BrepFaceList.Add(Rhino.Geometry.Surface)
member.summary: Add a new face to a brep. This creates a complete face with new vertices at the surface corners, new edges along the surface boundary, etc. The loop of the returned face has four trims that correspond to the south, east, north, and west side of the surface in that order. If you use this version of Add to add an exiting brep, then you are responsible for using a tool like JoinEdges() to hook the new face to its neighbors.

member.param: The south side of the face's surface will run along edgeA.
true if the new face's outer boundary orientation along edgeA is opposite the orientation of edgeA.
The north side of the face's surface will run along edgeA
true if the new face's outer boundary orientation along edgeB is opposite the orientation of edgeB

member.param: The apex of the cone will be at this vertex. The north side of the surface's parameter space will be a singular point at the vertex.
The south side of the face's surface will run along this edge.
true if the new face's outer boundary orientation along the edge is opposite the orientation of edge.

member.summary: Create a new boundary loop on a face. After you get this BrepLoop, you still need to create the vertices, edges, and trims that define the loop.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Collections.BrepLoopList.AddOuterLoop(System.Int32)
member.summary: Create a new outer boundary loop that runs along the sides of the face's surface. All the necessary trims, edges, and vertices are created and added to the brep.
member.param: index of face that needs an outer boundary that runs along the sides of its surface.
member.returns: New outer boundary loop that is complete.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Collections.BrepLoopList.AddPlanarFaceLoop(System.Int32,Rhino.Geometry.BrepLoopType,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Rhino.Geometry.Curve})
member.summary: Add a planar trimming loop to a planar face
member.param: index of planar face. The underlying suface must be a PlaneSurface

type of loop to add. If loopType is Unknown, then the loop direction is tested and the the new loops type will be set to Outer or Inner. If the loopType is Outer, then the direction of the new loop is tested and flipped if it is clockwise. If the loopType is Inner, then the direction of the new loop is tested and flipped if it is counter-clockwise.
list of 3d curves that form a simple (no self intersections) closed curve. These curves define the 3d edge geometry and should be near the planar surface.
member.returns: new loop if successful

member.name: T:Rhino.FileIO.File3dm
member.summary:
Represents a 3dm file, which is stored using the OpenNURBS file standard.
The 3dm format is the main Rhinoceros storage format.
Visit http://www.opennurbs.com/ for more details.

member.name: M:Rhino.FileIO.File3dm.Read(System.String)
member.summary: Reads a 3dm file from a specified location.
member.returns: new File3dm on success, null on error.
member.exception: If path does not exist.

member.name: M:Rhino.FileIO.File3dm.Read(System.String,Rhino.FileIO.File3dm.TableTypeFilter,Rhino.FileIO.File3dm.ObjectTypeFilter)
member.summary: Reads a 3dm file from a specified location.
member.param: If tableTypeFilterFilter is None, then everything in the archive is read. Otherwise tableTypeFilterFilter identifies what tables should be read.
If objectTypeFilter is not None, then is a filter made by bitwise oring values to select which types of objects will be read from the model object table.
member.returns: new File3dm on success, null on error.
member.exception: If path does not exist.

member.name: M:Rhino.FileIO.File3dm.ReadWithLog(System.String,Rhino.FileIO.File3dm.TableTypeFilter,Rhino.FileIO.File3dm.ObjectTypeFilter,System.String@)
member.summary: Reads a 3dm file from a specified location.
member.param: If tableTypeFilterFilter is None, then everything in the archive is read. Otherwise tableTypeFilterFilter identifies what tables should be read.
If objectTypeFilter is not None, then is a filter made by bitwise oring values to select which types of objects will be read from the model object table.
Any archive reading errors are logged here.
member.returns: new File3dm on success, null on error.
member.exception: If path does not exist.

member.name: M:Rhino.FileIO.File3dm.ReadWithLog(System.String,System.String@)
member.summary: Read a 3dm file from a specified location and log any archive reading errors.
member.param: Any archive reading errors are logged here.
member.returns: New File3dm on success, null on error.
member.exception: If path does not exist.

member.summary: Reads only the notes from an existing 3dm file.
member.param: The file from which to read the notes.
member.returns: The 3dm file notes.
member.exception: If path does not exist, is null or cannot be accessed because of permissions.

member.name: M:Rhino.FileIO.File3dm.ReadArchiveVersion(System.String)
member.summary: Reads only the archive 3dm version from an existing 3dm file.
member.param: The file from which to read the archive version.
member.returns: The 3dm file archive version.
member.exception: If path does not exist, is null or cannot be accessed because of permissions.

member.param: last person to edit the file
which revision this file is at
date file was created (DateTime.MinValue if not set in file)
date file was last edited (DateTime.MinValue if not set in file)

member.name: M:Rhino.FileIO.File3dm.Write(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes contents of this model to an openNURBS archive. I STRONGLY suggested that you call Polish() before calling Write so that your file has all the "fluff" that makes it complete. If the model is not valid, then Write will refuse to write it.
member.param: The file name to use for writing.

Version of the openNURBS archive to write. Must be 2, 3, 4, or 5. Rhino 2.x can read version 2 files. Rhino 3.x can read version 2 and 3 files. Rhino 4.x can read version 2, 3 and 4 files. Rhino 5.x can read version 2, 3, 4, and 5 files. Use version 5 when possible.
member.returns: true if archive is written with no error. false if errors occur.

member.name: M:Rhino.FileIO.File3dm.Write(System.String,Rhino.FileIO.File3dmWriteOptions)
member.summary: Writes contents of this model to an openNURBS archive. I STRONGLY suggested that you call Polish() before calling Write so that your file has all the "fluff" that makes it complete. If the model is not valid, then Write will refuse to write it.
member.param: The file name to use for writing.
member.returns: true if archive is written with no error. false if errors occur.

member.name: M:Rhino.FileIO.File3dm.WriteWithLog(System.String,System.Int32,System.String@)
member.summary: Writes contents of this model to an openNURBS archive. I STRONGLY suggested that you call Polish() before calling Write so that your file has all the "fluff" that makes it complete. If the model is not valid, then Write will refuse to write it.
member.param: Version of the openNURBS archive to write. Must be 2, 3, 4, or 5. Rhino 2.x can read version 2 files. Rhino 3.x can read version 2 and 3 files. Rhino 4.x can read version 2, 3 and 4 files. Rhino 5.x can read version 2, 3, 4, and 5 files. Use version 5 when possible.
. This argument will be filled by out reference.
member.returns: true if archive is written with no error. false if errors occur.

member.name: M:Rhino.FileIO.File3dm.IsValid(System.String@)
member.summary: Checks a model to make sure it is valid.
member.param: if errors are found, a description of the problem is put in this variable.
member.returns: true if the model is valid.

member.name: M:Rhino.FileIO.File3dm.IsValid(Rhino.FileIO.TextLog)
member.summary: Checks a model to make sure it is valid.
member.param: if errors are found, a description of the problem is put in this variable.
member.returns: true if the model is valid.

member.name: M:Rhino.FileIO.File3dm.Polish
member.summary: Quickly fills in the little details, like making sure there is at least one layer and table indices make sense. For a full blown check and repair, call Audit(true).

member.name: M:Rhino.FileIO.File3dm.Audit(System.Boolean,System.Int32@,System.String@,System.Int32[]@)
member.summary: Check a model to make sure it is valid and, if possible and requested, attempt to repair.
member.param: if true and a problem is found, the problem is repaired.
if errors are found, a description of the problem is put in this.

If problems were found, warning ids are appended to this list. 1 (MaterialTable flaws), 2 (LayerTable is not perfect), 3 (some ObjectTable.Attributes.Id was nil or not unique), 4 (ObjectTable.IsValid() is false), 5 (some IDefTable entry has an invalid or duplicate name), 6 (some IDefTable.ObjectId is not valid), 7 (some ObjectTable.Geometry is null), 8 (some ObjectTable.Geometry.IsValid is false), 9 (some ObjectTable.Attributes is not valid), 10 (LinetypeTable is not perfect), 11 (LinetypeTable is not perfect), 12 (some IDefTable.Id was Empty or not unique), 13 (some TextureMappingTable.MappingId was Empty or not unique), 14 (some MaterialTable.Id was Empty or not unique), 15 (some LightTable.LightId was Empty or not unique)
member.returns: <0 (model has serious errors), 0 (model is ok), >0 (number of problems that were found)

member.summary: Actively reclaims unmanaged resources that this instance uses.

member.name: M:Rhino.FileIO.File3dm.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
For derived class implementers.
This method is called with argument true when class user calls Dispose(), while with argument false when the Garbage Collector invokes the finalizer, or Finalize() method.
You must reclaim all used unmanaged resources in both cases, and can use this chance to call Dispose on disposable fields if the argument is true.
Also, you must call the base virtual method within your overriding method.
member.param: true if the call comes from the Dispose() method; false if it comes from the Garbage Collector finalizer.
