member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.Hatch
member.summary: Represents a hatch in planar boundary loop or loops. This is a 2d entity with a plane defining a local coordinate system. The loops, patterns, angles, etc are all in this local coordinate system. The Hatch object manages the plane and loop array Fill definitions are in the HatchPattern or class derived from HatchPattern Hatch has an index to get the pattern definition from the pattern table.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.Intersect.Intersection
member.summary: Provides static methods for the computation of intersections, projections, sections and similar.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Intersect.Intersection.LineLine(Rhino.Geometry.Line,Rhino.Geometry.Line,System.Double@,System.Double@,System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Intersects two lines.
member.param: Parameter on lineA that is closest to LineB. The shortest distance between the lines is the chord from lineA.PointAt(a) to lineB.PointAt(b)
Parameter on lineB that is closest to LineA. The shortest distance between the lines is the chord from lineA.PointAt(a) to lineB.PointAt(b)
If tolerance > 0.0, then an intersection is reported only if the distance between the points is <= tolerance. If tolerance <= 0.0, then the closest point between the lines is reported.
If true, the input lines are treated as finite segments. If false, the input lines are treated as infinite lines.
member.returns: true if a closest point can be calculated and the result passes the tolerance parameter test; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Intersect.Intersection.LineLine(Rhino.Geometry.Line,Rhino.Geometry.Line,System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary: Finds the closest point between two infinite lines.
member.param: Parameter on lineA that is closest to lineB. The shortest distance between the lines is the chord from lineA.PointAt(a) to lineB.PointAt(b)
Parameter on lineB that is closest to lineA. The shortest distance between the lines is the chord from lineA.PointAt(a) to lineB.PointAt(b)
member.returns:
true if points are found and false if the lines are numerically parallel. Numerically parallel means the 2x2 matrix:
+AoA -AoB
-AoB +BoB is numerically singular, where A = (lineA.To - lineA.From) and B = (lineB.To-lineB.From)

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Intersect.Intersection.LinePlane(Rhino.Geometry.Line,Rhino.Geometry.Plane,System.Double@)
member.summary: Intersects a line and a plane. This function only returns true if the intersection result is a single point (i.e. if the line is coincident with the plane then no intersection is assumed).
member.param: Parameter on line where intersection occurs. If the parameter is not within the {0, 1} Interval then the finite segment does not intersect the plane.
member.returns: true on success, false on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Intersect.Intersection.PlanePlane(Rhino.Geometry.Plane,Rhino.Geometry.Plane,Rhino.Geometry.Line@)
member.summary: Intersects two planes and return the intersection line. If the planes are parallel or coincident, no intersection is assumed.
member.param: If this function returns true, the intersectionLine parameter will return the line where the planes intersect.
member.returns: true on success, false on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Intersect.Intersection.PlanePlanePlane(Rhino.Geometry.Plane,Rhino.Geometry.Plane,Rhino.Geometry.Plane,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d@)
member.summary: Intersects three planes to find the single point they all share.
member.param: Point where all three planes converge.
member.returns: true on success, false on failure. If at least two out of the three planes are parallel or coincident, failure is assumed.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Intersect.Intersection.PlaneCircle(Rhino.Geometry.Plane,Rhino.Geometry.Circle,System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary: Intersects a plane with a circle using exact calculations.
member.param: First intersection parameter on circle if successful or RhinoMath.UnsetValue if not.
Second intersection parameter on circle if successful or RhinoMath.UnsetValue if not.
member.returns: The type of intersection that occured.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Intersect.Intersection.PlaneSphere(Rhino.Geometry.Plane,Rhino.Geometry.Sphere,Rhino.Geometry.Circle@)
member.summary: Intersects a plane with a sphere using exact calculations.
member.returns: If is returned, the intersectionCircle has a radius of zero and the center point is the point on the plane closest to the sphere.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Intersect.Intersection.LineCircle(Rhino.Geometry.Line,Rhino.Geometry.Circle,System.Double@,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d@,System.Double@,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d@)
member.summary: Intersects a line with a circle using exact calculations.
member.param: Parameter on line for first intersection.
Point on circle closest to first intersection.
Parameter on line for second intersection.
Point on circle closest to second intersection.
member.returns: If is returned, only t1 and point1 will have valid values. If is returned, t2 and point2 will also be filled out.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Intersect.Intersection.LineSphere(Rhino.Geometry.Line,Rhino.Geometry.Sphere,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d@,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d@)
member.summary: Intersects a line with a sphere using exact calculations.
member.returns: If is returned, the first point is the point on the line closest to the sphere and the second point is the point on the sphere closest to the line. If is returned, the first point is the point on the line and the second point is the same point on the sphere.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Intersect.Intersection.LineCylinder(Rhino.Geometry.Line,Rhino.Geometry.Cylinder,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d@,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d@)
member.summary: Intersects a line with a cylinder using exact calculations.
member.returns:
If None is returned, the first point is the point on the line closest to the cylinder and the second point is the point on the cylinder closest to the line.
If is returned, the first point is the point on the line and the second point is the same point on the cylinder.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Intersect.Intersection.SphereSphere(Rhino.Geometry.Sphere,Rhino.Geometry.Sphere,Rhino.Geometry.Circle@)
member.summary: Intersects two spheres using exact calculations.
member.param: If intersection is a point, then that point will be the center, radius 0.
member.returns: The intersection type.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Intersect.Intersection.LineBox(Rhino.Geometry.Line,Rhino.Geometry.BoundingBox,System.Double,Rhino.Geometry.Interval@)
member.summary: Intersects an infinite line and an axis aligned bounding box.
member.param: If tolerance > 0.0, then the intersection is performed against a box that has each side moved out by tolerance.
The chord from line.PointAt(lineParameters.T0) to line.PointAt(lineParameters.T1) is the intersection.
member.returns: true if the line intersects the box, false if no intersection occurs.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Intersect.Intersection.LineBox(Rhino.Geometry.Line,Rhino.Geometry.Box,System.Double,Rhino.Geometry.Interval@)
member.summary: Intersects an infinite line with a box volume.
member.param: If tolerance > 0.0, then the intersection is performed against a box that has each side moved out by tolerance.
The chord from line.PointAt(lineParameters.T0) to line.PointAt(lineParameters.T1) is the intersection.
member.returns: true if the line intersects the box, false if no intersection occurs.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.Intersect.PlaneCircleIntersection.Coincident
member.summary: Circle and plane are co-planar, they intersect everywhere.

member.summary: All curve intersection events are either a single point or an overlap.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Intersect.IntersectionEvent.PointA
member.summary: Gets the point on Curve A where the intersection occured. If the intersection type is overlap, then this will return the start of the overlap region.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Intersect.IntersectionEvent.PointA2
member.summary: Gets the end point of the overlap on Curve A. If the intersection type is not overlap, this value is meaningless.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Intersect.IntersectionEvent.PointB
member.summary: Gets the point on Curve B (or Surface B) where the intersection occured. If the intersection type is overlap, then this will return the start of the overlap region.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Intersect.IntersectionEvent.PointB2
member.summary: Gets the end point of the overlap on Curve B (or Surface B). If the intersection type is not overlap, this value is meaningless.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Intersect.IntersectionEvent.ParameterB

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Intersect.IntersectionEvent.OverlapA
member.summary: Gets the interval on curve A where the overlap occurs. If the intersection type is not overlap, this value is meaningless.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Intersect.IntersectionEvent.OverlapB
member.summary: Gets the interval on curve B where the overlap occurs. If the intersection type is not overlap, this value is meaningless.

member.summary: Actively reclaims unmanaged resources that this instance uses.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Intersect.CurveIntersections.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
For derived class implementers.
This method is called with argument true when class user calls Dispose(), while with argument false when the Garbage Collector invokes the finalizer, or Finalize() method.
You must reclaim all used unmanaged resources in both cases, and can use this chance to call Dispose on disposable fields if the argument is true.
Also, you must call the base virtual method within your overriding method.
member.param: true if the call comes from the Dispose() method; false if it comes from the Garbage Collector finalizer.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Intersect.CurveIntersections.CopyTo(Rhino.Geometry.Intersect.IntersectionEvent[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Copies all intersection results into another array, departing at an index in the target array.
member.param: The target array. This value cannot be null.
Zero-based index in which to start the copy.
member.exception: If array is null.
If arrayIndex is less than 0.

If array is multi-dimensional; or if arrayIndex is larger than or equal to the length of this collection; or this collection contains more IntersectionEvents than the ones that can be stored in array after and including arrayIndex.

member.summary: Constructs a light which simulates the Sun based on a given time and location on Earth.
member.param: The angle of North in degrees. North is the angle between positive World Y axis and model North, as measured on World XY plane.

The time of the measurement. The Kind property of DateTime specifies whether this is in local or universal time.
Local and Undefined daytime kinds in this argument are considered local.
The latitude, in degrees, of the location on Earth.
The longitude, in degrees, of the location on Earth.
member.returns: A newly constructed light object.
member.exception: If the RDK is not loaded.

member.summary:

attenuation = 1/(a0 + d*a1 + d^2*a2) where d = distance to light.
member.param: The new constant attenuation divisor term.
The new reverse linear attenuation divisor term.
The new reverse quadratic attenuation divisor term.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Light.SpotExponent
member.summary: The spot exponent varies from 0.0 to 128.0 and provides an exponential interface for controling the focus or concentration of a spotlight (like the OpenGL GL_SPOT_EXPONENT parameter). The spot exponent and hot spot parameters are linked; changing one will change the other. A hot spot setting of 0.0 corresponds to a spot exponent of 128. A hot spot setting of 1.0 corresponds to a spot exponent of 0.0.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Light.HotSpot
member.summary: The hot spot setting runs from 0.0 to 1.0 and is used to provides a linear interface for controling the focus or concentration of a spotlight. A hot spot setting of 0.0 corresponds to a spot exponent of 128. A hot spot setting of 1.0 corresponds to a spot exponent of 0.0.

For derived class implementers.
This method is called with argument true when class user calls Dispose(), while with argument false when the Garbage Collector invokes the finalizer, or Finalize() method.
You must reclaim all used unmanaged resources in both cases, and can use this chance to call Dispose on disposable fields if the argument is true.

member.summary: Computes the Area properties for a collection of geometric objects. At present only Breps, Surfaces, Meshes and Planar Closed Curves are supported.
member.param: Objects to include in the area computation.
member.returns: The Area properties for the entire collection or null on failure.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.AreaMassProperties.Area
member.summary: Gets the area solution.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.AreaMassProperties.AreaError
member.summary: Gets the uncertainty in the area calculation.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.AreaMassProperties.Centroid
member.summary: Gets the area centroid in the world coordinate system.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.AreaMassProperties.CentroidError
member.summary: Gets the uncertainty in the centroid calculation.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.AreaMassProperties.WorldCoordinatesFirstMoments
member.summary: Returns the world coordinate first moments if they were able to be calculated. X is integral of "x dm" over the area Y is integral of "y dm" over the area Z is integral of "z dm" over the area.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.AreaMassProperties.WorldCoordinatesFirstMomentsError
member.summary: Uncertainty in world coordinates first moments calculation.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.AreaMassProperties.WorldCoordinatesSecondMoments
member.summary: Returns the world coordinate first moments if they were able to be calculated. X is integral of "xx dm" over the area Y is integral of "yy dm" over the area Z is integral of "zz dm" over the area.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.AreaMassProperties.WorldCoordinatesSecondMomentsError
member.summary: Uncertainty in world coordinates second moments calculation.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.AreaMassProperties.WorldCoordinatesProductMoments
member.summary: Returns the world coordinate product moments if they were able to be calculated. X is integral of "xy dm" over the area Y is integral of "yz dm" over the area Z is integral of "zx dm" over the area.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.AreaMassProperties.WorldCoordinatesProductMomentsError
member.summary: Uncertainty in world coordinates second moments calculation.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.AreaMassProperties.WorldCoordinatesMomentsOfInertia
member.summary: The moments of inertia about the world coordinate axes. X = integral of (y^2 + z^2) dm Y = integral of (z^2 + x^2) dm Z = integral of (z^2 + y^2) dm.
member.remarks: What is meant by "moments of intertia" varies widely in textbooks and papers. The values returned here are the integrals listed in the Summary section. Some applications may want the values from WorldCoordinatesSecondMoments instead of the values returned here.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.AreaMassProperties.WorldCoordinatesMomentsOfInertiaError
member.summary: Uncertainty in world coordinates moments of inertia calculation.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.AreaMassProperties.WorldCoordinatesRadiiOfGyration
member.summary: Radii of gyration with respect to world coordinate system. X = sqrt(integral of (y^2 + z^2) dm/M) Y = sqrt(integral of (z^2 + x^2) dm/M) Z = sqrt(integral of (z^2 + y^2) dm/M)
member.remarks: What is meant by "radii of gyration" varies widely in textbooks and papers. The values returned here are the integrals listed in the Returns section.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.AreaMassProperties.CentroidCoordinatesSecondMoments
member.summary: Second moments with respect to centroid coordinate system. X = integral of (x-x0)^2 dm Y = integral of (y-y0)^2 dm Z = integral of (z-z0)^2 dm where (x0,y0,z0) = centroid.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.AreaMassProperties.CentroidCoordinatesSecondMomentsError
member.summary: Uncertainty in centroid coordinates second moments calculation.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.AreaMassProperties.CentroidCoordinatesMomentsOfInertia
member.summary: Moments of inertia with respect to centroid coordinate system. X = integral of ((y-y0)^2 + (z-z0)^2) dm Y = integral of ((z-z0)^2 + (x-x0)^2) dm Z = integral of ((z-z0)^2 + (y-y0)^2) dm where (x0,y0,z0) = centroid.
member.remarks: What is meant by "moments of intertia" varies widely in textbooks and papers. The values returned here are the integrals listed in the Summary section. Some applications may want the values from WorldCoordinatesSecondMoments instead of the values returned here.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.AreaMassProperties.CentroidCoordinatesMomentsOfInertiaError
member.summary: Uncertainty in centroid coordinates moments of inertia calculation.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.AreaMassProperties.CentroidCoordinatesRadiiOfGyration
member.summary: Radii of gyration with respect to centroid coordinate system. X = sqrt(integral of ((y-y0)^2 + (z-z0)^2) dm/M) Y = sqrt(integral of ((z-z0)^2 + (x-x0)^2) dm/M) Z = sqrt(integral of ((z-z0)^2 + (y-y0)^2) dm/M) where (x0,y0,z0) = centroid.
member.remarks: What is meant by "radii of gyration" varies widely in textbooks and papers. The values returned here are the integrals listed in the Returns section.

member.summary: Sets all values inside the matrix to zero.

member.summary: Sets diagonal value and zeros off all non-diagonal values.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Matrix.Transpose
member.summary:
Modifies this matrix to be its transpose.
This is like swapping rows with columns.
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transpose
member.returns: true if operation succeeded; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Matrix.SwapRows(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Exchanges two rows.
member.returns: true if operation succeeded; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Matrix.SwapColumns(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Exchanges two columns.
member.returns: true if operation succeeded; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Matrix.Invert(System.Double)
member.summary:
Modifies this matrix to become its own inverse.
Matrix might be non-invertible (singular) and the return value will be false.
member.returns: true if operation succeeded; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Matrix.op_Multiply(Rhino.Geometry.Matrix,Rhino.Geometry.Matrix)
member.summary: Multiplies two matrices and returns a new product matrix.
member.param: A first matrix to use in calculation.
Another matrix to use in calculation.
member.returns: The product matrix.
member.exception: When a.ColumnCount != b.RowCount.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Matrix.op_Addition(Rhino.Geometry.Matrix,Rhino.Geometry.Matrix)
member.summary: Adds two matrices and returns a new sum matrix.
member.param: A first matrix to use in calculation.
Another matrix to use in calculation.
member.returns: The sum matrix.
member.exception: When the two matrices are not the same size.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Matrix.Scale(System.Double)
member.summary: Modifies the current matrix by multiplying its values by a number.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Matrix.RowReduce(System.Double,System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary: Row reduces a matrix to calculate rank and determinant.
member.param: (>=0.0) zero tolerance for pivot test. If a the absolute value of a pivot is <= zeroTolerance, then the pivot is assumed to be zero.
value of determinant is returned here.
value of the smallest pivot is returned here.
member.returns: Rank of the matrix.
member.remarks: The matrix itself is row reduced so that the result is an upper triangular matrix with 1's on the diagonal.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Matrix.RowReduce(System.Double,System.Double[],System.Double@)
member.summary: Row reduces a matrix as the first step in solving M*X=b where b is a column of values.
member.param: (>=0.0) zero tolerance for pivot test. If the absolute value of a pivot is <= zero_tolerance, then the pivot is assumed to be zero.
an array of RowCount values that is row reduced with the matrix.
the value of the smallest pivot is returned here.
member.returns: Rank of the matrix.
member.remarks: The matrix itself is row reduced so that the result is an upper triangular matrix with 1's on the diagonal.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Matrix.RowReduce(System.Double,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d[],System.Double@)
member.summary: Row reduces a matrix as the first step in solving M*X=b where b is a column of 3d points.
member.param: (>=0.0) zero tolerance for pivot test. If the absolute value of a pivot is <= zero_tolerance, then the pivot is assumed to be zero.
An array of RowCount 3d points that is row reduced with the matrix.
The value of the smallest pivot is returned here.
member.returns: Rank of the matrix.
member.remarks: The matrix itself is row reduced so that the result is an upper triangular matrix with 1's on the diagonal.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Matrix.BackSolve(System.Double,System.Double[])
member.summary: Solves M*x=b where M is upper triangular with a unit diagonal and b is a column of values.
member.param: (>=0.0) used to test for "zero" values in b in underdetermined systems of equations.
The values in B[RowCount],...,B[B.Length-1] are tested to make sure they are within "zeroTolerance".
member.returns: Array of length ColumnCount on success. null on error.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Matrix.BackSolvePoints(System.Double,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d[])
member.summary: Solves M*x=b where M is upper triangular with a unit diagonal and b is a column of 3d points.
member.param: (>=0.0) used to test for "zero" values in b in underdetermined systems of equations.
The values in B[RowCount],...,B[B.Length-1] are tested to make sure they are "zero".
member.returns: Array of length ColumnCount on success. null on error.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Matrix.GetHashCode
member.summary: Gets the hash code for this matrix. The hash code will change when the matrix changes so you cannot change matrices while they are stored in hash tables.
member.returns: Hash code.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Matrix.Item(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets or sets the matrix value at the given row and column indixes.
member.returns: The value at [row, column].

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Matrix.IsValid
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this matrix is valid.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Matrix.IsSquare
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this matrix has the same number of rows and columns. 0x0 matrices are not considered square.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Matrix.RowCount
member.summary: Gets the amount of rows.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Matrix.ColumnCount
member.summary: Gets the amount of columns.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Matrix.IsRowOrthogonal
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the matrix is row orthogonal.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Matrix.IsColumnOrthogonal
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the matrix is column orthogonal.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.MeshingParameters.Finalize
member.summary: Passively reclaims unmanaged resources when the class user did not explicitly call Dispose().

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.MeshingParameters.Dispose
member.summary: Actively reclaims unmanaged resources that this instance uses.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.MeshingParameters.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
For derived class implementers.
This method is called with argument true when class user calls Dispose(), while with argument false when the Garbage Collector invokes the finalizer, or Finalize() method.
You must reclaim all used unmanaged resources in both cases, and can use this chance to call Dispose on disposable fields if the argument is true.
Also, you must call the base virtual method within your overriding method.
member.param: true if the call comes from the Dispose() method; false if it comes from the Garbage Collector finalizer.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Mesh.IsManifold(System.Boolean,System.Boolean@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether or not the mesh is manifold. A manifold mesh does not have any edge that borders more than two faces.
member.param: If true, the query treats coincident vertices as the same.
isOriented will be set to true if the mesh is a manifold and adjacent faces have compatible face normals.
hasBoundary will be set to true if the mesh is a manifold and there is at least one "edge" with no more than one adjacent face.
member.returns: true if every mesh "edge" has at most two adjacent faces.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Mesh.SolidOrientation
member.summary: Determines orientation of a "solid" mesh.

returns.para: +1 = mesh is solid with outward facing normals.
-1 = mesh is solid with inward facing normals.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Mesh.IsPointInside(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Determines if a point is inside a solid mesh.
member.param: (>=0) 3d distance tolerance used for ray-mesh intersection and determining strict inclusion.

If strictlyIn is true, then point must be inside mesh by at least tolerance in order for this function to return true. If strictlyIn is false, then this function will return true if point is inside or the distance from point to a mesh face is <= tolerance.
member.returns: true if point is inside the solid mesh, false if not.
member.remarks: The caller is responsible for making certing the mesh is solid before calling this function. If the mesh is not solid, the behavior is unpredictable.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Mesh.Unweld(System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Makes sure that faces sharing an edge and having a difference of normal greater than or equal to angleToleranceRadians have unique vertexes along that edge, adding vertices if necessary.
member.param: Angle at which to make unique vertices.
Determines whether new vertex normals will have the same vertex normal as the original (false) or vertex normals made from the corrsponding face normals (true)

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Mesh.Weld(System.Double)
member.summary: Makes sure that faces sharing an edge and having a difference of normal greater than or equal to angleToleranceRadians share vertexes along that edge, vertex normals are averaged.
member.param: Angle at which to weld vertices.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Mesh.UnifyNormals
member.summary: Attempts to fix inconsistencies in the directions of meshfaces for a mesh. This function does not modify the vertex normals, but rather rearranges the mesh face winding and face normals to make them all consistent. You may want to call Mesh.Normals.ComputeNormals() to recompute vertex normals after calling this functions.
member.returns: number of faces that were modified.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Mesh.ExplodeAtUnweldedEdges
member.summary: Explode the mesh into submeshes where a submesh is a collection of faces that are contained within a closed loop of "unwelded" edges. Unwelded edges are edges where the faces that share the edge have unique mesh vertexes (not mesh topology vertexes) at both ends of the edge.
member.returns: Array of submeshes on success; null on error. If the count in the returned array is 1, then nothing happened and the ouput is essentially a copy of the input.

member.summary: Gets the point on the mesh that is closest to a given test point.
member.returns: The point on the mesh closest to testPoint, or Point3d.Unset on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Mesh.ClosestMeshPoint(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,System.Double)
member.summary: Gets the point on the mesh that is closest to a given test point. Similar to the ClosestPoint function except this returns a MeshPoint class which includes extra information beyond just the location of the closest point.
member.param: Optional upper bound on the distance from test point to the mesh. If you are only interested in finding a point Q on the mesh when testPoint.DistanceTo(Q) < maximumDistance, then set maximumDistance to that value. This parameter is ignored if you pass 0.0 for a maximumDistance.
member.returns: closest point information on success. null on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Mesh.ClosestPoint(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d@,System.Double)
member.summary: Gets the point on the mesh that is closest to a given test point.
member.param: Point on the mesh closest to testPoint.

Optional upper bound on the distance from test point to the mesh. If you are only interested in finding a point Q on the mesh when testPoint.DistanceTo(Q) < maximumDistance, then set maximumDistance to that value. This parameter is ignored if you pass 0.0 for a maximumDistance.
member.returns: Index of face that the closest point lies on if successful. -1 if not successful; the value of pointOnMesh is undefined.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Mesh.ClosestPoint(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d@,Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d@,System.Double)
member.summary: Gets the point on the mesh that is closest to a given test point.
member.param: Point on the mesh closest to testPoint.
The normal vector of the mesh at the closest point.

Optional upper bound on the distance from test point to the mesh. If you are only interested in finding a point Q on the mesh when testPoint.DistanceTo(Q) < maximumDistance, then set maximumDistance to that value. This parameter is ignored if you pass 0.0 for a maximumDistance.
member.returns: Index of face that the closest point lies on if successful. -1 if not successful; the value of pointOnMesh is undefined.

member.summary: Pulls a collection of points to a mesh.
member.param: An array, a list or any enumerable set of points.
member.returns: An array of points. This can be empty.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Mesh.Offset(System.Double)
member.summary: Makes a new mesh with vertices offset a distance in the opposite direction of the existing vertex normals. Same as Mesh.Offset(distance, false)
member.param: A distance value to use for offsetting.
member.returns: A new mesh on success, or null on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Mesh.Offset(System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Makes a new mesh with vertices offset a distance in the opposite direction of the existing vertex normals. Optionally, based on the value of solidify, adds the input mesh and a ribbon of faces along any naked edges. If solidify is false it acts exactly as the Offset(distance) function.
member.param: true if the mesh should be solidified.
member.returns: A new mesh on success, or null on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Mesh.GetNakedEdgePointStatus
member.summary: Returns an array of bool values equal in length to the number of vertices in this mesh. Each value corresponds to a mesh vertex and is set to true if the vertex is not completely surrounded by faces.
member.returns: An array of true/false flags that, at each index, reveals if the corresponding vertex is completely surrounded by faces.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Mesh.CreatePartitions(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: In ancient times (or modern smartphone times), some rendering engines were only able to process small batches of triangles and the CreatePartitions() function was provided to partition the mesh into subsets of vertices and faces that those rendering engines could handle.
member.returns: true on success

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Mesh.GetPartition(System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves a partition. See for details.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Mesh.Reduce(System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Reduce polygon count
member.param: desired or target number of faces
If true mesh appearance is not changed even if the target polygon count is not reached
Integer from 1 to 10 telling how accurate reduction algorithm to use. Greater number gives more accurate results
If true mesh is fitted to an axis aligned unit cube until reduction is complete
member.returns: True if mesh is successfully reduced and false if mesh could not be reduced for some reason.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Mesh.CreateContourCurves(Rhino.Geometry.Mesh,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,System.Double)
member.summary: Constructs contour curves for a mesh, sectioned along a linear axis.
member.param: A start point of the contouring axis.
An end point of the contouring axis.
member.returns: An array of curves. This array can be empty.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Mesh.CreateContourCurves(Rhino.Geometry.Mesh,Rhino.Geometry.Plane)
member.summary: Constructs contour curves for a mesh, sectioned at a plane.
member.returns: An array of curves. This array can be empty.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Mesh.IsClosed
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether a mesh is considered to be closed (solid). A mesh is considered solid when every mesh edge borders two or more faces.

If [index] is less than [Count], the existing vertex at [index] will be modified.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Collections.MeshTopologyVertexList.SortEdges
member.summary: Sorts the edge list for the mesh topology vertex list so that the edges are in radial order when you call ConnectedTopologyVertices. A nonmanifold edge is treated as a boundary edge with respect to sorting. If any boundary or nonmanifold edges end at the vertex, then the first edge will be a boundary or nonmanifold edge.
member.returns: true on success.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Collections.MeshTopologyVertexList.SortEdges(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sorts the edge list for as single mesh topology vertex so that the edges are in radial order when you call ConnectedTopologyVertices. A nonmanifold edge is treated as a boundary edge with respect to sorting. If any boundary or nonmanifold edges end at the vertex, then the first edge will be a boundary or nonmanifold edge.
member.param: index of a topology vertex in Mesh.TopologyVertices>
member.returns: true on success.

member.summary:
Gets the center point of a face.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Collections.MeshFaceList.ConvertQuadsToTriangles
member.summary: Splits all quads along the short diagonal.
member.returns: true on success, false on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Collections.MeshFaceList.ConvertTrianglesToQuads(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Joins adjacent triangles into quads if the resulting quad is 'nice'.
member.param: Used to compare adjacent triangles' face normals. For two triangles to be considered, the angle between their face normals has to be <= angleToleranceRadians. When in doubt use RhinoMath.PI/90.0 (2 degrees).

( <= 1.0) For two triangles to be considered the ratio of the resulting quad's diagonals (length of the shortest diagonal)/(length of longest diagonal). has to be >= minimumDiagonalLengthRatio. When in doubt us .875.
member.returns: true on success, false on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Collections.MeshFaceList.CullDegenerateFaces
member.summary:
Attempts to removes degenerate faces from the mesh.
Degenerate faces are faces that contains such a combination of indices, that their final shape collapsed in a line or point.
Before returning, this method also attempts to repair faces by juggling vertex indices.
member.returns: The number of degenerate faces that were removed.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Collections.MeshFaceList.IsHidden(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Gets a value indicating whether a face is hidden.
A face is hidden if, and only if, at least one of its vertices is hidden.
member.returns: true if hidden, false if fully visible.

member.summary: Returns true if at least one of the face edges are not topologically connected to any other faces.
member.returns: true if that face makes the mesh open, otherwise false.

member.summary: Find all connected face indices where adjacent face normals meet the criteria of angleRadians and greaterThanAngle
member.param: angle to use for comparison of what is connected
If true angles greater than or equal to are considered connected. If false, angles less than or equal to are considerd connected.
member.returns: list of connected face indices

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Collections.MeshFaceList.GetConnectedFacesToEdges(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Uses startFaceIndex and finds all connected face indexes up to unwelded or naked edges. If treatNonmanifoldLikeUnwelded is true then non-manifold edges will be considered as unwelded or naked
member.param: True means non-manifold edges will be handled like unwelded edges, False means they aren't considered
member.returns: Array of connected face indexes

member.summary:
Sets or adds a vertex color to the color List.
If [index] is less than [Count], the existing vertex at [index] will be modified.
If [index] equals [Count], a new vertex is appended to the end of the vertex list.

Red component of vertex color. Value must be in the 0~255 range.
Green component of vertex color. Value must be in the 0~255 range.
Blue component of vertex color. Value must be in the 0~255 range.
member.returns: true on success, false on failure.

param.name: direction
param.para: 0 = first texture coordinate is reversed.
1 = second texture coordinate is reversed.

member.returns: true if operation succeeded; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.MeshFace
member.summary:
Represents the values of the four indices of a mesh face quad.
If the third and fourth values are the same, this face represents a triangle.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.MeshFace.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructs a new triangular Mesh face.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.MeshFace.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructs a new quadrangular Mesh face.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.MeshFace.IsValid
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether or not this mesh face is considered to be valid. Note that even valid mesh faces could potentially be invalid in the context of a specific Mesh, if one or more of the corner indices exceeds the number of vertices on the mesh. If you want to perform a complete validity check, use IsValid(int) instead.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.MeshFace.IsValid(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether or not this mesh face is considered to be valid. Unlike the simple IsValid function, this function takes upper bound indices into account.
member.param: Number of vertices in the mesh that this face is a part of.
member.returns: true if the face is considered valid, false if not.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.MeshFace.Set(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets all the corners for this face as a triangle.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.MeshFace.Set(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets all the corners for this face as a quad.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.MeshFace.Flip
member.summary: Reverses the orientation of the face by swapping corners. The first corner is always maintained.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshFace.Unset
member.summary: Gets an Unset MeshFace. Unset faces have Int32.MinValue for all corner indices.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshFace.DebuggerDisplayUtil
member.summary: Internal property that figures out the debugger display for Mesh Faces.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshFace.A
member.summary: Gets or sets the first corner index of the mesh face.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshFace.B
member.summary: Gets or sets the second corner index of the mesh face.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshFace.C
member.summary: Gets or sets the third corner index of the mesh face.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshFace.D
member.summary: Gets or sets the fourth corner index of the mesh face. If D equals C, the mesh face is considered to be a triangle rather than a quad.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshFace.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets or sets the vertex index associated with an entry in this face.
member.param: A number in interval [0-3] that refers to an index of a vertex in this face.
member.returns: The vertex index associated with this mesh face.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshFace.IsTriangle
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether or not this mesh face is a triangle. A mesh face is considered to be a triangle when C equals D, thus it is possible for an Invalid mesh face to also be a triangle.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshFace.IsQuad
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether or not this mesh face is a quad. A mesh face is considered to be a triangle when C does not equal D, thus it is possible for an Invalid mesh face to also be a quad.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.NurbsSurface.CreateNetworkSurface(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Rhino.Geometry.Curve},System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Rhino.Geometry.Curve},System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Builds a surface from an ordered network of curves/edges.
member.param: An array, a list or any enumerable set of U curves.
continuity at first U segment, 0 = loose, 1 = pos, 2 = tan, 3 = curvature.
continuity at last U segment, 0 = loose, 1 = pos, 2 = tan, 3 = curvature.
An array, a list or any enumerable set of V curves.
continuity at first V segment, 0 = loose, 1 = pos, 2 = tan, 3 = curvature.
continuity at last V segment, 0 = loose, 1 = pos, 2 = tan, 3 = curvature.
tolerance to use along network surface edge.
tolerance to use for the interior curves.

If the NurbsSurface could not be created, the error value describes where the failure occured. 0 = success, 1 = curve sorter failed, 2 = network initializing failed, 3 = failed to build surface, 4 = network surface is not valid.
member.returns: A NurbsSurface or null on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.NurbsSurface.CreateNetworkSurface(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Rhino.Geometry.Curve},System.Int32,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Builds a surface from an autosorted network of curves/edges.
member.param: An array, a list or any enumerable set of curves/edges, sorted automatically into U and V curves.
continuity along edges, 0 = loose, 1 = pos, 2 = tan, 3 = curvature.
tolerance to use along network surface edge.
tolerance to use for the interior curves.

If the NurbsSurface could not be created, the error value describes where the failure occured. 0 = success, 1 = curve sorter failed, 2 = network initializing failed, 3 = failed to build surface, 4 = network surface is not valid.
member.returns: A NurbsSurface or null on failure.

member.summary: Protected constructor for internal use.

member.summary: Applies the space morph to geometry.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MorphControl.SpaceMorphTolerance
member.summary: The 3d fitting tolerance used when morphing surfaces and breps. The default is 0.0 and any value <= 0.0 is ignored by morphing functions. The value returned by Tolerance does not affect the way meshes and points are morphed.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MorphControl.QuickPreview
member.summary: true if the morph should be done as quickly as possible because the result is being used for some type of dynamic preview. If QuickPreview is true, the tolerance may be ignored. The QuickPreview value does not affect the way meshes and points are morphed. The default is false.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MorphControl.PreserveStructure
member.summary: true if the morph should be done in a way that preserves the structure of the geometry. In particular, for NURBS objects, true eans that only the control points are moved. The PreserveStructure value does not affect the way meshes and points are morphed. The default is false.

member.summary: Gets the mesh face indices of the triangle where the intersection is on the face takes into consideration the way the quad was split during the intersection.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshPoint.Mesh
member.summary: The mesh that is ralated to this point.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshPoint.EdgeParameter
member.summary: Edge parameter when found.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshPoint.ComponentIndex
member.summary: Gets the component index of the intersecting element in the mesh.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshPoint.EdgeIndex
member.summary: When set, EdgeIndex is an index of an edge in the mesh's edge list.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshPoint.FaceIndex
member.summary: FaceIndex is an index of a face in mesh.Faces. When ComponentIndex refers to a vertex, any face that uses the vertex may appear as FaceIndex. When ComponenctIndex refers to an Edge or EdgeIndex is set, then any face that uses that edge may appear as FaceIndex.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshPoint.Triangle
member.summary:
Face triangle where the intersection takes place:
0 is unset
A is 0,1,2
B is 0,2,3
C is 0,1,3
D is 1,2,3

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshPoint.T
member.summary: Barycentric quad coordinates for the point on the mesh face mesh.Faces[FaceIndex]. If the face is a triangle disregard T[3] (it should be set to 0.0). If the face is a quad and is split between vertexes 0 and 2, then T[3] will be 0.0 when point is on the triangle defined by vi[0], vi[1], vi[2] and T[1] will be 0.0 when point is on the triangle defined by vi[0], vi[2], vi[3]. If the face is a quad and is split between vertexes 1 and 3, then T[2] will be -1 when point is on the triangle defined by vi[0], vi[1], vi[3] and m_t[0] will be -1 when point is on the triangle defined by vi[1], vi[2], vi[3].

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshPoint.Point
member.summary: Gets the location (position) of this point.

When not overridden in a derived class, this calls .
member.returns: An exact duplicate of this curve.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.PolyCurve.DuplicatePolyCurve
member.summary:
Duplicates this polycurve.
This is the same as .
member.returns: An exact duplicate of this curve.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.PolyCurve.SegmentCurve(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the segment curve at the given index.
member.returns: The segment at the given index or null on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.PolyCurve.RemoveNesting
member.summary: Explodes nested polycurve segments and reconstructs this curve from the shattered remains. The result will have not have any PolyCurves as segments but it will have identical locus and parameterization.
member.returns: true if any nested PolyCurve was found and absorbed, false if no PolyCurve segments could be found.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.PolyCurve.Explode
member.summary: Explodes this PolyCurve into a list of Curve segments. This will not explode nested polycurves. Call first if you need all individual segments.
member.returns: An array of polycurve segments.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.PolyCurve.Append(Rhino.Geometry.Line)
member.summary: Appends and matches the start of the line to the end of polycurve. This function will fail if the polycurve is closed.
member.returns: true on success, false on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.PolyCurve.Append(Rhino.Geometry.Arc)
member.summary: Appends and matches the start of the arc to the end of polycurve. This function will fail if the polycurve is closed or if SegmentCount > 0 and the arc is closed.
member.returns: true on success, false on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.PolyCurve.Append(Rhino.Geometry.Curve)
member.summary: Appends and matches the start of the curve to the end of polycurve. This function will fail if the PolyCurve is closed or if SegmentCount > 0 and the new segment is closed.
member.returns: true on success, false on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.PolyCurve.SegmentCurveParameter(System.Double)
member.summary: Converts a polycurve parameter to a segment curve parameter.
member.returns: Segment curve evaluation parameter or UnsetValue if the segment curve parameter could not be computed.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.PolyCurve.PolyCurveParameter(System.Int32,System.Double)
member.summary: Converts a segment curve parameter to a polycurve parameter.
member.returns: Polycurve evaluation parameter or UnsetValue if the polycurve curve parameter could not be computed.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.PolyCurve.SegmentDomain(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the polycurve subdomain assigned to a segment curve.
member.returns: The polycurve subdomain assigned to a segment curve. Returns Interval.Unset if segment_index < 0 or segment_index >= Count().

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.PolyCurve.SegmentIndex(System.Double)
member.summary: Finds the segment used for evaluation at polycurve_parameter.
member.param: Parameter on polycurve for segment lookup.
member.returns: Index of the segment used for evaluation at polycurve_parameter. If polycurve_parameter < Domain.Min(), then 0 is returned. If polycurve_parameter > Domain.Max(), then Count()-1 is returned.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.PolyCurve.SegmentIndexes(Rhino.Geometry.Interval,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Finds the segments that overlap the Polycurve sub domain.

Index of last segment that overlaps the subdomain. Note that segmentIndex0 <= i < segmentIndex1.
member.returns: Number of segments that overlap the subdomain.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.PolyCurve.HasGap
member.summary: This is a quick way to see if the curve has gaps between the sub curve segments.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.Polyline
member.summary:
Represents an ordered set of points connected by linear segments.
Polylines are closed if start and end points coincide.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Polyline.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new empty polyline.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Polyline.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new empty polyline with an initial capacity.

member.summary: Initializes a new polyline from a collection of points.

member.summary: Determines whether the polyline is closed, provided a tolerance value.
member.param: If the distance between the start and end point of the polyline is less than tolerance, the polyline is considered to be closed.
member.returns: true if the polyline is closed to within tolerance, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Polyline.SegmentAt(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the line segment at the given index.

member.summary: Gets the point on the polyline at the given parameter. The integer part of the parameter indicates the index of the segment.
member.returns: The point on the polyline at t.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Polyline.TangentAt(System.Double)
member.summary: Gets the unit tangent vector along the polyline at the given parameter. The integer part of the parameter indicates the index of the segment.
member.returns: The tangent along the polyline at t.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Polyline.Trim(Rhino.Geometry.Interval)
member.summary: Constructs a polyline out of a parameter subdomain in this curve.
member.param: The subdomain of the polyline. The integer part of the domain parameters indicate the index of the segment.
member.returns: The polyline as defined by the subdomain, or null on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Polyline.ClosestPoint(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d)
member.summary: Gets the point on the polyline which is closest to a test-point.
member.returns: The point on the polyline closest to testPoint.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Polyline.ClosestParameter(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d)
member.summary: Gets the parameter along the polyline which is closest to a test-point.
member.returns: The parameter along the polyline closest to testPoint.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Polyline.GetSegments
member.summary: Constructs an array of line segments that make up the entire polyline.
member.returns: An array of line segments or null if the polyline contains fewer than 2 points.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Polyline.ToNurbsCurve
member.summary: Constructs a nurbs curve representation of this polyline.
member.returns: A Nurbs curve shaped like this polyline or null on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Polyline.DeleteShortSegments(System.Double)
member.summary:
Removes all points that are closer than tolerance to the previous point.
Start and end points are left intact.
member.param: Vertices closer together than tolerance will be removed.
member.returns: Number of points (and segments) removed.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Polyline.CollapseShortSegments(System.Double)
member.summary: Collapses all segments until none are shorter than tolerance. This function is significantly slower than DeleteShortSegments, since it recursively operates on the shortest segment. When a segment is collapsed the end-points are placed in the center of the segment.
member.returns: The number of segments that were collapsed.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Polyline.ReduceSegments(System.Double)
member.summary: Constructs a reduction of this polyline by recursively removing the least significant segments.
member.param: Tolerance for reduction. Whenever a vertex of the polyline is more significant than tolerance, it will be included in the reduction.
member.returns: The number of vertices that disappeared due to reduction.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Polyline.Smooth(System.Double)
member.summary: Smoothens the polyline segments by averaging adjacent vertices. Smoothing requires a polyline with exclusively valid vertices.
member.param: Amount to smooth. Zero equals no smoothing, one equals complete smoothing.
member.returns: true on success, false on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Polyline.BreakAtAngles(System.Double)
member.summary: Breaks this polyline into sections at sharp kinks. Closed polylines will also be broken at the first and last vertex.
member.param: Angle (in radians) between adjacent segments for a break to occur.
member.returns: An array of polyline segments, or null on error.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Polyline.CenterPoint
member.summary: Compute the center point of the polyline as the weighted average of all segments.
member.returns: The weighted average of all segments.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Polyline.TriangulateClosedPolyline
member.summary: Attempts to create a list of triangles which represent a triangulation of a closed polyline

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Polyline.IsValid
member.summary:
Gets a value that indicates whether this polyline is valid.
Valid polylines have at least one segment, no Invalid points and no zero length segments.
Closed polylines with only two segments are also not considered valid.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Polyline.SegmentCount
member.summary: Gets the number of segments for this polyline.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Polyline.IsClosed
member.summary:
Gets a value that indicates whether this polyline is closed.
The polyline is considered to be closed if its start is identical to its endpoint.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Polyline.Length
member.summary: Gets the total length of the polyline.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.Rectangle3d
member.summary: Represents the values of a plane and two intervals that form an oriented rectangle in three dimensions.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Rectangle3d.CreateFromPolyline(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Rhino.Geometry.Point3d})
member.summary: Attempts to create a rectangle from a polyline. In order for the polyline to qualify as a rectangle, it must have 4 or 5 corner points (i.e. it need not be closed).
member.returns: A rectangle that is shaped similarly to the polyline or Rectangle3d.Unset if the polyline does not represent a rectangle.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Rectangle3d.CreateFromPolyline(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Rhino.Geometry.Point3d},System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary:
Attempts to create a Rectangle from a Polyline. In order for a polyline to qualify as a rectangle, it must have 4 or 5 corner points (i.e. it need not be closed).
This overload also returns deviations.
member.param: On success, the deviation will contain the largest deviation between the polyline and the rectangle.
On success, the angleDeviation will contain the largest deviation (in radians) between the polyline edges and the rectangle edges.
member.returns: A rectangle that is shaped similarly to the polyline or Rectangle3d.Unset if the polyline does not represent a rectangle.

member.summary: Initializes a new rectangle from a base plane and two corner points.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Rectangle3d.Corner(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the corner at the given index.
member.param:
Index of corner, valid values are:
0 = lower left (min-x, min-y)
1 = lower right (max-x, min-y)
2 = upper right (max-x, max-y)
3 = upper left (min-x, max-y)
member.returns: The point at the given corner index.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Rectangle3d.RecenterPlane(System.Int32)
member.summary: Recenters the base plane on one of the corners.

Index of corner, valid values are:
0 = lower left (min-x, min-y)
1 = lower right (max-x, min-y)
2 = upper right (max-x, max-y)
3 = upper left (min-x, max-y)

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.RevSurface
member.summary:
Represents a surface of revolution.
Revolutions can be incomplete (they can form arcs).

member.summary:
Constructs a new surface of revolution from a generatrix curve and an axis.
This overload accepts a slice start and end angles.
member.param: An angle in radias for the start.
An angle in radias for the end.
member.returns: A new surface of revolution, or null if any of the inputs is invalid or on error.

Results can be (truncated) cones, cylinders and circular hyperboloids, or can fail.

An angle in radias for the end.
member.returns: A new surface of revolution, or null if any of the inputs is invalid or on error.

member.returns: A new surface of revolution, or null if any of the inputs is invalid or on error.

member.summary: Represents event data that is passed when when an item that meets certain criteria is found and the passed RTree event is raised.

member.summary: Gets the identifier of the found item.

member.summary: Gets the identifier pointer of the found item.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines if the search should be conducted farther.

member.summary: If search is using two r-trees, IdB is the element b pointer in the search.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.RTreeEventArgs.Tag

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.RTreeEventArgs.SearchSphere

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.RTreeEventArgs.SearchBoundingBox
member.summary: Bounding box bounds used during a search. You may modify the box in a search callback to help reduce the bounds to search.

member.remarks: The opennurbs rtree code is a modifed version of the free and unrestricted R-tree implementation obtianed from http://www.superliminal.com/sources/sources.htm .

member.summary: Actively reclaims unmanaged resources that this instance uses.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.RTree.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
For derived class implementers.
This method is called with argument true when class user calls Dispose(), while with argument false when the Garbage Collector invokes the finalizer, or Finalize() method.
You must reclaim all used unmanaged resources in both cases, and can use this chance to call Dispose on disposable fields if the argument is true.
Also, you must call the base virtual method within your overriding method.
member.param: true if the call comes from the Dispose() method; false if it comes from the Garbage Collector finalizer.

member.name: T:Rhino.Render.TextureMapping
member.summary: Represents a texture mapping.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.TextureMapping.TryGetMappingBox(Rhino.Geometry.Plane@,Rhino.Geometry.Interval@,Rhino.Geometry.Interval@,Rhino.Geometry.Interval@)
member.summary: Get a box projection from the texture mapping.
member.param: The center of the box is at plane.origin and the sides of the box are parallel to the plane's coordinate planes.

The "front" and "back" sides of the box are in spanned by the vectors plane.yaxis and plane.zaxis. The back plane contains the point plane.PointAt(dx[0],0,0) and the front plane contains the point plane.PointAt(dx[1],0,0).

The "left" and "right" sides of the box are in spanned by the vectors plane.zaxis and plane.xaxis. The left plane contains the point plane.PointAt(0,dx[0],0) and the back plane contains the point plane.PointAt(0,dy[1],0).

The "top" and "bottom" sides of the box are in spanned by the vectors plane.xaxis and plane.yaxis. The bottom plane contains the point plane.PointAt(0,0,dz[0]) and the top plane contains the point plane.PointAt(0,0,dz[1]).
member.returns: Returns true if a valid box is returned.
member.remarks: Generally, GetMappingBox will not return the same parameters passed to SetBoxMapping. However, the location of the box will be the same.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.TextureMapping.TryGetMappingSphere(Rhino.Geometry.Sphere@)
member.summary: Get a spherical projection parameters from this texture mapping.
member.returns: Returns true if a valid sphere is returned.
member.remarks: Generally, GetMappingShere will not return the same parameters passed to SetSphereMapping. However, the location of the sphere will be the same. If this mapping is not cylindrical, the cylinder will approximate the actual mapping primitive.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.TextureMapping.TryGetMappingCylinder(Rhino.Geometry.Cylinder@)
member.summary: Get a cylindrical projection parameters from this texture mapping.
member.returns: Returns true if a valid cylinder is returned.
member.remarks: Generally, GetMappingCylinder will not return the same parameters passed to SetCylinderMapping. However, the location of the cylinder will be the same. If this mapping is not cylindrical, the cylinder will approximate the actual mapping primitive.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.TextureMapping.TryGetMappingPlane(Rhino.Geometry.Plane@,Rhino.Geometry.Interval@,Rhino.Geometry.Interval@,Rhino.Geometry.Interval@)
member.summary: Get plane mapping parameters from this texture mapping.
member.param: Portion of the plane's x axis that is mapped to [0,1]
Portion of the plane's y axis that is mapped to [0,1]
Portion of the plane's z axis that is mapped to [0,1]
member.returns: Return true if valid plane mapping parameters were returned.
member.remarks: NOTE WELL: Generally, GetMappingPlane will not return the same parameters passed to SetPlaneMapping. However, the location of the plane will be the same.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.TextureMapping.CreatePlaneMapping(Rhino.Geometry.Plane,Rhino.Geometry.Interval,Rhino.Geometry.Interval,Rhino.Geometry.Interval)
member.summary: Create a planar projection texture mapping
member.param: A plane to use for mapping.
portion of the plane's x axis that is mapped to [0,1] (can be a decreasing interval)
portion of the plane's y axis that is mapped to [0,1] (can be a decreasing interval)
portion of the plane's z axis that is mapped to [0,1] (can be a decreasing interval)
member.returns: TextureMapping instance if input is valid

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.TextureMapping.CreateCylinderMapping(Rhino.Geometry.Cylinder,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Create a cylindrical projection texture mapping.
member.param: cylinder in world space used to define a cylindrical coordinate system. The angular parameter maps (0,2pi) to texture "u" (0,1), The height parameter maps (height[0],height[1]) to texture "v" (0,1), and the radial parameter maps (0,r) to texture "w" (0,1).
If true, the cylinder is treated as a finite capped cylinder
member.remarks: When the cylinder is capped and m_texture_space = divided, the cylinder is mapped to texture space as follows: The side is mapped to 0 <= "u" <= 2/3. The bottom is mapped to 2/3 <= "u" <= 5/6. The top is mapped to 5/6 <= "u" <= 5/6. This is the same convention box mapping uses.
member.returns: TextureMapping instance if input is valid

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.TextureMapping.CreateSphereMapping(Rhino.Geometry.Sphere)
member.summary: Create a spherical projection texture mapping.
member.param: sphere in world space used to define a spherical coordinate system. The longitude parameter maps (0,2pi) to texture "u" (0,1). The latitude paramter maps (-pi/2,+pi/2) to texture "v" (0,1). The radial parameter maps (0,r) to texture "w" (0,1).
member.returns: TextureMapping instance if input is valid

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.TextureMapping.CreateBoxMapping(Rhino.Geometry.Plane,Rhino.Geometry.Interval,Rhino.Geometry.Interval,Rhino.Geometry.Interval,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Create a box projection texture mapping.
member.param: The sides of the box the box are parallel to the plane's coordinate planes. The dx, dy, dz intervals determine the location of the sides.
Determines the location of the front and back planes. The vector plane.xaxis is perpendicular to these planes and they pass through plane.PointAt(dx[0],0,0) and plane.PointAt(dx[1],0,0), respectivly.
Determines the location of the left and right planes. The vector plane.yaxis is perpendicular to these planes and they pass through plane.PointAt(0,dy[0],0) and plane.PointAt(0,dy[1],0), respectivly.
Determines the location of the top and bottom planes. The vector plane.zaxis is perpendicular to these planes and they pass through plane.PointAt(0,0,dz[0]) and plane.PointAt(0,0,dz[1]), respectivly.
If true, the box is treated as a finite capped box.
member.returns: TextureMapping instance if input is valid

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.TextureMapping.MappingType
member.summary: Texture mapping type associated with this Mapping object.

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.TextureMapping.Id
member.summary: The unique Id for this texture mapping object.

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.TextureMapping.UvwTransform
member.summary: Transform applied to mapping coordinate (u,v,w) to convert it into a texture coordinate.

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.TextureMapping.PrimativeTransform
member.summary: For primitive based mappings, these transformations are used to map the world coordinate (x,y,z) point P and surface normal N before it is projected to the normalized mapping primitive. The surface normal transformation, m_Nxyz, is always calculated from m_Pxyz. It is a runtime setting that is not saved in 3dm files. If m_type is srfp_mapping, then m_Pxyz and m_Nxyz are ignored.

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.TextureMapping.NormalTransform
member.summary: For primitive based mappings, these transformations are used to map the world coordinate (x,y,z) point P and surface normal N before it is projected to the normalized mapping primitive. The surface normal transformation, m_Nxyz, is always calculated from m_Pxyz. It is a runtime setting that is not saved in 3dm files. If m_type is srfp_mapping, then m_Pxyz and m_Nxyz are ignored.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.ChangeToParallelProjection(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Use this function to change projections of valid viewports from parallel to perspective. It will make common additional adjustments to the frustum and camera location so the resulting views are similar. The camera direction and target point are not be changed. If the current projection is parallel and symmetricFrustum, FrustumIsLeftRightSymmetric() and FrustumIsTopBottomSymmetric() are all equal, then no changes are made and true is returned.
member.param: true if you want the resulting frustum to be symmetric.
member.returns: true if the operation succeeded; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.ChangeToPerspectiveProjection(System.Double,System.Boolean,System.Double)
member.summary: Use this function to change projections of valid viewports from parallel to perspective. It will make common additional adjustments to the frustum and camera location so the resulting views are similar. The camera direction and target point are not changed. If the current projection is perspective and symmetricFrustum, IsFrustumIsLeftRightSymmetric, and IsFrustumIsTopBottomSymmetric are all equal, then no changes are made and true is returned.
member.param: If RhinoMath.UnsetValue this parameter is ignored. Otherwise it must be > 0 and indicates which plane in the current view frustum should be perserved.
true if you want the resulting frustum to be symmetric.

(pass 50.0 when in doubt) 35 mm lens length to use when changing from parallel to perspective projections. If the current projection is perspective or lens_length is <= 0.0, then this parameter is ignored.
member.returns: true if the operation succeeded; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.ChangeToTwoPointPerspectiveProjection(System.Double,Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d,System.Double)
member.summary: Changes projections of valid viewports to a two point perspective. It will make common additional adjustments to the frustum and camera location and direction so the resulting views are similar. If the current projection is perspective and IsFrustumIsLeftRightSymmetric is true and IsFrustumIsTopBottomSymmetric is false, then no changes are made and true is returned.
member.param: If RhinoMath.UnsetValue this parameter is ignored. Otherwise it must be > 0 and indicates which plane in the current view frustum should be perserved.
The locked up direction. Pass Vector3d.Zero if you want to use the world axis direction that is closest to the current up direction. Pass CameraY() if you want to preserve the current up direction.

(pass 50.0 when in doubt) 35 mm lens length to use when changing from parallel to perspective projections. If the current projection is perspective or lens_length is <= 0.0, then this parameter is ignored.
member.returns: true if the operation succeeded; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.ChangeToSymmetricFrustum(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Double)
member.summary: If needed, adjusts the current frustum so it has the specified symmetries and adjust the camera location so the target plane remains visible.
member.param: If true, the frustum will be adjusted so left = -right.
If true, the frustum will be adjusted so top = -bottom.

If projection is not perspective or target_distance is RhinoMath.UnsetValue, then this parameter is ignored. If the projection is perspective and targetDistance is not RhinoMath.UnsetValue, then it must be > 0.0 and it is used to determine which plane in the old frustum will appear unchanged in the new frustum.
member.returns: Returns true if the viewport has now a frustum with the specified symmetries.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.GetPointDepth(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,System.Double@)
member.summary: Gets the clipping distance of a point. This function ignores the current value of the viewport's near and far settings. If the viewport is a perspective projection, then it intersects the semi infinite frustum volume with the bounding box and returns the near and far distances of the intersection. If the viewport is a parallel projection, it instersects the infinte view region with the bounding box and returns the near and far distances of the projection.
member.returns: true if the bounding box intersects the view frustum and near_dist/far_dist were set. false if the bounding box does not intesect the view frustum.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.GetBoundingBoxDepth(Rhino.Geometry.BoundingBox,System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary: Gets near and far clipping distances of a bounding box. This function ignores the current value of the viewport's near and far settings. If the viewport is a perspective projection, the it intersects the semi infinite frustum volume with the bounding box and returns the near and far distances of the intersection. If the viewport is a parallel projection, it instersects the infinte view region with the bounding box and returns the near and far distances of the projection.
member.param: Near distance of the box. This value can be zero or negative when the camera location is inside bbox.
Far distance of the box. This value can be equal to near_dist, zero or negative when the camera location is in front of the bounding box.
member.returns: true if the bounding box intersects the view frustum and near_dist/far_dist were set. false if the bounding box does not intesect the view frustum.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.GetSphereDepth(Rhino.Geometry.Sphere,System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary: Gets near and far clipping distances of a bounding sphere.
member.param: Near distance of the sphere (can be < 0)
Far distance of the sphere (can be equal to near_dist)
member.returns: true if the sphere intersects the view frustum and near_dist/far_dist were set. false if the sphere does not intesect the view frustum.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.SetFrustumNearFar(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Sets near and far clipping distance subject to constraints.
member.param: If min_near_dist <= 0.0, it is ignored. If min_near_dist > 0 and near_dist < min_near_dist, then the frustum's near_dist will be increased to min_near_dist.

If min_near_over_far <= 0.0, it is ignored. If near_dist < far_dist*min_near_over_far, then near_dist is increased and/or far_dist is decreased so that near_dist = far_dist*min_near_over_far. If near_dist < target_dist < far_dist, then near_dist near_dist is increased and far_dist is decreased so that projection precision will be good at target_dist. Otherwise, near_dist is simply set to far_dist*min_near_over_far.
If target_dist <= 0.0, it is ignored. If target_dist > 0, it is used as described in the description of the min_near_over_far parameter.
member.returns: true if operation succeeded; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.GetNearPlaneCorners
member.summary: Gets the corners of near clipping plane rectangle. 4 points are returned in the order of bottom left, bottom right, top left, top right.
member.returns: Four corner points on success. Empty array if viewport is not valid.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.GetFarPlaneCorners
member.summary: Gets the corners of far clipping plane rectangle. 4 points are returned in the order of bottom left, bottom right, top left, top right.
member.returns: Four corner points on success. Empty array if viewport is not valid.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.DollyCamera(Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d)
member.summary: DollyCamera() does not update the frustum's clipping planes. To update the frustum's clipping planes call DollyFrustum(d) with d = dollyVector o cameraFrameZ. To convert screen locations into a dolly vector, use GetDollyCameraVector(). Does not update frustum. To update frustum use DollyFrustum(d) with d = dollyVector o cameraFrameZ.
member.returns: true if the operation succeeded; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.GetDollyCameraVector(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Double)
member.summary: Gets a world coordinate dolly vector that can be passed to DollyCamera().
member.param: Distance of projection plane from camera. When in doubt, use 0.5*(frus_near+frus_far).
member.returns: The world coordinate dolly vector.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.GetDollyCameraVector(System.Drawing.Point,System.Drawing.Point,System.Double)
member.summary: Gets a world coordinate dolly vector that can be passed to DollyCamera().
member.param: Distance of projection plane from camera. When in doubt, use 0.5*(frus_near+frus_far).
member.returns: The world coordinate dolly vector.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.DollyFrustum(System.Double)
member.summary: Moves the frustum clipping planes.
member.param: Distance to move in camera direction.
member.returns: true if the operation succeeded; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.DollyExtents(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Rhino.Geometry.GeometryBase},System.Double)
member.summary: Dolly the camera location and so that the view frustum contains all of the document objects that can be seen in view. If the projection is perspective, the camera angle is not changed.
member.param: If border > 1.0, then the fustum in enlarged by this factor to provide a border around the view. 1.1 works well for parallel projections; 0.0 is suggested for perspective projections.
member.returns: True if successful.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.DollyExtents(Rhino.Geometry.BoundingBox,System.Double)
member.summary: Dolly the camera location and so that the view frustum contains all of the document objects that can be seen in view. If the projection is perspective, the camera angle is not changed.
member.param: If border > 1.0, then the fustum in enlarged by this factor to provide a border around the view. 1.1 works well for parallel projections; 0.0 is suggested for perspective projections.
member.returns: True if successful.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.FrustumCenterPoint(System.Double)
member.summary: Return a point on the central axis of the view frustum. This point is a good choice for a general purpose target point.
member.param: If targetDistance > 0.0, then the distance from the returned point to the camera plane will be targetDistance. Note that if the frustum is not symmetric, the distance from the returned point to the camera location will be larger than targetDistance. If targetDistance == ON_UNSET_VALUE and the frustum is valid with near > 0.0, then 0.5*(near + far) will be used as the targetDistance.
member.returns: A point on the frustum's central axis. If the viewport or input is not valid, then ON_3dPoint::UnsetPoint is returned.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.TargetDistance(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets the distance from the target point to the camera plane. Note that if the frustum is not symmetric, then this distance is shorter than the distance from the target to the camera location.
member.param: If bUseFrustumCenterFallback is false and the target point is not valid, then ON_UNSET_VALUE is returned. If bUseFrustumCenterFallback is true and the frustum is valid and current target point is not valid or is behind the camera, then 0.5*(near + far) is returned.
member.returns: Shortest signed distance from camera plane to target point. If the target point is on the visible side of the camera, a positive value is returned. ON_UNSET_VALUE is returned when the input of view is not valid.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.FrustumAspect
member.summary: Setting FrustumAspect changes the larger of the frustum's width/height so that the resulting value of width/height matches the requested aspect. The camera angle is not changed. If you change the shape of the view port with a call SetScreenPort(), then you generally want to call SetFrustumAspect() with the value returned by GetScreenPortAspect().

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.FrustumNearPlane
member.summary: Gets near clipping plane if camera and frustum are valid. The plane's frame is the same as the camera's frame. The origin is located at the intersection of the camera direction ray and the near clipping plane. The plane's normal points out of the frustum towards the camera location.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.FrustumFarPlane
member.summary: Gets far clipping plane if camera and frustum are valid. The plane's frame is the same as the camera's frame. The origin is located at the intersection of the camera direction ray and the far clipping plane. The plane's normal points into the frustum towards the camera location.

Gets the sceen aspect ratio.
