member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.CameraAngle
member.summary: Gets or sets the 1/2 smallest angle. See for more information.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.Camera35mmLensLength
member.summary: This property assumes the camera is horizontal and crop the film rather than the image when the aspect of the frustum is not 36/24. (35mm film is 36mm wide and 24mm high.) Setting preserves camera location, changes the frustum, but maintains the frustum's aspect.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.ViewScale
member.summary: Applies scaling factors to parallel projection clipping coordinates by setting the m_clip_mod transformation. If you want to compress the view projection across the viewing plane, then set x = 0.5, y = 1.0, and z = 1.0.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.TargetPoint
member.summary: The current value of the target point. This point does not play a role in the view projection calculations. It can be used as a fixed point when changing the camera so the visible regions of the before and after frustums both contain the region of interest. The default constructor sets this point on ON_3dPoint::UnsetPoint. You must explicitly call one SetTargetPoint() functions to set the target point.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.Id
member.summary: Sets the viewport's id to the value used to uniquely identify this viewport. There is no approved way to change the viewport id once it is set in order to maintain consistency across multiple viewports and those routines that manage them.

member.name: T:Rhino.Render.RenderContentSerializer
member.summary: Used to import and export custom render content types such as materials, environments and textures. You must override RenderPlugIn.RenderContentSerializers() and return an array of derived RenderContentSerializer class types to add to the content browsers.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.RenderContentSerializer.#ctor(System.String,Rhino.Render.RenderContentKind,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Protected constructor to be called from derived class
member.param: File extension associated with this serialize object
Type of content created when importing or exporting this file type.
If true then the file type can be imported and will be included in the file open box when importing the specified render content type.
If true then the file type can be exported and will be included in the file save box when exporting the specified render content type.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.RenderContentSerializer.Read(System.String)
member.summary: Called to when importing a file, file should be parsed and converted to a valid RenderContent object.
member.param: Full path of the file to load.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.RenderContent.Create(System.Guid,Rhino.Render.RenderContent.ShowContentChooserFlags,Rhino.RhinoDoc)
member.summary: Constructs a new content of the specified type and add it to the persistent content list. This function cannot be used to create temporary content that you delete after use. Content created by this function is owned by RDK and appears in the content editor. To create a temporary content which is owned by you, call RhRdkContentFactories().NewContentFromType().
member.param: Is the type of the content to add.
member.returns: A new persistent render content.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.RenderContent.Create(System.Type,Rhino.Render.RenderContent.ShowContentChooserFlags,Rhino.RhinoDoc)
member.summary: Constructs a new content of the specified type and add it to the persistent content list. This function cannot be used to create temporary content that you delete after use. Content created by this function is owned by RDK and appears in the content editor. To create a temporary content which is owned by you, call RhRdkContentFactories().NewContentFromType().
member.param: Is the type of the content to add.
member.returns: A new persistent render content.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.RenderContent.Create(System.Guid,Rhino.Render.RenderContent,System.String,Rhino.Render.RenderContent.ShowContentChooserFlags,Rhino.RhinoDoc)
member.summary: Constructs a new content of the specified type and add it to the persistent content list. This function cannot be used to create temporary content that you delete after use. Content created by this function is owned by RDK and appears in the content editor. To create a temporary content which is owned by you, call RhRdkContentFactories().NewContentFromType().
member.param: is the type of the content to add.

Parent is the parent content. If not NULL, this must be an RDK-owned content that is in the persistent content list (either top-level or child). The new content then becomes its child. If NULL, the new content is added to the top-level content list instead.
ChildSlotName is the unique child identifier to use for the new content when creating it as a child of pParent (i.e., when pParent is not NULL)
member.returns: A new persistent render content.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.RenderContent.Create(System.Type,Rhino.Render.RenderContent,System.String,Rhino.Render.RenderContent.ShowContentChooserFlags,Rhino.RhinoDoc)
member.summary: Constructs a new content of the specified type and add it to the persistent content list. This function cannot be used to create temporary content that you delete after use. Content created by this function is owned by RDK and appears in the content editor. To create a temporary content which is owned by you, call RhRdkContentFactories().NewContentFromType().
member.param: is the type of the content to add.

Parent is the parent content. If not NULL, this must be an RDK-owned content that is in the persistent content list (either top-level or child). The new content then becomes its child. If NULL, the new content is added to the top-level content list instead.
ChildSlotName is the unique child identifier to use for the new content when creating it as a child of pParent (i.e., when pParent is not NULL)
member.returns: A new persistent render content.

member.summary: See C++ RDK documentation - this is a pass through function that gives access to your own native shader. .NET clients will more likely simply check the type of their content and call their own shader access functions If you overide this function, you must ensure that you call "IsCompatible" and return IntPtr.Zero is that returns false.
member.param: The render engine requesting the shader.
A pointer to the render engine's own context object.
member.returns: A pointer to the unmanaged shader.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.RenderContent.ChildSlotNameFromParamName(System.String)
member.summary: A "child slot" is the specific "slot" that a child (usually a texture) occupies. This is generally the "use" of the child - in other words, the thing the child operates on. Some examples are "color", "transparency".
member.param: The name of a parameter field. Since child textures will usually correspond with some parameter (they generally either replace or modify a parameter over UV space) these functions are used to specify which parameter corresponded with child slot. If there is no correspondence, return the empty string.
member.returns: The default behavior for these functions is to return the input string. Sub-classes may (in the future) override these functions to provide different mappings.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.RenderContent.ParamNameFromChildSlotName(System.String)
member.summary: A "child slot" is the specific "slot" that a child (usually a texture) occupies. This is generally the "use" of the child - in other words, the thing the child operates on. Some examples are "color", "transparency".
member.param: The named of the child slot to receive the parameter name for.
member.returns: The default behaviour for these functions is to return the input string. Sub-classes may (in the future) override these functions to provide different mappings.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.RenderContent.DeleteChild(System.String,Rhino.Render.RenderContent.ChangeContexts)
member.param: Currently ignored, reserved for future use

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.RenderContent.DeleteAllChildren(Rhino.Render.RenderContent.ChangeContexts)
member.param: Currently ignored, reserved for future use

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.RenderContent.SetChild(Rhino.Render.RenderContent,System.String,Rhino.Render.RenderContent.ChangeContexts)
member.summary: Set another content as a child of this content. This content may or may not be attached to a document. If this content already has a child with the specified child slot name, that child will be deleted. If this content is not attached to a document, the child will be added without sending any events. If this content is attached to a document, the necessary events will be sent to update the UI. Note: Do not call this method to add children in your constructor. If you want to add default children, you should override Initialize() and add them there.
member.param: Child content to add to this content. If pChild is NULL, the function will fail. If pChild is already attached to a document, the function will fail. If pChild is already a child of this or another content, the function will fail.
The name that will be assigned to this child slot. The child slot name cannot be an empty string. If it is, the function will fail.
member.returns: Returns true if the content was added or the child slot with this name was modified otherwise; returns false.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.RenderContent.NewRenderContent(System.Guid,System.Type)
member.summary: Create content from type Id, called by the NewRenderContentCallbackEvent methods to create a .NET object pointer of a specific type from a class type Guid.
member.param: The class GUID property to look up
The created content must be this type
member.returns: Valid content object if the typeId is found otherwise null.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.RenderContent.IsFactoryProductAcceptableAsChild(System.Guid,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Override this method to restrict the type of acceptable child content. The default implementation of this method just returns true.
member.returns: Return true only if content with the specified kindId can be accepted as a child in the specified child slot.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.RenderContent.Icon(System.Drawing.Size)
member.summary: Icon to display in the content browser, this bitmap needs to be valid for the life of this content object, the content object that returns the bitmap is responsible for disposing of the bitmap.
member.returns: Return Icon to display in the content browser.

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.RenderContent.Fields
member.summary: Rhino.Render.Fields FieldDictionary which provides access to setting and retrieving field values.

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.RenderContent.TypeName
member.summary: Name for your content type. ie. "My .net Texture"

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.RenderContent.TypeDescription
member.summary: Description for your content type. ie. "Procedural checker pattern"

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.RenderContent.Name
member.summary: Instance name for this content.

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.RenderContent.Notes
member.summary: Notes for this content.

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.RenderContent.Id
member.summary: Instance identifier for this content.

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.RenderContent.TopLevel
member.summary: Returns true if this content has no parent, false if it is the child of another content.

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.RenderContent.InDocument
member.summary: Returns true if this content is a resident of one of the persistent lists.

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.RenderContent.Hidden
member.summary: Determines if the content has the hidden flag set.

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.RenderContent.Current
member.summary: Determines if the content is considered the "Current" content - currently only used for Environments.

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.RenderContent.Parent
member.summary: Returns the top content in this parent/child chain.

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.RenderContent.TopLevelParent
member.summary: Returns the top content in this parent/child chain.

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.RenderContent.Document
member.summary: Get the document this content belongs to or null if the content has not yet been added to a document. This will be null when content is generated for browsers or preview generation.

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.RenderContent.IsLocked
member.summary: Set this property to true prior to adding content to the document to lock the content browser editing UI methods. Setting this to true will keep the browser from allowing things like deleting, renaming or changing content. This is useful for custom child content that you want to be editable but persistent. Setting this after adding content to the document will cause an exception to be thrown.
member.exception: IsLocked must be called prior to adding content to the document

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.RenderContent.FilesToEmbed
member.summary: A string array of full paths to files used by the content that may be embedded in .3dm files and library files (.rmtl, .renv, .rtex). The default implementation returns an empty string list. Override this to return the file name or file names used by your content. This is typically used by textures that reference files containing the texture imagery.

member.name: T:Rhino.Render.RenderContent.StringIds

member.name: T:Rhino.Render.RenderContent.MatchDataResult
member.summary: Return values for MatchData function

members.member: Delete a child content. \param parentContent is the content whose child is to be deleted. This must be an RDK-owned content that is in the persistent content list (either top-level or child). \param wszChildSlotName is the child-slot name of the child to be deleted. \return \e true if successful, else \e false.

member.name: F:Rhino.Render.RenderContent.ChangeChildContentFlags.AllowNone
member.summary: Allow (none) item to be displayed in dialog.

member.name: F:Rhino.Render.RenderContent.ChangeChildContentFlags.AutoEdit
member.summary: Automatically open new content in thumbnail editor.

member.name: F:Rhino.Render.RenderContent.ChangeChildContentFlags.HarvestMask
member.summary: Mask to use to isolate harvesting flags.

member.name: F:Rhino.Render.RenderContent.ChangeChildContentFlags.HarvestUseOpt
member.summary: Use Renderer Support option to decide about harvesting.

member.name: F:Rhino.Render.RenderContent.ChangeChildContentFlags.HarvestAlways
member.summary: Always copy similar parameters from old child.

member.name: F:Rhino.Render.RenderContent.ChangeChildContentFlags.HarvestNever
member.summary: Never copy similar parameters from old child.

members.member: Change a content's child by allowing the user to choose the new content type from a content browser dialog. The child is created if it does not exist, otherwise the old child is deleted and replaced by the new child. \param parentContent is the content whose child is to be manipulated. This must be an RDK-owned content that is in the persistent content list (either top-level or child). \param wszChildSlotName is the child-slot name of the child to be manipulated. \param allowedKinds determines which content kinds are allowed to be chosen from the content browser dialog. \param uFlags is a set of flags for controlling the content browser dialog. \return \e true if successful, \e false if it fails or if the user cancels.

member.returns: Returns a new C++ pointer of the requested content type.

member.name: T:Rhino.Render.Fields.FieldDictionary
member.summary: Dictionary containing RenderContent data fields, add fields to this dictionary in your derived RenderContent classes constructor. Get field values using the TryGet[data type]() methods and set them using the Set() method.

member.name: F:Rhino.Render.Fields.FieldDictionary.m_content
member.summary: RenderContent that owns this dictionary.

member.name: F:Rhino.Render.Fields.FieldDictionary.m_dictionary
member.summary: Field dictionary used to store and access field values.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.Fields.FieldDictionary.#ctor(Rhino.Render.RenderContent)
member.summary: Internal constructor, this object should only be created by the RenderContent constructor.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.Fields.FieldDictionary.InternalDispose
member.summary: Clean up the Field C++ pointers

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.Fields.FieldDictionary.FieldFromContent(System.String)
member.summary: Search the underlying C++ content objects field list and return a temporary Field object which can be used to access the field data. The Field object can safely be disposed of when done.
member.param: Field dictionary key, it is case insensitive.
member.returns: Returns a temporary Field pointer attached to the C++ field if it is found otherwise; returns null if it is not found.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.Fields.FieldDictionary.FindField(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Search dictionary for field that matches the key name, if the field is not found in the runtime dictionary and searchContent is true the check the content for the field, if the field is found on the content object and addToDictionary is true then add it to the dictionary.
member.param: Look for a field with a matching Key value
If this is true and the field is not found in the runtime dictionary call FindContentField to search the content object for the field.
member.returns: Content field associated with the requested key or null if the field is not found.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.Fields.FieldDictionary.ContainsField(System.String)
member.summary: Call this method to determine if a this FieldsList contains a field with the specified field name.
member.returns: Returns true if a field with that matches fieldName is found or false if it is not found.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.Fields.FieldDictionary.GetField(System.String)
member.summary: Call this method to get the field with the matching name.
member.returns: If the field exists in the Fields dictionary then the field is returned otherwise; null is returned.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.Fields.FieldDictionary.AddField(Rhino.Render.Fields.Field)
member.summary: Add a new Field to the dictionary. Will throw an exception if the key is already in the dictionary or if value is not a supported type.
member.param: The new Field object to add, this will not create the Fields C++ pointer, that happens later on after the dictionary C++ object has been created.
member.returns: Returns the newly added Field object.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.Fields.FieldDictionary.Add(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Add a new StringField to the dictionary. This will be a data only field and not show up in the content browsers.
member.param: Key name for the field value to change.
member.exception: An element with the same key already exists in the dictionary

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.Fields.FieldDictionary.Add(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Add a new StringField to the dictionary.
member.param: Key name for the field value to change.

member.name: T:Rhino.Render.Fields.Field
member.summary: Generic data fields used to add publicly accessible properties to RenderContent.FieldDictionary. These should be created by calling a FieldDictaionary.Add() method on a Render content object. These are allocated after the RenderContent object's C++ object is created and added to the underlying C++ objects content dictionary, who ever allocates a field is responsible for deleting it so these objects clean up the C++ pointers when they are disposed of.

member.name: F:Rhino.Render.Fields.Field.m_auto_delete
member.summary: If this is true then the m_fieldPointer is deleted when this object is disposed of, if Attached is called when accessing data provided by another plug-in then a temporary version of this field will be returned and its value extracted by the RenderContent.FieldDictionary, in that Attach is called instead of CreateCppPointer() so the m_fieldPointer should not be deleted.

member.name: F:Rhino.Render.Fields.Field.m_initial_value
member.summary: Place holder for the initial field value, this will get used by CreateCppPointer(), it will call Set(m_initialValue) after creating the C++ pointer to initialize the field value.

member.summary: Field constructor

Display string used by the user interface

Determines whether auto-UIs will show the texture control set

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.Fields.Field.CreateCppPointer(Rhino.Render.RenderContent,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Create the RDK C++ field object and set its initial value, fields are added to a RenderContent.FieldDictionary in the RenderContent constructor before the RenderContent C++ pointer is created, the RenderContent C++ pointer is required when creating a field in order for the field to get added to the RenderContent C++ Field list so this method is called by RenderContent when it is safe to create the Field C++ pointers.
member.param: Existing C++ pointer to attach to.

member.summary: IDisposable required method

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.Fields.Field.FieldFromPointer(Rhino.Render.RenderContent,System.IntPtr,System.String)
member.summary: Create a Field[data type] object from a content field pointer using its values variant type to figure out what kind of Field[data type] object to return.
member.param: RenderContent whose Fields dictionary the field belongs to.
C++ pointer to the field object, will throw a ArgumentNullException if this value is null.
Key value for the new field

member.summary: Base class that provides access to the document lists of RenderContent instances ie - the Material, Environment and Texture tables.

member.summary: Finds a content by its instance id.
member.param: Instance id of the content to find.
Specifies if children should be searched as well as top-level content.
member.returns: The found content or null.

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.ContentList`1.Count
member.summary: The number of top level content objects in this list.

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.ContentList`1.Id
member.summary: The unique identifier for this list.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.RenderPrimitiveList.#ctor(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: This constructor gets called when attaching to an unmanaged pointer that the RDK passes to a virtual function, there is no clean up need in this case because the RDK takes care of freeing the pointer when it is done calling the virtual method.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.RenderPrimitiveList.ToMeshArray
member.summary: Call this method to get a array of meshes, all primitives will get meshed and the meshes will get included in the returned array.
member.returns: Return an array of meshes from this list, this will convert all primitives to meshes.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.RenderPrimitiveList.ToMaterialArray
member.summary: Call this method to see if there are any RenderMaterials associated with the meshes. Each primitive can optionally have a RenderMaterial associated with it, if the RenderMaterial is null then check for a RhinoObject.RenderMaterial.
member.returns: Return an array that of the same size as the ToMeshArray() containing the RenderMaterial associated with the mesh, may contain null entries if there is no RenderMaterial associated with the custom mesh.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.RenderPrimitiveList.Add(Rhino.Geometry.Mesh,Rhino.Render.RenderMaterial)
member.summary: Add mesh and material.
member.param: Material to add, may be null if not needed.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.RenderPrimitiveList.Add(Rhino.Geometry.Sphere,Rhino.Render.RenderMaterial)
member.summary: Add primitive sphere and material.
member.param: Material to add, may be null if not needed.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.RenderPrimitiveList.Add(Rhino.Geometry.Cone,Rhino.Geometry.Plane,Rhino.Render.RenderMaterial)
member.summary: Add primitive cone and material.
member.param: The plane used to cut the cone (the non-apex end is kept). Should be equal to cone.plane if not truncated.
Material to add, may be null if not needed.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.RenderPrimitiveList.Add(Rhino.Geometry.PlaneSurface,Rhino.Render.RenderMaterial)
member.summary: Add primitive plane and material.
member.param: Material to add, may be null if not needed.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.RenderPrimitiveList.Add(Rhino.Geometry.Box,Rhino.Render.RenderMaterial)
member.summary: Add primitive box and material.
member.param: Material to add, may be null if not needed.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.RenderPrimitiveList.PrimitiveType(System.Int32)
member.summary: Type of primitive object at this index.
member.param: The zero based index of the item in the list. Valid values are greater than or equal to 0 and less than Count.
member.returns: Primitive type of the item at this index.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.RenderPrimitiveList.Mesh(System.Int32)
member.summary: Get the mesh for the primitive at the specified index. If the item at this index is a primitive type other than a mesh then it mesh representation is returned.
member.param: The zero based index of the item in the list. Valid values are greater than or equal to 0 and less than Count.
member.returns: Returns the mesh for the primitive at the specified index. If the item at this index is a primitive type other than a mesh then it mesh representation is returned.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.RenderPrimitiveList.TryGetSphere(System.Int32,Rhino.Geometry.Sphere@)
member.summary: Call this method to get a box at the specified index.
member.param: The zero based index of the item in the list. Valid values are greater than or equal to 0 and less than Count.
Will contain the sphere at the requested index if the index is in range and the primitive at the requested index is a box.
member.returns: Return true if the index is in range and the primitive at the requested index is a box otherwise returns false.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.RenderPrimitiveList.TryGetBox(System.Int32,Rhino.Geometry.Box@)
member.summary: Call this method to get a box at the specified index.
member.param: The zero based index of the item in the list. Valid values are greater than or equal to 0 and less than Count.
Will contain the box at the requested index if the index is in range and the primitive at the requested index is a box.
member.returns: Return true if the index is in range and the primitive at the requested index is a box otherwise returns false.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.RenderPrimitiveList.TryGetPlane(System.Int32,Rhino.Geometry.PlaneSurface@)
member.summary: Call this method to get a box at the specified index.
member.param: The zero based index of the item in the list. Valid values are greater than or equal to 0 and less than Count.
Will contain the plane at the requested index if the index is in range and the primitive at the requested index is a plane.
member.returns: Return true if the index is in range and the primitive at the requested index is a plane otherwise returns false.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.RenderPrimitiveList.TryGetCone(System.Int32,Rhino.Geometry.Cone@,Rhino.Geometry.Plane@)
member.summary: Call this method to get a box at the specified index.
member.param: The zero based index of the item in the list. Valid values are greater than or equal to 0 and less than Count.
Will contain the cone at the requested index if the index is in range and the primitive at the requested index is a box.
member.returns: Return true if the index is in range and the primitive at the requested index is a box otherwise returns false.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.RenderPrimitiveList.Material(System.Int32)
member.summary: Call this method to get the render material associated with the mesh at the specified index. Will return null if there is no material associated with the requested mesh.
member.param: The zero based index of the item in the list. Valid values are greater than or equal to 0 and less than Count.
member.returns: If there is a render material associated at the requested index then the material is returned otherwise null is returned.

member.name: T:Rhino.Render.CustomRenderMeshProvider
member.summary: You must call CustomRenderMeshProvider.RegisterProviders() from your plug-ins OnLoad override for each assembly containing a custom mesh provider. Only publicly exported classes derived from CustomRenderMeshProvider with a public constructor that has no parameters will get registered.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.CustomRenderMeshProvider.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.CustomRenderMeshProvider.WillBuildCustomMeshes(Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo,Rhino.DocObjects.RhinoObject,System.Guid,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Determines if custom render meshes will be built for a particular object.
member.param: UUID of the RDK plug-in requesting the meshes.
member.returns: true if custom meshes will be built.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.CustomRenderMeshProvider.BuildCustomMeshes(Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo,Rhino.Render.RenderPrimitiveList,System.Guid,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Build custom render mesh(es).
member.param: The meshes class to populate with custom meshes.
UUID of the RDK plug-in requesting the meshes.
member.returns: true if operation was successful.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.CustomRenderMeshProvider.CreateCppObject(System.Guid)
member.summary: RegisterProviders calls this method to create a runtime unmanaged pointer for each custom provider registered.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.CustomRenderMeshProvider.FromSerialNumber(System.Int32)
member.summary: This method is called by the virtual hooks to get the runtime managed object from a serial number.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.CustomRenderMeshProvider.RegisterProviders(System.Reflection.Assembly,System.Guid)
member.summary: Call this method once from your plug-ins OnLoad override for each assembly containing a custom mesh provider. Only publicly exported classes derived from CustomRenderMeshProvider with a public constructor that has no parameters will get registered.
member.param: Assembly to search for valid CustomRenderMeshProvider derived classes.
The plug-in that owns the custom mesh providers.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.CustomRenderMeshProvider.AllObjectsChanged
member.summary: Call this method if your render meshes change.

member.name: T:Rhino.Render.Decal
member.summary: Represents a decal, or a picture that can be moved on an object.

member.summary: The UV bounds of the decal. Only used when mapping is UV.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.Decal.TryGetColor(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d,Rhino.Display.Color4f@,Rhino.Geometry.Point2d@)
member.summary: Blend color with the decal color at a given point.
member.param: The point in space or, if the decal is uv-mapped, the uv-coordinate of that point.
The face normal of the given point.
The color to blend the decal color to.
the UV on the texture that the color point was read from.
member.returns: true if the given point hits the decal, else false.

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.Decal.Id
member.summary: Gets the decal ID associated with this decal.

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.Decal.TextureInstanceId
member.summary: Gets the texture ID for this decal.

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.Decal.DecalMapping
member.summary: Gets the mapping of the decal.

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.Decal.DecalProjection
member.summary: Gets the decal's projection. Used only when mapping is planar.

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.Decal.MapToInside
member.summary: Used only when mapping is cylindrical or spherical.
member.value: true if texture is mapped to inside of sphere or cylinder, else \e false.

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.Decal.Transparency
member.summary: Gets the decal's transparency in the range 0 to 1.

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.Decal.Origin
member.summary: Gets the origin of the decal in world space.

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.Decal.VectorUp
member.summary: For cylindrical and spherical mapping, the vector is unitized.
member.returns: The 'up' vector of the decal. For planar mapping the length of the vector is relevant.

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.Decal.VectorAcross
member.summary: Gets the vector across. For cylindrical and spherical mapping, the vector is unitized.
member.value: The 'across' vector of the decal. For planar mapping the length of the vector is relevant.

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.Decal.Height
member.summary: Gets the height of the decal. Only used when mapping is cylindrical.

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.Decal.Radius
member.summary: Gets the radius of the decal. Only used when mapping is cylindrical or spherical.

member.summary: Gets the start latitude of the decal's sweep. Only used when mapping is cylindrical or spherical.

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.Decal.EndLatitude
member.summary: Gets the stop latitude of the decal's sweep. Only used when mapping is cylindrical or spherical.

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.Decal.StartLongitude
member.summary: Gets the start longitude of the decal's sweep. Only used when mapping is spherical.

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.Decal.EndLongitude
member.summary: Gets the stop longitude of the decal's sweep. Only used when mapping is spherical.

member.name: T:Rhino.Display.ColorLCH
member.summary: Represents an LCH (Lightness, A, B) color with double precision floating point channels. LCH colors (also sometimes called CIELUV) are transformation of the 1931 CIE XYZ color space, in order to approach perceptual uniformity. They are primarily used in computer graphics which deal with colored lights.

RhinoObjects should only ever be creatable by the RhinoDoc.

member.param: An array, a list, or any enumerable set of Rhino objects.
true if the method is allowed to instantiate new meshes if they do not exist.
true if all objects should be returned.

member.summary: Constructs a deep (full) copy of the geometry.
member.returns: A copy of the internal geometry.

member.summary: Moves changes made to this RhinoObject into the RhinoDoc.
member.returns: true if changes were made.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.RhinoObject.MemoryEstimate
member.summary: Computes an estimate of the number of bytes that this object is using in memory. Note that this is a runtime memory estimate and does not directly compare to the amount of space take up by the object when saved to a file.
member.returns: The estimated number of bytes this object occupies in memory.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.RhinoObject.GetGroupList
member.summary: Allocates an array of group indices of length GroupCount. If is 0, then this method returns null.
member.returns: An array of group indices, or null if is 0.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.RhinoObject.IsSelected(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Check selection state.
member.param: (false is good default) If true and the entire object is not selected, and some subset of the object is selected, like some edges of a surface, then 3 is returned. If false and the entire object is not selected, then zero is returned.
member.returns: 0 = object is not selected. 1 = object is selected. 2 = entire object is selected persistently. 3 = one or more proper sub-objects are selected.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.RhinoObject.IsSubObjectSelected(Rhino.Geometry.ComponentIndex)
member.summary: Check sub-object selection state.
member.returns: true if the subobject is selected.
member.remarks: A subobject cannot be persistently selected.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.RhinoObject.GetSelectedSubObjects
member.summary: Get a list of all selected sub-objects.
member.returns: An array of subobject indices, or null if there are none.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.RhinoObject.IsSelectable(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Reports if an object can be selected.
member.param: If true, then selected objects are selectable. If false, then selected objects are not selectable.
If true, then objects with grips on can be selected. If false, then the value returned by the object's IsSelectableWithGripsOn() function decides if the object can be selected.
If true, then objects on locked layers are selectable. If false, then objects on locked layers are not selectable.
If true, then objects on hidden layers are selectable. If false, then objects on hidden layers are not selectable.
member.returns: true if object is capable of being selected.
member.remarks: Objects that are locked, hidden, or on locked or hidden layers cannot be selected. If IsSelectableWithGripsOn() returns false, then an that object is not selectable if it has grips turned on.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.RhinoObject.IsSelectable
member.summary: Reports if an object can be selected.
member.returns: true if object is capable of being selected.
member.remarks: Objects that are locked, hidden, or on locked or hidden layers cannot be selected. If IsSelectableWithGripsOn() returns false, then an that object is not selectable if it has grips turned on.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.RhinoObject.IsSubObjectSelectable(Rhino.Geometry.ComponentIndex,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Reports if a subobject can be selected.
member.param: If true, then selected objects are selectable. If false, then selected objects are not selectable.
member.returns: true if the specified subobject can be selected.
member.remarks: Objects that are locked, hidden, or on locked or hidden layers cannot be selected. If IsSelectableWithGripsOn() returns false, then that object is not selectable if it has grips turned on.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.RhinoObject.Select(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Selects an object.
member.param: The new selection state; true activates selection.

If true, then the object is highlighted if it is selected and unhighlighted if is is not selected.
Highlighting can be and stay out of sync, as its specification is independent.
Objects that are persistently selected stay selected when a command terminates.

If true, then objects with grips on can be selected. If false, then the value returned by the object's IsSelectableWithGripsOn() function decides if the object can be selected when it has grips turned on.
If true, then objects on locked layers can be selected. If false, then objects on locked layers cannot be selected.
If true, then objects on hidden layers can be selectable. If false, then objects on hidden layers cannot be selected.
member.remarks: Objects that are locked, hidden, or on locked or hidden layers cannot be selected. If IsSelectableWithGripsOn() returns false, then an that object is not selectable if it has grips turned on.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.RhinoObject.Select(System.Boolean)

member.param: The new selection state; true activates selection.
member.remarks: Objects that are locked, hidden, or on locked or hidden layers cannot be selected. If IsSelectableWithGripsOn() returns false, then an that object is not selectable if it has grips turned on.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.RhinoObject.Select(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Selects an object.
member.param: The new selection state; true activates selection.

If true, then the object is hightlighted if it is selected and not hightlighted if is is not selected.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.RhinoObject.IsNormal
member.summary: An object must be in one of three modes: normal, locked or hidden. If an object is in normal mode, then the object's layer controls visibility and selectability. If an object is locked, then the object's layer controls visibility by the object cannot be selected. If the object is hidden, it is not visible and it cannot be selected.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.RhinoObject.IsLocked
member.summary: An object must be in one of three modes: normal, locked or hidden. If an object is in normal mode, then the object's layer controls visibility and selectability. member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.RhinoObject.IsReference

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.RhinoObject.Id
member.summary:
Every object has a Guid (globally unique identifier, also known as UUID, or universally unique identifier). The default value is Guid.Empty.
When an object is added to a model, the value is checked. If the value is Guid.Empty, a new Guid is created. If the value is not null but it is already used by another object in the model, a new Guid is created. If the value is not Guid.Empty and it is not used by another object in the model, then that value persists. When an object is updated, by a move for example, the value of ObjectId persists.
This value is the same as the one returned by this.Attributes.ObjectId.

member.summary: Passively reclaims unmanaged resources when the class user did not explicitly call Dispose().

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.Text3d.Dispose
member.summary: Actively reclaims unmanaged resources that this instance uses.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.Text3d.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
For derived class implementers.
This method is called with argument true when class user calls Dispose(), while with argument false when the Garbage Collector invokes the finalizer, or Finalize() method.
You must reclaim all used unmanaged resources in both cases, and can use this chance to call Dispose on disposable fields if the argument is true.
Also, you must call the base virtual method within your overriding method.
member.param: true if the call comes from the Dispose() method; false if it comes from the Garbage Collector finalizer.

member.returns: full imagePath on success; null on error.

Get full path to a Rhino specific sub-folder under the per-user Local (non-roaming) Profile folder. This is the folder where user-specific data is stored.
Windows NT4, 2000, XP, usually someplace like: "C:\Documents and Settings\[USERNAME]\Local Settings\Application Data\McNeel\Rhinoceros\[VERSION_NUMBER]\" Windows Vista, 7, usually someplace like: "C:\Users\[USERNAME]\AppData\Local\McNeel\Rhinoceros\[VERSION_NUMBER]\"

member.name: P:Rhino.ApplicationSettings.ModelAidSettings.SnappyGumballEnabled

member.name: T:Rhino.ApplicationSettings.ViewSettingsState
member.summary: Represents a snapshot of .

member.name: P:Rhino.ApplicationSettings.ViewSettingsState.PanScreenFraction
member.summary: Gets or sets the faction used as multiplier to pan the screen.

member.name: P:Rhino.ApplicationSettings.ViewSettingsState.PanReverseKeyboardAction
member.summary:
Gets or sets if panning with the keyboard is reversed.
false, then Rhino pans the camera in the direction of the arrow key you press. true, then Rhino pans the scene instead.

member.name: P:Rhino.ApplicationSettings.ViewSettingsState.AlwaysPanParallelViews
member.summary:
Gets or sets the 'always pan parallel views' value.
If the view is not looking straight at the construction plane, then sets parallel viewports so they will not rotate.

member.name: P:Rhino.ApplicationSettings.ViewSettingsState.ZoomScale
member.summary: Gets or sets the step size for zooming with a wheeled mouse or the Page Up and Page Down keys.

member.name: P:Rhino.ApplicationSettings.ViewSettingsState.RotateCircleIncrement
member.summary:
Gets or sets the rotation increment.
When the user rotates a view with the keyboard, Rhino rotates the view in steps. The usual step is 1/60th of a circle, which equals six degrees.

member.name: P:Rhino.ApplicationSettings.ViewSettingsState.RotateReverseKeyboard
member.summary:
Gets or sets the rotation direction.
If true, then Rhino rotates the camera around the scene, otherwise, rotates the scene itself.

member.name: P:Rhino.ApplicationSettings.ViewSettingsState.RotateToView
member.summary:
Gets or sets the rotation reference.
If true, then the views rotates relative to the view axes; false, than relative to the world x, y, and z axes.

member.name: P:Rhino.ApplicationSettings.ViewSettingsState.DefinedViewSetCPlane
member.summary:
Gets or sets the 'named views set CPlane' value.
When true, restoring a named view causes the construction plane saved with that view to also restore.

member.name: P:Rhino.ApplicationSettings.ViewSettingsState.DefinedViewSetProjection
member.summary:
Gets or sets the 'named views set projection' value.
When true, restoring a named view causes the viewport projection saved with the view to also restore.

member.name: P:Rhino.ApplicationSettings.ViewSettingsState.SingleClickMaximize
member.summary:
Gets or sets the 'single-click maximize' value.
When true, maximizing a viewport needs a single click on the viewport title rather than a double-click.

member.name: P:Rhino.ApplicationSettings.ViewSettingsState.LinkedViewports
member.summary:
Gets or sets the 'linked views' activated setting.
true enables real-time view synchronization. When a standard view is manipulated, the camera lens length of all parallel projection viewports are set to match the current viewport.

member.name: T:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.BitmapTable
member.summary: Stores the list of bitmaps in a Rhino document.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.BitmapTable.Find(System.String,System.Boolean,System.String@)
member.summary: This function first attempts to find the file with "name" on the disk. If it does find it, "fileName" is set to the full path of the file and the BitmapEntry returned will be null, even if there was a BitmapEntry with "name" in the bitmap table. If the function cannot find the file on the disk, it searches the bitmap table. If it finds it, the returned BitmapEntry entry will be the entry in the table with that name. Additionally, if "createFile" is true, and an entry is found, the file will be written to the disk and it's full path will be contained in "fileName".
member.param: Name of the file to search for including file extension.

If this is true, and the file is not found on the disk but is found in the BitmapTable, then the BitmapEntry will get saved to the Rhino bitmap file cache and fileName will contain the full path to the cached file.
The full path to the current location of this file or an empty string if the file was not found and/or not extracted successfully.
member.returns: Returns null if "name" was found on the disk. If name was not found on the disk, returns the BitmapEntry with the specified name if it is found in the bitmap table and null if it was not found in the bitmap table.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.BitmapTable.AddBitmap(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds a new bitmap with specified name to the bitmap table.
member.param: If NULL or empty, then a unique name of the form "Bitmap 01" will be automatically created.
If true and the there is alread a bitmap using the specified name, then that bitmap is replaced. If false and there is already a bitmap using the specified name, then -1 is returned.
member.returns: index of new bitmap in table on success. -1 on error.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.BitmapTable.DeleteBitmap(System.String)
member.summary: Deletes a bitmap.
member.returns: true if successful. false if the bitmap cannot be deleted because it is the current bitmap or because it bitmap contains active geometry.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.BitmapTable.ExportToFiles(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Exports all the bitmaps in the table to files.
member.param: full path to the directory where the bitmaps should be saved. If NULL, a dialog is used to interactively get the directory name.
member.returns: Number of bitmaps written.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.BitmapTable.ExportToFile(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Writes a bitmap to a file.
member.param: The index of the bitmap to be written.
The full path, including file name and extension, name of the file to write.
member.returns: true if successful.

member.summary: BitmapTable enumerator

member.summary: No flag is defined.

member.name: F:Rhino.Commands.Style.Hidden
member.summary: Also known as a "test" command. The command name does not auto-complete when typed on the command line an is therefore not discoverable. Useful for writing commands that users don't normally have access to.

member.name: F:Rhino.Commands.Style.ScriptRunner
member.summary: For commands that want to run scripts as if they were typed at the command line (like RhinoScript's RunScript command)

member.name: F:Rhino.Commands.Style.Transparent
member.summary: Transparent commands can be run inside of other commands. The command does not modify the contents of the model's geometry in any way. Examples of transparent commands include commands that change views and toggle snap states. Any command that adds or deletes, a view cannot be transparent.

member.name: F:Rhino.Commands.Style.DoNotRepeat
member.summary: The command should not be repeated by pressing "ENTER" immediately after the command finishes.

member.name: F:Rhino.Commands.Style.NotUndoable
member.summary: By default, all commands are undoable.

member.name: T:Rhino.Commands.RunMode
member.summary: Provides enumerated constants for a command running mode. This is currently interactive or scripted.

member.name: F:Rhino.Commands.RunMode.Interactive
member.summary: Can use dialogs for input. Must use message boxes to report serious error conditions.

member.name: F:Rhino.Commands.RunMode.Scripted
member.summary: All input must come from command line, GetPoint, GetObject, GetString, etc. Must use message boxes to report serious error conditions. Script mode gets used when a command is run with a hyphen (-) prefix.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.HistoryRecord.Finalize
member.summary: Passively reclaims unmanaged resources when the class user did not explicitly call Dispose().

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.HistoryRecord.Dispose
member.summary: Actively reclaims unmanaged resources that this instance uses.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.HistoryRecord.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
For derived class implementers.
This method is called with argument true when class user calls Dispose(), while with argument false when the Garbage Collector invokes the finalizer, or Finalize() method.
You must reclaim all used unmanaged resources in both cases, and can use this chance to call Dispose on disposable fields if the argument is true.
Also, you must call the base virtual method within your overriding method.
member.param: true if the call comes from the Dispose() method; false if it comes from the Garbage Collector finalizer.

member.summary: You typically register your panel class in your plug-in's OnLoad function. This informs Rhino of the existence of your panel class
member.param: Plug-in this panel is associated with

Class type to construct when a panel is shown. Currently only types that implement the IWin32Window interface are supported. The requirements for the class are that it has a parameterless constructor and have a GuidAttribute applied with a unique Guid
Use a 32bit depth icon in order to get proper transparency

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.DisplayBitmap.SetBlendFunction(Rhino.Display.BlendMode,Rhino.Display.BlendMode)
member.summary:
Sets blending function used to determine how this bitmap is blended with the current framebuffer color. The default setting is SourceAlpha for source and OneMinusSourceAlpha for destination. See OpenGL's glBlendFunc for details.
http://www.opengl.org/sdk/docs/man/xhtml/glBlendFunc.xml

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.DisplayBitmap.Finalize
member.summary: Passively reclaims unmanaged resources when the class user did not explicitly call Dispose().

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.DisplayBitmap.Dispose
member.summary: Actively reclaims unmanaged resources that this instance uses.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.DisplayBitmap.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
For derived class implementers.
This method is called with argument true when class user calls Dispose(), while with argument false when the Garbage Collector invokes the finalizer, or Finalize() method.
You must reclaim all used unmanaged resources in both cases, and can use this chance to call Dispose on disposable fields if the argument is true.
Also, you must call the base virtual method within your overriding method.
member.param: true if the call comes from the Dispose() method; false if it comes from the Garbage Collector finalizer.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.DisplayBitmapDrawList.MaximumCachedSortLists
member.summary: Maximum number of cached sort order index lists stored on this class. Default is 10, but depending on the number of points in this list you may get better performance by setting this value to a certain percentage of the point count.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.DisplayBitmapDrawList.SortAngleTolerance
member.summary: Angle in radians used to determine if an index list is "parallel enough" to a viewports camera angle. Default is 0.0873 radians (5 degrees)

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.DisplayConduit.CalculateBoundingBox(Rhino.Display.CalculateBoundingBoxEventArgs)
member.summary:
Library developers should override this function to increase the bounding box of scene so it includes the geometry that you plan to draw in the "Draw" virtual functions.
The default implementation does nothing.
member.param: The event argument contain the current bounding box state.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.DisplayConduit.CalculateBoundingBoxZoomExtents(Rhino.Display.CalculateBoundingBoxEventArgs)
member.summary:
If you want to participate in the Zoom Extents command with your display conduit, then you will need to override ZoomExtentsBoundingBox. Typically you could just call your CalculateBoundingBox override, but you may also want to spend a little more time here and compute a tighter bounding box for your conduit geometry if that is needed.
The default implementation does nothing.
member.param: The event argument contain the current bounding box state.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.DisplayConduit.PreDrawObjects(Rhino.Display.DrawEventArgs)
member.summary:
Called before objects are been drawn. Depth writing and testing are on.
The default implementation does nothing.
member.param: The event argument contain the current viewport and display state.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.DisplayConduit.PreDrawObject(Rhino.Display.DrawObjectEventArgs)
member.summary: Called before every object in the scene is drawn.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.DisplayConduit.PostDrawObjects(Rhino.Display.DrawEventArgs)
member.summary:
Called after all non-highlighted objects have been drawn. Depth writing and testing are still turned on. If you want to draw without depth writing/testing, see DrawForeground.
The default implementation does nothing.
member.param: The event argument contains the current viewport and display state.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.DisplayConduit.DrawForeground(Rhino.Display.DrawEventArgs)
member.summary:
Called after all non-highlighted objects have been drawn and PostDrawObjects has been called. Depth writing and testing are turned OFF. If you want to draw with depth writing/testing, see PostDrawObjects.
The default implementation does nothing.
member.param: The event argument contains the current viewport and display state.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.DisplayConduit.DrawOverlay(Rhino.Display.DrawEventArgs)
member.summary:
If Rhino is in a feedback mode, the draw overlay call allows for temporary geometry to be drawn on top of everything in the scene. This is similar to the dynamic draw routine that occurs with custom get point.
The default implementation does nothing.
member.param: The event argument contains the current viewport and display state.

member.name: F:Rhino.Display.PointStyle.ActivePoint
member.summary: Like a control point but includes vertical/horizontal crosshair lines.

member.name: T:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline
member.summary:
The display pipeline calls events during specific phases of drawing During the drawing of a single frame the events are called in the following order.
[Begin Drawing of a Frame]
CalculateBoundingBox
CalculateClippingPanes
SetupFrustum
SetupLighting
InitializeFrameBuffer
DrawBackground
If this is a layout and detail objects exist the channels are called in the same order for each detail object (drawn as a nested viewport)
PreDrawObjects
For Each Visible Non Highlighted Object
SetupObjectDisplayAttributes
PreDrawObject
DrawObject
PostDrawObject
PostDrawObjects - depth writing/testing on
DrawForeGround - depth writing/testing off
For Each Visible Highlighted Object
SetupObjectDisplayAttributes
PreDrawObject
DrawObject
PostDrawObject
PostProcessFrameBuffer (If a delegate exists that requires this)
DrawOverlay (if Rhino is in a feedback mode)
[End of Drawing of a Frame]
NOTE: There may be multiple DrawObject calls for a single object. An example of when this could happen would be with a shaded sphere. The shaded mesh is first drawn and these channels would be processed; then at a later time the isocurves for the sphere would be drawn.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.IsVisible(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d)
member.summary: Test a given 3d world coordinate point for visibility inside the view frustum under the current viewport and model transformation settings.
member.returns: true if the point is visible, false if it is not.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.IsVisible(Rhino.DocObjects.RhinoObject)
member.summary:
Test a given object for visibility inside the view frustum under the current viewport and model transformation settings. This function calls a virtual IsVisibleFinal function that subclassed pipelines can add extra tests to. In the base class, this test only tests visibility based on the objects world coordinates location and does not pay attention to the object's attributes.
NOTE: Use CRhinoDisplayPipeline::IsVisible() to perform "visibility" tests based on location (is some part of the object in the view frustum). Use CRhinoDisplayPipeline::IsActive() to perform "visibility" tests based on object type.
member.returns: true if the object is visible, false if not.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.IsVisible(Rhino.Geometry.BoundingBox)
member.summary: Test a given box for visibility inside the view frustum under the current viewport and model transformation settings.
member.returns: true if at least some portion of the box is visible, false if not.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.IsActive(Rhino.DocObjects.RhinoObject)
member.summary: Determines if an object can be visible in this viewport based on it's object type and display attributes. This test does not check for visibility based on location of the object. NOTE: Use CRhinoDisplayPipeline::IsVisible() to perform "visibility" tests based on location (is some part of the object in the view frustum). Use CRhinoDisplayPipeline::IsActive() to perform "visibility" tests based on object type.
member.returns: true if this object can be drawn in the pipeline's viewport based on it's object type and display attributes.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.InterruptDrawing
member.summary: Tests to see if the pipeline should stop drawing more geometry and just show what it has so far. If a drawing operation is taking a long time, this function will return true and tell Rhino it should just finish up and show the frame buffer. This is used in dynamic drawing operations.
member.returns: true if the pipeline should stop attempting to draw more geometry and just show the frame buffer.

member.name: E:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.CalculateBoundingBoxZoomExtents
member.summary: Calculate a bounding to include in the Zoom Extents command.

member.name: E:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.PreDrawObjects
member.summary: Called before objects are been drawn. Depth writing and testing are on.

member.name: E:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.PreDrawObject
member.summary: Called right before an individual object is being drawn. NOTE: Do not use this event unless you absolutely need to. It is called for every object in the document and can slow disply down if a large number of objects exist in the document

member.name: E:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.PostDrawObjects
member.summary: Called after all non-highlighted objects have been drawn. Depth writing and testing are still turned on. If you want to draw without depth writing/testing, see DrawForeground.

member.name: E:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.DrawForeground
member.summary: Called after all non-highlighted objects have been drawn and PostDrawObjects has been called. Depth writing and testing are turned OFF. If you want to draw with depth writing/testing, see PostDrawObjects.
member.remarks: This event is actually passed a DrawForegroundEventArgs, but we could not change the event declaration without breaking the SDK. Cast to a DrawForegroundEventArgs if you need it.

member.name: E:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.DrawOverlay
member.summary: If Rhino is in a feedback mode, the draw overlay call allows for temporary geometry to be drawn on top of everything in the scene. This is similar to the dynamic draw routine that occurs with custom get point.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.FrameSize
member.summary: Gets the size of the framebuffer that this pipeline is drawing to.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.DefaultCurveThickness
member.summary: Gets the curve thickness as defined by the current display mode. Note: this only applies to curve objects, Brep and Mesh wires may have different settings.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.IsOpenGL
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether or not this pipeline is drawing into an OpenGL context.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.IsStereoMode
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether this pipeline is currently using an engine that is performing stereo style drawing. Stereo drawing is for providing an "enhanced 3-D" effect through stereo viewing devices.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.IsPrinting
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether this pipeline is currently drawing for printing purposes.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.IsDynamicDisplay
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the viewport is in Dynamic Display state. Dynamic display is the state a viewport is in when it is rapidly redrawing because of an operation like panning or rotating. The pipeline will drop some level of detail while inside a dynamic display state to keep the frame rate as high as possible.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.SupportsShading
member.summary: Gets whether or not this pipeline supports shaded meshes.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.StereoProjection
member.summary:
Gets the current stereo projection if stereo mode is on.
0 = left
1 = right If stereo mode is not enables, this property always returns 0.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.ModelTransform
member.summary: Gets or sets the current model transformation that is applied to vertices when drawing.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.ModelTransformIsIdentity
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the Model Transform is an Identity transformation.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.RenderPass
member.summary: Gets the current pass that the pipeline is in for drawing a frame. Typically drawing a frame requires a single pass through the DrawFrameBuffer function, but some special display effects can be achieved through drawing with multiple passes.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.NestLevel
member.summary:
Gets the current nested viewport drawing level. This is used to know if you are currently inside the drawing of a nested viewport (detail object in Rhino).
Nest level = 0 Drawing is occuring in a standard Rhino viewport or on the page viewport.
Nest level = 1 Drawing is occuring inside a detail view object.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.DrawingWires
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the pipeline is currently in a curve drawing operation. This is useful when inside of a draw event or display conduit to check and see if the geometry is about to be drawn is going to be drawing the wire representation of the geometry (mesh, extrusion, or brep). See DrawingSurfaces to check and see if the shaded mesh representation of the geometry is going to be drawn.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.DrawingGrips
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the pipeline is currently in a grip drawing operation.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.DrawingSurfaces
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the pipeline is currently in a surface drawing operation. Surface drawing means draw the shaded triangles of a mesh representing the surface (mesh, extrusion, or brep). This is useful when inside of a draw event or display conduit to check and see if the geometry is about to be drawn as a shaded set of triangles representing the geometry. See DrawingWires to check and see if the wireframe representation of the geometry is going to be drawn.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.ShadingRequired
member.summary: Gets or sets the "ShadingRequired" flag. This flag gets set inside the pipeline when a request is made to draw a shaded mesh but the current render engine doesn't support shaded mesh drawing...at this point the redraw mechanism will make sure everything will work the next time around.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.CalculateBoundingBoxEventArgs.IncludeBoundingBox(Rhino.Geometry.BoundingBox)
member.summary: Unites a bounding box with the current display bounding box in order to ensure dynamic objects in "box" are drawn.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.CalculateBoundingBoxEventArgs.BoundingBox
member.summary: Gets the current bounding box.

member.name: T:Rhino.Display.ZBufferCapture
member.summary: Provides functionality for getting the zbuffer values from a viewport and a given display mode

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.ZBufferCapture.Finalize
member.summary: Passively reclaims unmanaged resources when the class user did not explicitly call Dispose().

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.ZBufferCapture.Dispose
member.summary: Actively reclaims unmanaged resources that this instance uses.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.ZBufferCapture.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
For derived class implementers.
This method is called with argument true when class user calls Dispose(), while with argument false when the Garbage Collector invokes the finalizer, or Finalize() method.
You must reclaim all used unmanaged resources in both cases, and can use this chance to call Dispose on disposable fields if the argument is true.
Also, you must call the base virtual method within your overriding method.
member.param: true if the call comes from the Dispose() method; false if it comes from the Garbage Collector finalizer.

member.name: E:Rhino.RhinoDoc.ReplaceRhinoObject
member.summary:
Called if an object is about to be replaced. If either RhinoDoc::UndoActive() or RhinoDoc::RedoActive() is true, then immediatedly after ReplaceObject is called there will be a call to DeleteObject and then a call to AddObject.
If both RhinoDoc::UndoActive() and RhinoDoc::RedoActive() are false, then immediatedly after ReplaceObject is called there will be a call to DeleteObject and then a call to UndeleteObject.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.ViewTable.FlashObjects(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Rhino.DocObjects.RhinoObject},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Cause objects selection state to change momentarily so the object appears to flash on the screen.
member.param: An array, a list or any enumerable set of Rhino objects.
If true, flash between object color and selection color. If false, flash between visible and invisible.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.ViewTable.Redraw
member.summary: Redraws all views.
member.remarks:
If you change something in the active document -- like adding objects, deleting objects, modifying layer or object display attributes, etc., then you need to call CRhinoDoc::Redraw to redraw all the views.
If you change something in a particular view like the projection, construction plane, background bitmap, etc., then you need to call CRhinoView::Redraw to redraw that particular view.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.ViewTable.Find(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Finds a view in this document with a main viewport that has a given name. Note that there may be multiple views in this document that have the same name. This function only returns the first view found. If you want to find all the views with a given name, use the GetViewList function and iterate through the views.
member.param: The name of the main viewport.
true if capitalization influences comparison; otherwise, false.
member.returns: A Rhino view on success; null on error.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.ObjectTable.Find(System.Guid)
member.summary: Uses the object guid to find a rhino object. Deleted objects cannot be found by id. The guid is the value that is stored on RhinoObject.Id In a single document, no two active objects have the same guid. If an object is replaced with a new object, then the guid persists. For example, if the _Move command moves an object, then the moved object inherits it's guid from the starting object. If the Copy command copies an object, then the copy gets a new guid. This guid persists through file saving/openning operations. This function will not find grip objects.
member.param: ID of object to search for.
member.returns: Reference to the rhino object with the objectId or null if no such object could be found.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.ObjectTable.Find(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Use the object runtime serial number to find a rhino object in the document. This is the value stored on RhinoObject.RuntimeObjectSerialNumber. The RhinoObject constructor sets the runtime serial number and every instance of a RhinoObject class will have a unique serial number for the duration of the Rhino application. If an object is replaced with a new object, then the new object will have a different runtime serial number. Deleted objects stored in the undo list maintain their runtime serial numbers and this funtion will return pointers to these objects. Call RhinoObject.IsDeleted if you need to determine if the returned object is active or deleted. The runtime serial number is not saved in files.
member.param: Runtime serial number to search for.
member.returns: Reference to the rhino object with the objectId or null if no such object could be found.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.ObjectTable.AddPictureFrame(Rhino.Geometry.Plane,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Double,System.Double,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a PictureFrame object from a plane and a path to an image file, Note, a PictureFrame object is just a Plane surface or mesh that has a material with a texture assigned to it that displays in all display modes.
member.param: Plane in which the PictureFrame will be created. Bottom left corner of picture will be at plane's origin, width will be in the plane's x axis direction, height will be in the plane's y axis direction.
If true, the function will make a MeshObject rather than a surface

Width of the resulting PictureFrame. If 0.0, the width of the pictureframe is the width of the image if height is also 0.0 or calculated from the height and aspect ratio of the image if height is not 0.0.

Height of the resulting PictureFrame. If 0.0, the height of the pictureframe is the height of the image if width is also 0.0 or calculated from the width and aspect ratio of the image if width is not 0.0.
If true, the image mapped to the picture frame plane always displays at full intensity and is not affected by light or shadow.
If true, the funtion adds the the image to the bitmaptable of the document to which the PictureFrame will be added
member.returns: A unique identifier for the object

If true, then the object is highlighted if it is selected and unhighlighted if is is not selected.
Objects that are persistently selected stay selected when a command terminates.

If true, then objects with grips on can be selected. If false, then the value returned by the object's IsSelectableWithGripsOn() function decides if the object can be selected when it has grips turned on.
If true, then objects on locked layers can be selected.
If true, then objects on hidden layers can be selectable.
member.returns: true on success, false on failure.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.Arc
member.summary:
Represents the value of a plane, two angles and a radius in a subcurve of a three-dimensional circle.
The curve is parameterized by an angle expressed in radians. For an IsValid arc the total subtended angle AngleRadians() = Domain()(1) - Domain()(0) must satisfy 0 < AngleRadians() < 2*Pi
The parameterization of the Arc is inherited from the Circle it is derived from. In particular
t -> center + cos(t)*radius*xaxis + sin(t)*radius*yaxis
where xaxis and yaxis, (part of Circle.Plane) form an othonormal frame of the plane containing the circle.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Arc.#ctor(Rhino.Geometry.Circle,System.Double)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of an arc from a base circle and an angle.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Arc.#ctor(Rhino.Geometry.Circle,Rhino.Geometry.Interval)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of an arc from a base circle and an interval of angles.
member.param: Increasing angle interval in radians with angleIntervalRadians.Length() <= 2.0*Math.PI.

member.summary: Initializes a new arc from a base plane, a radius value and an angle.
member.param: The plane of the arc (arc center will be located at plane origin)

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Arc.#ctor(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Initializes a new horizontal arc at the given center point, with a custom radius and angle.

member.summary: Initializes a new aligned arc at the given center point, with a custom radius and angle.
member.param: Alignment plane for arc. The arc will be parallel to this plane.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.BoundingBox
member.summary:
Represents the value of two points in a bounding box defined by the two extreme corner points.
This box is therefore aligned to the world X, Y and Z axes.

member.summary:
Inflate the box with custom amounts in all directions. Inflating with negative amounts may result in decreasing boxes.

Amount (in model units) to inflate this box in the y direction.

member.summary: Tests a point for boundingbox inclusion. This is the same as calling Contains(point, false)
member.returns: true if the point is on the inside of or coincident with this boundingbox; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.BoundingBox.Contains(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Tests a point for BoundingBox inclusion.

returns.para: If 'strict' is affirmative, true if the point is inside this boundingbox; false if it is on the surface or outside.
If 'strict' is negative, true if the point is on the surface or on the inside of the boundingbox; otherwise false.

member.summary:
Determines whether this boundingbox contains another boundingbox.
This is the same as calling Contains(box,false).

member.param: If true, the box needs to be fully on the inside of the boundingbox. I.e. coincident boxes will be considered 'outside'.

member.summary: Determines whether a bounding box is degenerate (flat) in one or more directions.
member.param: Distances <= tolerance will be considered to be zero. If tolerance is negative (default), then a scale invarient tolerance is used.
member.returns: 0 = box is not degenerate 1 = box is a rectangle (degenerate in one direction). 2 = box is a line (degenerate in two directions). 3 = box is a point (degenerate in three directions) 4 = box is not valid.

member.returns: true if this operation is sucessfull; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.BoundingBox.ToBrep
member.summary: Constructs a representation of this boundingbox.
member.returns: If this operation is sucessfull, a Brep representation of this box; otherwise null.

member.returns: The BoundingBox that contains both a and b.
member.remarks: Invalid boxes are ignored and will not affect the union.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.BoundingBox.Intersection(Rhino.Geometry.BoundingBox,Rhino.Geometry.BoundingBox)

Point to include in the union.
member.returns: The BoundingBox that contains both the box and the point.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.Circle
member.summary:
Represents a circle in 3D.
The values used are a radius and an orthonormal frame of the plane containing the circle, with origin at the center.
The circle is parameterized by radians from 0 to 2 Pi given by
t -> center + cos(t)*radius*xaxis + sin(t)*radius*yaxis
where center, xaxis and yaxis define the orthonormal frame of the circle plane.
member.remarks: >An IsValid circle has positive radius and an IsValid plane defining the frame.

member.summary: Try to fit a circle to two curves using tangent relationships.
member.param: Parameter on first curve close to desired solution.
Parameter on second curve closet to desired solution.
member.returns: Valid circle on success, Circle.Unset on failure.

member.summary: Try to fit a circle to three curves using tangent relationships.
member.param: Parameter on first curve close to desired solution.
Parameter on second curve closet to desired solution.
Parameter on third curve close to desired solution.
member.returns: Valid circle on success, Circle.Unset on failure.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.Cone
member.summary: Represents the center plane, radius and height values in a right circular cone.

member.summary: Initializes a new cone with a specified base plane, height and radius.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Cone.AngleInRadians
member.summary: Computes the angle (in radians) between the axis and the side of the cone. The angle and the height have the same sign.
member.returns: Math.Atan(Radius / Height) if the height is not 0; 0 if the radius is 0; Math.PI otherwise.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Cone.AngleInDegrees
member.summary: Computes the angle (in degrees) between the axis and the side of the cone. The angle and the height have the same sign.
member.returns: An angle in degrees.

member.summary: Constructs a Nurbs surface representation of this Cone. This is synonymous with calling NurbsSurface.CreateFromCone().
member.returns: A Nurbs surface representation of the cone or null.

member.summary: Constructs a RevSurface representation of this Cone. This is synonymous with calling RevSurface.CreateFromCone().
member.returns: A RevSurface representation of the cone or null.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Cone.ToBrep(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets a Brep representation of the cone with a single face for the cone, an edge along the cone seam, and vertices at the base and apex ends of this seam edge. The optional cap is a single face with one circular edge starting and ending at the base vertex.
member.param: true if the bottom should be filled with a surface. false otherwise.
member.returns: A brep (polysurface) representation of this cone values.
