member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.CurveOffsetCornerStyle
member.summary: Defines enumerated values for all implemented corner styles in curve offsets.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.CurveOffsetCornerStyle.None
member.summary: The dafault value.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.CurveOffsetCornerStyle.Sharp
member.summary: Offsets and extends curves with a straight line until they intersect.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.CurveOffsetCornerStyle.Round
member.summary: Offsets and fillets curves with an arc of radius equal to the offset distance.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.CurveOffsetCornerStyle.Smooth
member.summary: Offsets and connects curves with a smooth (G1 continuity) curve.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.CurveOffsetCornerStyle.Chamfer
member.summary: Offsets and connects curves with a straight line between their endpoints.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.CurveKnotStyle
member.summary: Defines enumerated values for knot spacing styles in interpolated curves.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.CurveKnotStyle.Uniform
member.summary: Parameter spacing between consecutive knots is 1.0.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.CurveKnotStyle.Chord
member.summary: Chord length spacing, requires degree=3 with CV1 and CVn1 specified.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.CurveKnotStyle.ChordSquareRoot
member.summary: Square root of chord length, requires degree=3 with CV1 and CVn1 specified.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.CurveKnotStyle.UniformPeriodic
member.summary: Periodic with uniform spacing.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.CurveKnotStyle.ChordPeriodic
member.summary: Periodic with chord length spacing.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.CurveKnotStyle.ChordSquareRootPeriodic
member.summary: Periodic with square roor of chord length spacing.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.CurveOrientation
member.summary: Defines enumerated values for closed curve orientations.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.CurveOrientation.Undefined
member.summary: Orientation is undefined.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.CurveOrientation.Clockwise
member.summary: The curve's orientation is clockwise in the xy plane.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.CurveOrientation.CounterClockwise
member.summary: The curve's orientation is counter clockwise in the xy plane.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.PointContainment
member.summary: Defines enumerated values for closed curve/point spatial relationships.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.PointContainment.Unset
member.summary: Relation is meaningless.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.PointContainment.Inside
member.summary: Point is on the interior of the region implied by the closed curve.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.PointContainment.Outside
member.summary: Point is on the exterior of the region implied by the closed curve.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.PointContainment.Coincident
member.summary: Point is coincident with the curve and therefor neither inside not outside.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.RegionContainment
member.summary: Defines enumerated values for closed curve/closed curve relationships.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.RegionContainment.Disjoint
member.summary: There is no common area between the two regions.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.RegionContainment.MutualIntersection
member.summary: The two curves intersect. There is therefore no full containment relationship either way.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.RegionContainment.AInsideB
member.summary: Region bounded by curveA (first curve) is inside of curveB (second curve).

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.RegionContainment.BInsideA
member.summary: Region bounded by curveB (second curve) is inside of curveA (first curve).

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.CurveExtensionStyle
member.summary: Defines enumerated values for styles to use during curve extension, such as "Line", "Arc" or "Smooth".

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.CurveExtensionStyle.Line
member.summary: Curve ends will be propagated linearly according to tangents.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.CurveExtensionStyle.Arc
member.summary: Curve ends will be propagated arc-wise according to curvature.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.CurveExtensionStyle.Smooth
member.summary: Curve ends will be propagated smoothly according to curvature.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.CurveSimplifyOptions
member.summary: Enumerates the options to use when simplifying a curve.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.CurveSimplifyOptions.None
member.summary: No option is specified.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.CurveSimplifyOptions.SplitAtFullyMultipleKnots
member.summary: Split NurbsCurves at fully multiple knots. Effectively turning single nurbs segments with kinks into multiple segments.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.CurveSimplifyOptions.RebuildLines
member.summary: Replace linear segments with LineCurves.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.CurveSimplifyOptions.RebuildArcs
member.summary: Replace partially circular segments with ArcCurves.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.CurveSimplifyOptions.RebuildRationals
member.summary: Replace rational nurbscurves with constant weights with an equivalent non-rational NurbsCurve.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.CurveSimplifyOptions.AdjustG1
member.summary: Adjust Curves at G1-joins.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.CurveSimplifyOptions.Merge
member.summary: Merge adjacent co-linear lines or co-circular arcs or combine consecutive line segments into a polyline.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.CurveSimplifyOptions.All
member.summary: Implies all of the simplification functions will be used.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.CurveEnd
member.summary: Defines the extremes of a curve through a flagged enumeration.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.CurveEnd.None
member.summary: Not the start nor the end.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.CurveEnd.Start
member.summary: The frontal part of the curve.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.CurveEnd.End
member.summary: The tail part of the curve.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.CurveEnd.Both
member.summary: Both the start and the end of the curve.

member.summary: The default evaluation side.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.CurveEvaluationSide.Below

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.CurveEvaluationSide.Above
member.summary: The above evaluation side.

member.summary: Gets a non-rational, degree 1 Nurbs curve representation of the line.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.NurbsCurve.CreateFromArc(Rhino.Geometry.Arc)
member.summary: Gets a rational degree 2 NURBS curve representation of the arc. Note that the parameterization of NURBS curve does not match arc's transcendental paramaterization.
member.returns: Curve on success, null on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.NurbsCurve.CreateFromCircle(Rhino.Geometry.Circle)
member.summary: Gets a rational degree 2 NURBS curve representation of the circle. Note that the parameterization of NURBS curve does not match circle's transcendental paramaterization. Use GetRadianFromNurbFormParameter() and GetParameterFromRadian() to convert between the NURBS curve parameter and the transcendental parameter.
member.returns: Curve on success, null on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.NurbsCurve.CreateFromEllipse(Rhino.Geometry.Ellipse)
member.summary:
Gets a rational degree 2 NURBS curve representation of the ellipse.
Note that the parameterization of the NURBS curve does not match with the transcendental paramaterization of the ellipsis.
member.returns: A nurbs curve representation of this ellipse or null if no such representation could be made.

member.summary: Constructs a new Nurbscurve with a specific degree and control-point count.
member.param: Degree of curve. Must be equal to or larger than 1 and smaller than or equal to 11.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.NurbsCurve.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructs a new NurbsCurve with knot and CV memory allocated.
member.param: true to make a rational NURBS.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.NurbsCurve.IncreaseDegree(System.Int32)
member.summary: Increase the degree of this curve.
member.param: The desired degree. Degrees should be number between and including 1 and 11.
member.returns: true on success, false on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.NurbsCurve.MakePiecewiseBezier(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Clamps ends and adds knots so the NURBS curve has bezier spans (all distinct knots have multiplitity = degree).
member.param: If true and the first or last weight is not one, then the first and last spans are reparameterized so that the end weights are one.
member.returns: true on success, false on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.NurbsCurve.Reparameterize(System.Double)
member.summary: Use a linear fractional transformation to reparameterize the NURBS curve. This does not change the curve's domain.
member.param: reparameterization constant (generally speaking, c should be > 0). The control points and knots are adjusted so that output_nurbs(t) = input_nurbs(lambda(t)), where lambda(t) = c*t/( (c-1)*t + 1 ). Note that lambda(0) = 0, lambda(1) = 1, lambda'(t) > 0, lambda'(0) = c and lambda'(1) = 1/c.
member.returns: true if successful.
member.remarks: The cv and knot values are values are changed so that output_nurbs(t) = input_nurbs(lambda(t)).

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.NurbsCurve.CreateSpiral(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Creates a C1 cubic NURBS approximation of a helix or spiral. For a helix, you may have radius0 == radius1. For a spiral radius0 == radius0 produces a circle. Zero and negative radii are permissible.
member.param: Helix's axis starting point or center of spiral.
Helix's axis vector or normal to spiral's plane.
Point used only to get a vector that is perpedicular to the axis. In particular, this vector must not be (anti)parallel to the axis vector.
The pitch, where a spiral has a pitch = 0, and pitch > 0 is the distance between the helix's "threads".

The number of turns in spiral or helix. Positive values produce counter-clockwise orientation, negitive values produce clockwise orientation. Note, for a helix, turnCount * pitch = length of the helix's axis.
member.returns: NurbsCurve on success, null on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.NurbsCurve.CreateSpiral(Rhino.Geometry.Curve,System.Double,System.Double,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32)
member.summary: Create a C2 non-rational uniform cubic NURBS approximation of a swept helix or spiral.
member.param: Starting portion of rail curve's domain to sweep along.
Ending portion of rail curve's domain to sweep along.
Point used only to get a vector that is perpedicular to the axis. In particular, this vector must not be (anti)parallel to the axis vector.
The pitch. Positive values produce counter-clockwise orientation, negative values produce clockwise orientation.

The turn count. If != 0, then the resulting helix will have this many turns. If = 0, then pitch must be != 0 and the approximate distance between turns will be set to pitch. Positive values produce counter-clockwise orientation, negitive values produce clockwise orientation.
The starting radius. At least one radii must benonzero. Negative values are allowed.
The ending radius. At least ont radii must be nonzero. Negative values are allowed.
Number of points to intepolate per turn. Must be greater than 4. When in doubt, use 12.
member.returns: NurbsCurve on success, null on failure.

member.summary:
Computes the knots that are superfluous because they are not used in NURBs evaluation. These make it appear so that the first and last curve spans are different from interior spans.
http://wiki.mcneel.com/developer/onsuperfluousknot

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Point2f.op_LessThan(Rhino.Geometry.Point2f,Rhino.Geometry.Point2f)
member.summary:
Determines whether the first specified comes before (has inferior sorting value than) the second point.
Coordinates evaluation priority is first X, then Y.
member.returns: true if a.X is smaller than b.X, or a.X == b.X and a.Y is smaller than b.Y; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Point2f.op_LessThanOrEqual(Rhino.Geometry.Point2f,Rhino.Geometry.Point2f)
member.summary:
Determines whether the first specified comes before (has inferior sorting value than) the second point, or it is equal to it.
Coordinates evaluation priority is first X, then Y.
member.returns: true if a.X is smaller than b.X, or a.X == b.X and a.Y <= b.Y; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Point2f.op_GreaterThan(Rhino.Geometry.Point2f,Rhino.Geometry.Point2f)
member.summary:
Determines whether the first specified comes after (has superior sorting value than) the second point.
Coordinates evaluation priority is first X, then Y.
member.returns: true if a.X is larger than b.X, or a.X == b.X and a.Y is larger than b.Y; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Point2f.op_GreaterThanOrEqual(Rhino.Geometry.Point2f,Rhino.Geometry.Point2f)

Adds two quaternions.

member.returns: A new quaternion.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion.op_Subtraction(Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion,Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion)
member.summary:
Subtracts a quaternion from another one.
This computes the difference of each quaternion coefficient with its correspondant and returns a new result quaternion.
member.returns: A new quaternion.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion.op_Multiply(Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion,Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion)
member.summary:
Multiplies a quaternion with another one.
Quaternion multiplication (Hamilton product) is not commutative.
member.returns: A new quaternion.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion.Invert
member.summary:
Modifies this quaternion to become
(a/L2, -b/L2, -c/L2, -d/L2),
where L2 = length squared = (a*a + b*b + c*c + d*d).
This is the multiplicative inverse, i.e., (a,b,c,d)*(a/L2, -b/L2, -c/L2, -d/L2) = (1,0,0,0).
member.returns: true if successful. false if the quaternion is zero and cannot be inverted.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion.DistanceTo(Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion)
member.summary: Computes the distance or norm of the difference between this and another quaternion.
member.returns: (this - q).Length.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion.Distance(Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion,Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion)
member.summary: Returns the distance or norm of the difference between two quaternions.
member.returns: (p - q).Length()

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion.MatrixForm
member.summary: Returns 4x4 real valued matrix form of the quaternion a b c d -b a -d c -c d a -b -d -c b a which has the same arithmetic properties as the quaternion.
member.returns: A transform value.
member.remarks: Do not confuse this with the rotation defined by the quaternion. This function will only be interesting to math nerds and is not useful in rendering or animation applications.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion.Unitize
member.summary: Scales the quaternion's coordinates so that a*a + b*b + c*c + d*d = 1.
member.returns: true if successful. false if the quaternion is zero and cannot be unitized.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion.SetRotation(System.Double,Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d)
member.summary: Sets the quaternion to cos(angle/2), sin(angle/2)*x, sin(angle/2)*y, sin(angle/2)*z where (x,y,z) is the unit vector parallel to axis. This is the unit quaternion that represents the rotation of angle about axis.
member.param: The direction of the axis of rotation.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion.Rotation(System.Double,Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d)
member.summary: Returns the unit quaternion cos(angle/2), sin(angle/2)*x, sin(angle/2)*y, sin(angle/2)*z where (x,y,z) is the unit vector parallel to axis. This is the unit quaternion that represents the rotation of angle about axis.
member.returns: A new quaternion.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion.SetRotation(Rhino.Geometry.Plane,Rhino.Geometry.Plane)
member.summary: Sets the quaternion to the unit quaternion which rotates plane0.xaxis to plane1.xaxis, plane0.yaxis to plane1.yaxis, and plane0.zaxis to plane1.zaxis.
member.param: The "from" rotation plane. Origin point is ignored.
The "to" rotation plane. Origin point is ignored.
member.remarks: The plane origins are ignored

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion.Rotation(Rhino.Geometry.Plane,Rhino.Geometry.Plane)
member.summary: Returns the unit quaternion that represents the the rotation that maps plane0.xaxis to plane1.xaxis, plane0.yaxis to plane1.yaxis, and plane0.zaxis to plane1.zaxis.
member.returns: A quaternion value.
member.remarks: The plane origins are ignored

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion.GetRotation(System.Double@,Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d@)
member.summary: Returns the rotation defined by the quaternion.
member.param: unit axis of rotation of 0 if (b,c,d) is the zero vector.
member.returns: True if the operation succeeded; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: If the quaternion is not unitized, the rotation of its unitized form is returned.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion.GetRotation(Rhino.Geometry.Plane@)
member.summary: Returns the frame created by applying the quaternion's rotation to the canonical world frame (1,0,0),(0,1,0),(0,0,1).
member.param: A plane. This out value will be assigned during this call.
member.returns: true if the operation succeeded; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion.Rotate(Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d)
member.summary: Rotates a 3d vector. This operation is also called conjugation, because the result is the same as (q.Conjugate()*(0,x,y,x)*q/q.LengthSquared).Vector.
member.returns: R*v, where R is the rotation defined by the unit quaternion. This is mathematically the same as the values (Inverse(q)*(0,x,y,z)*q).Vector and (q.Conjugate()*(0,x,y,x)*q/q.LengthSquared).Vector.
member.remarks: If you need to rotate more than a dozen or so vectors, it will be more efficient to calculate the rotation matrix once and use it repeatedly.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion.Product(Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion,Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion)
member.summary: The quaternion product of p and q. This is the same value as p*q.
member.returns: A transform value.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion.CrossProduct(Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion,Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion)
member.summary:
Computes the vector cross product of p and q = (0,x,y,z),
where (x,y,z) = CrossProduct(p.Vector,q.Vector).
This is not the same as the quaternion product p*q.
member.returns: A new quaternion.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion.Zero
member.summary: Returns the dafault quaternion, where all coefficients are 0.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion.Identity
member.summary: Returns the (1,0,0,0) quaternion.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion.I
member.summary: Returns the (0,1,0,0) quaternion.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion.J
member.summary: Returns the (0,0,1,0) quaternion.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion.K
member.summary: Returns the (0,0,0,1) quaternion.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion.A
member.summary: Gets or sets the real part of the quaternion.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion.B
member.summary: Gets or sets the first imaginary coefficient of the quaternion.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion.C
member.summary: Gets or sets the second imaginary coefficient of the quaternion.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion.D
member.summary: Gets or sets the third imaginary coefficient of the quaternion.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion.IsValid
member.summary:
Determines if the four coefficients are valid numbers within RhinoCommon.
See .

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion.Conjugate
member.summary:
Gets a new quaternion that is the conjugate of this quaternion.
This is (a,-b,-c,-d)

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion.Inverse
member.summary:
Computes a new inverted quaternion,
(a/L2, -b/L2, -c/L2, -d/L2),
where L2 = length squared = (a*a + b*b + c*c + d*d). This is the multiplicative inverse, i.e., (a,b,c,d)*(a/L2, -b/L2, -c/L2, -d/L2) = (1,0,0,0). If this is the zero quaternion, then the zero quaternion is returned.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion.Length
member.summary: Returns the length or norm of the quaternion.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion.LengthSquared
member.summary: Gets the result of (a^2 + b^2 + c^2 + d^2).

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion.Vector
member.summary:
The imaginary part of the quaternion
(B,C,D)

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion.Scalar
member.summary:
The real (scalar) part of the quaternion
This is .

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion.IsZero
member.summary: true if a, b, c, and d are all zero.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion.IsScalar
member.summary: true if b, c, and d are all zero.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion.IsVector
member.summary: true if a = 0 and at least one of b, c, or d is not zero.

member.summary: Constructs a new translation (move) tranformation. Right column is (dx, dy, dz, 1.0).

Distance to translate (move) geometry along the world Y axis.
Distance to translate (move) geometry along the world Z axis.
member.returns: A transform matrix which moves geometry with the specified distances.

Scaling factor along the anchor plane Y-Axis direction.
Scaling factor along the anchor plane Z-Axis direction.
member.returns: A transformation matrix which scales geometry non-uniformly.

member.summary: Constructs a new rotation transformation with specified angle, rotation center and rotation axis.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Transform.Mirror(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d)
member.summary: Create mirror transformation matrix The mirror transform maps a point Q to Q - (2*(Q-P)oN)*N, where P = pointOnMirrorPlane and N = normalToMirrorPlane.
member.param: Normal vector to the mirror plane.
member.returns: A transformation matrix which mirrors geometry in a specified plane.

member.summary: Constructs a new Mirror transformation.
member.param: Plane that defines the mirror orientation and position.
member.returns: A transformation matrix which mirrors geometry in a specified plane.

member.param: Coordinate system in which the geometry is currently described.
Target coordinate system in which we want the geometry to be described.
member.returns: A transformation matrix which orients geometry from one coordinate system to another on success. Transform.Unset on failure.

member.summary: The determinant of this 4x4 matrix.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.TransformSimilarityType.OrientationReversing
member.summary: Similarity is preserved, but orientation is flipped.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.TransformSimilarityType.NotSimilarity
member.summary: Similarity is not preserved. Geometry needs to be deformable for this Transform to operate correctly.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.TransformSimilarityType.OrientationPreserving

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.SpaceMorph
member.summary: Represents a spacial, Euclidean morph.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.SpaceMorph.Morph(Rhino.Geometry.GeometryBase)
member.summary: Apply the space morph to geometry.
member.returns: true on success, false on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.SpaceMorph.IsMorphable(Rhino.Geometry.GeometryBase)
member.summary: true if the geometry can be morphed by calling SpaceMorph.Morph(geometry)

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.SpaceMorph.MorphPoint(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d)
member.summary:
Morphs an Euclidean point.
This method is abstract.
member.param: A point that will be morphed by this function.
member.returns: Resulting morphed point.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.SpaceMorph.Tolerance
member.summary: The desired accuracy of the morph. This value is primarily used for deforming surfaces and breps. The default is 0.0 and any value <= 0.0 is ignored by morphing functions. The Tolerance value does not affect the way meshes and points are morphed.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.SpaceMorph.QuickPreview
member.summary: true if the morph should be done as quickly as possible because the result is being used for some type of dynamic preview. If QuickPreview is true, the tolerance may be ignored. The QuickPreview value does not affect the way meshes and points are morphed. The default is false.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.SpaceMorph.PreserveStructure
member.summary: true if the morph should be done in a way that preserves the structure of the geometry. In particular, for NURBS objects, true means that only the control points are moved. The PreserveStructure value does not affect the way meshes and points are morphed. The default is false.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.Morphs.TwistSpaceMorph
member.summary: Deforms objects by rotating them around an axis.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Morphs.TwistSpaceMorph.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs a twist space morph.

member.summary:
Morphs an Euclidean point.
This method is abstract.
member.param: A point that will be morphed by this function.

member.summary: Deforms objects by bending along a spine arc.

member.summary: Constructs a bend space morph.
member.param: Start of spine that represents the original orientation of the object.
If false, then point determines the region to bend. If true, only the spine region is bent.
If false, then only one end of the object bends. If true, then the object will bend symmetrically around the center if you start the spine in the middle of the object.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.Morphs.MaelstromSpaceMorph
member.summary: Deforms objects in a spiral as if they were caught in a whirlpool.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Morphs.MaelstromSpaceMorph.#ctor(Rhino.Geometry.Plane,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Constructs a maelstrom space morph.
member.param: Plane on which the base circle will lie. Origin of the plane will be the center point of the circle.

remarks.para:
If radius0 = radius1 > 0, then the morph is a rotation where the angle of rotation is proportional to the radius.
If radius0 < radius1, then everything inside of the circle of radius radius0 if fixed, the rotation angle increases smoothly from 0 at radius0 to m_a at radius1, and everything outside of the circle of radius radius1 is rotated by angle.
If radius0 > radius1, then everything outside of the circle of radius radius0 if fixed, the rotation angle increases smoothly from 0 at radius0 to m_a at radius1, and everything inside of the circle of radius radius1 is rotated by angle.

member.name: T:Rhino.FileIO.File3dmTypeCodes
member.summary:
Typecode format 4 bytes long
x xxxxxxxxxxxxxxx,x xxx xxxx xxxx x x xx | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | +--- "stuff" bit | | | | | | | +-- specific codes | | | | | +-- RESERVED - DO NOT USE (should be 0) (will be used to control CRC on/off) | | | +-- category:_000 0000 0000 0001 Legacy geometry TCODE_LEGACY_GEOMETRY | _000 0000 0000 0010 openNURBS object TCODE_OPENNURBS_OBJECT | _000 0000 0000 0100 -- RESERVED - DO NOT USE (should be 0 in any typecode) -- | _000 0000 0000 1000 -- RESERVED - DO NOT USE (should be 0 in any typecode) -- | _000 0000 0001 0000 Geometry TCODE_GEOMETRY | _000 0000 0010 0000 Annotation | _000 0000 0100 0000 Display Attributes TCODE_DISPLAY | _000 0000 1000 0000 Rendering TCODE_RENDER | _000 0001 0000 0000 | _000 0010 0000 0000 Interface TCODE_INTERFACE | _000 0100 0000 0000 -- RESERVED - DO NOT USE (should be 0 in any typecode) -- | _000 1000 0000 0000 Tolerances TCODE_TOLERANCE | _001 0000 0000 0000 Tables TCODE_TABLE | _010 0000 0000 0000 Table record TCODE_TABLEREC | _100 0000 0000 0000 User information TCODE_USER | +-- format: 0 - data size in header - data block follows TCODE_SHORT 1 - data in header - no data block follows

member.name: F:Rhino.FileIO.File3dmTypeCodes.TCODE_COMMENTBLOCK
member.summary: (0x00000001) The TCODE_COMMENTBLOCK is the first chunk in the file, starts 32 bytes into the file, and contains text information terminated with a ^m_z. This ^m_z and contents of this chunk were expanded in February 2000. Files written with code released earlier than this will not have the ^m_z.

member.name: F:Rhino.FileIO.File3dmTypeCodes.TCODE_ENDOFFILE
member.summary: (0x00007FFF) The TCODE_ENDOFFILE is the last chunk in the file and the first 4 bytes of information in this chunk is an integer that contains the file length. This chunk was added in February 2000 and files written with code released earlier than this will not have this termination block.

member.name: F:Rhino.FileIO.File3dmTypeCodes.TCODE_ENDOFFILE_GOO
member.summary: (0x00007FFE) this typecode is returned when a rogue eof marker is found Some v1 3dm file writers put these markers in a "goo". Simply skip these chunks and continue.

member.name: F:Rhino.FileIO.File3dmTypeCodes.TCODE_ANONYMOUS_CHUNK
member.summary: (TCODE_USER | TCODE_CRC | 0x0000)

member.name: P:Rhino.FileIO.FileReadOptions.ImportMode
member.summary:
true means we are merging whatever is being read into an existing document. This means you need to consider things like:
If the information being read is in a different unit system, it should be scaled if UseScaleGeometry is true.
There can be existing layers, fonts, materials, dimension styles, hatch patterns, and so on with the same name as items being read from the file.

member.name: P:Rhino.FileIO.FileReadOptions.OpenMode
member.summary:
true means we are reading the information into an empty document. This means you need to consider things like:
Setting the unit system (if the file has a unit system)
Creating a default layer if one is not there.
Setting up appropriate views when you're finished reading.

member.name: P:Rhino.FileIO.FileReadOptions.NewMode
member.summary: true means we are reading template information in something like a OnFileNew event.

member.name: P:Rhino.FileIO.FileReadOptions.InsertMode
member.summary: true means we are reading information that will be used to create an instance definition or some other type of "inserting" that is supported by Rhino's "Insert" command.

member.name: P:Rhino.FileIO.FileReadOptions.ImportReferenceMode
member.summary: true means we are reading information for a work session reference model or a linked instance definition.

member.name: P:Rhino.FileIO.FileReadOptions.BatchMode
member.summary: true means you cannot ask questions during reading. (no dialogs, no "getters", etc.)

member.name: P:Rhino.FileIO.FileReadOptions.UseScaleGeometry
member.summary: If this parameter is true, then no questions are asked when unit conversion scaling is optional and the setting specified by ScaleGeometry is used.

summary.para: true: If ImportMode is true and the geometry in the file being read has a unit system different from the model's unit system, then apply the unit conversion scale to the file's geometry before adding it to the model.

false: Do not scale. Once case where this happens is when an instance definition is read from a file and the model space instance references have been scaled. In case the instance definition geometry cannot be scaled or the net result is that the size of the instance reference object is scaled by the square of the scale factor.

member.param: true if the call comes from the Dispose() method; false if it comes from the Garbage Collector finalizer.

member.name: T:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass
member.summary:
Base class for GetObject, GetPoint, GetSphere, etc.
You will never directly create a GetBaseClass but you will use its member functions after calling GetObject.Gets(), GetPoint.Get(), and so on.
Provides tools to set command prompt, set command options, and specify if the "get" can optionally accept numbers, nothing (pressing enter), and undo.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.SetCommandPrompt(System.String)
member.summary: Sets prompt message that appears in the command prompt window.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.SetCommandPromptDefault(System.String)
member.summary: Sets message that describes what default value will be used if the user presses enter. This description appears in angle brackets <> in the command prompt window. You do not need to provide a default value description unless you explicity enable AcceptNothing.
member.remarks: If you have a simple default point, number, or string, it is easier to use SetDefaultPoint, SetDefaultNumber, or SetDefaultString. SetCommandPromptDefault and AcceptNothing can be used for providing more advanced UI behavior.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.SetDefaultPoint(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d)
member.summary: Sets a point as default value that will be returned if the user presses the ENTER key during the get.
member.remarks: Calling SetDefaultPoint will automatically handle setting the command prompt default and reacting to the user pressing ENTER. If the user presses enter to accept the default point, GetResult.Point is returned and RhinoGet.GotDefault() will return true. Calling SetDefaultPoint will clear any previous calls to SetDefaultString or SetDefaultNumber.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.SetDefaultNumber(System.Double)
member.summary: Sets a number as default value that will be returned if the user presses ENTER key during the get.
member.remarks: Calling SetDefaultNumber will automatically handle setting the command prompt default and reacting to the user pressing ENTER. If the user presses ENTER to accept the default number, GetResult.Number is returned and RhinoGet.GotDefault() will return true. Calling SetDefaultNumber will clear any previous calls to SetDefaultString or SetDefaultPoint.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.SetDefaultInteger(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets a number as default value that will be returned if the user presses ENTER key during the get.
member.remarks: Calling SetDefaultInteger will automatically handle setting the command prompt default and reacting to the user pressing ENTER. If the user presses ENTER to accept the default integer, GetResult.Number is returned and CRhinoGet.GotDefault() will return true. Calling SetDefaultNumber will clear any previous calls to SetDefaultString or SetDefaultPoint.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.SetDefaultString(System.String)
member.summary: Sets a string as default value that will be returned if the user presses ENTER key during the get.
member.remarks: Calling SetDefaultString will automatically handle setting the command prompt default and reacting to the user pressing ENTER. If the user presses ENTER to accept the default string, GetResult.String is returned and RhinoGet.GotDefault() will return true. Calling SetDefaultString will clear any previous calls to SetDefaultNumber or SetDefaultPoint.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.SetDefaultColor(System.Drawing.Color)
member.summary: Sets a color as default value that will be returned if the user presses ENTER key during the get.
member.remarks: Calling SetDefaultColor will automatically handle setting the command prompt default and reacting to the user pressing ENTER. If the user presses ENTER to accept the default color, GetResult.Color is returned and RhinoGet.GotDefault() will return true. Calling SetDefaultColor will clear any previous calls to SetDefaultString or SetDefaultPoint.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.SetWaitDuration(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the wait duration (in milliseconds) of the getter. If the duration passes without the user making a decision, the GetResult.Timeout code is returned.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.ClearDefault
member.summary: Clears any defaults set using SetDefaultPoint, SetDefaultNumber, SetDefaultString, or SetCommandPromptDefault.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.GotDefault
member.summary: Returns true if user pressed Enter to accept a default point, number, or string set using SetDefaultPoint, SetDefaultNumber, or SetDefaultString.
member.returns: true if the result if the default point, number or string set. Otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.ClearCommandOptions
member.summary: Clear all command options.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.EnableTransparentCommands(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Control the availability of transparent commands during the get.
member.param: If true, then transparent commands can be run during the get. If false, then transparent commands cannot be run during the get.
member.remarks: Some Rhino commands are "transparent" and can be run inside of other commands. Examples of transparent commands include the view manipulation commands like ZoomExtents, Top, etc., and the selection commands like SelAll, SelPoint, etc. By default transparent commands can be run during any get. If you want to disable this feature, then call EnableTransparentCommands(false) before calling GetString, GetPoint, GetObject, etc.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.AcceptNothing(System.Boolean)
member.summary: If you want to allow the user to be able to press enter in order to skip selecting a something in GetPoint.Get(), GetObject::GetObjects(), etc., then call AcceptNothing( true ) beforehand.
member.param: true if user is able to press enter in order to skip selecting.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.AcceptUndo(System.Boolean)
member.summary: If you want to allow the user to have an 'undo' option in GetPoint.Get(), GetObject.GetObjects(), etc., then call AcceptUndo(true) beforehand.
member.param: true if user is able to choose the 'Undo' option.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.AcceptNumber(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: If you want to allow the user to be able to type in a number during GetPoint.Get(), GetObject::GetObjects(), etc., then call AcceptNumber() beforehand. If the user chooses to type in a number, then the result code GetResult.Number is returned and you can use RhinoGet.Number() to get the value of the number. If you are using GetPoint and you want "0" to return (0,0,0) instead of the number zero, then set acceptZero = false.
member.param: true if user is able to type a number.
If you are using GetPoint and you want "0" to return (0,0,0) instead of the number zero, then set acceptZero = false.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.AcceptPoint(System.Boolean)
member.summary: If you want to allow the user to be able to type in a point then call AcceptPoint(true) before calling GetPoint()/GetObject(). If the user chooses to type in a number, then the result code GetResult.Point is returned and you can use RhinoGet.Point() to get the value of the point.
member.param: true if user is able to type in a point.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.AcceptColor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: If you want to allow the user to be able to type in a color r,g,b or name during GetPoint.Get(), GetObject::GetObjects(), etc., then call AcceptColor(true) before calling GetPoint()/GetObject(). If the user chooses to type in a color, then the result code GetResult.Color is returned and you can use RhinoGet.Color() to get the value of the color. If the get accepts points, then the user will not be able to type in r,g,b colors but will be able to type color names.
member.param: true if user is able to type a color.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.AcceptString(System.Boolean)
member.summary: If you want to allow the user to be able to type in a string during GetPoint.Get(), GetObject::GetObjects(), etc., then call AcceptString(true) before calling GetPoint()/GetObject(). If the user chooses to type in a string, then the result code GetResult.String is returned and you can use RhinoGet.String() to get the value of the string.
member.param: true if user is able to type a string.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.Result
member.summary: Returns result of the Get*() call.
member.returns: The result of the last Get*() call.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.CommandResult
member.summary: Helper method for getting command result value from getter results.
member.returns: The converted command result.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.Number

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.StringResult

member.returns: The string chosen by the user.

member.summary: Gets a color if Get*() returns GetResult.Color.
member.returns: The color chosen by the user.

member.summary: Gets a view the user clicked in during GetPoint.Get(), GetObject.GetObjects(), etc.
member.returns: The view chosen by the user.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.PickRectangle
member.summary: If the get was a GetObjects() and the mouse was used to select the objects, then the returned rect has left < right and top < bottom. This rect is the Windows GDI screen coordinates of the picking rectangle. RhinoViewport.GetPickXform( pick_rect, pick_xform ) will calculate the picking transformation that was used. In all other cases, left=right=top=bottom=0;
member.returns: The picking rectangle; or 0 in the specified cases.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.Point2d
member.summary: Returns location in view of point in selected in GetPoint::Get() or GetPoint::Get2dPoint(). (0,0) = upper left corner of window.
member.returns: The location.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.Rectangle2d
member.summary: Returns the location in the view of the 2d rectangle selected in GetPoint::Get2dRectangle(). rect.left < rect.right and rect.top < rect.bottom (0,0) = upper left corner of window.
member.returns: The rectangle.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.Line2d
member.summary:
Returns two points defining the location in the view window of the 2d line selected in GetPoint::Get2dLine().
(0,0) = upper left corner of window.
member.returns: An array with two 2D points.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.#ctor
member.summary: Create a new GetPoint.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.SetBasePoint(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets a base point used by ortho snap, from snap, planar snap, etc.
member.param: If true, then the distance from base_point to the current point will be in the status bar distance pane.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.ConstrainDistanceFromBasePoint(System.Double)
member.summary: Sets distance constraint from base point.
member.param: pass UnsetValue to clear this constraint. Pass 0.0 to disable the ability to set this constraint by typing a number during GetPoint.
member.remarks: If the base point is set and the distance from base point constraint is > 0, then the picked point is constrained to be this distance from the base point.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.DrawLineFromPoint(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Use DrawLineFromPoint() if you want a dynamic line drawn from a point to the point being picked.
member.param: The line is drawn from startPoint to the point being picked. If the base point has not been set, then it is set to startPoint.
if true, the distance from the basePoint to the point begin picked is shown in the status bar.
member.remarks: Calling DrawLineFromPoint automatically enables drawing the line. Use EnableDrawLineFromPoint() to toggle the line drawing state.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.EnableDrawLineFromPoint(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Controls drawing of dynamic a line from the start point.
member.param: if true, a dynamic line is drawn from the DrawLineFromPoint startPoint to the point being picked.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.PermitOrthoSnap(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Controls availability of ortho snap. Default is true.
member.param: if true, then GetPoint pays attention to the Rhino "ortho snap" and "planar snap" settings reported by ModelAidSettings.Ortho and ModelAidSettings.Planar.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.PermitFromOption(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Control the availability of the built-in "From" option. By default, the "From" option is enabled.
member.param: if true, then the "From" option is automatically avaiable in GetPoint.
member.remarks: The GetPoint "From" option is never visible on the command line and the user must type the complete option name to activate the "From" option. When the GetPoint "From" snap is enabled, the user set/change the base point during GetPoint by typing "From" and picking a point. A related option is the builit-in distance from base point constraint that is can be set before GetPoint is called by passing a value to GetPoint::ConstrainDistanceFromBasePoint or during GetPoint by entering a number.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.PermitConstraintOptions(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Control the availability of the built-in linear, planar, curve, and surface constraint options like "Along", "AlongPerp", "AlongTan", "AlongParallel", "Between", "OnCrv", "OnSrf", ".x", ".y", ".z", ".xy", etc.
member.param: if true, then the built-in contraint options are automatically avaiable in GetPoint.
member.remarks: By default, these built-in constraint options are availble unless an explicit constraint is added by calling one of the GetPoint::Constrain functions. Calling GetPoint::ClearConstraints automatically enables the built-in constraint options. The built-in constraint options are never visible on the command line and the user must type the complete option name to activate these options.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.PermitTabMode(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Permits the use of the tab key to define a line constraint.
member.param: If true, then the built-in tab key mode is available.
member.remarks: By default, use of the tab key is supported.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.PermitElevatorMode(System.Int32)
member.summary: Permits the use of the control key to define a line constraint.
member.param: 0: no elevator modes are permitted 1: fixed plane elevator mode (like the Line command) 2: cplane elevator mode (like object dragging)

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.PermitObjectSnap(System.Boolean)
member.summary: By default, object snaps like "end", "near", etc. are controled by the user. If you want to disable this ability, then call PermitObjectSnap(false).
member.param: true to permit snapping to objects.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.AddSnapPoint(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d)
member.summary: Adds a point to the list of osnap points.
member.returns: Total number of snap points.
member.remarks: When point osnap is enabled, GetPoint will snap to points in the Rhino model. If you want the user to be able to snap to additional points, then use GetPoint::AddSnapPoints to specify the locations of these additional points.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.AddSnapPoints(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d[])
member.summary: Adds points to the list of osnap points.
member.param: An array of points to snap onto.
member.returns: Total number of snap points.
member.remarks: When point osnap is enabled, GetPoint will snap to points in the Rhino model. If you want the user to be able to snap to additional points, then use GetPoint::AddSnapPoints to specify the locations of these additional points.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.AddConstructionPoint(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d)
member.summary: Adds a point to the list of construction points.
member.returns: Total number of construction points.
member.remarks: Construction points are like snap points except that they get snapped to even when point osnap is off. Typically, there are only a few construction points while there can be many snap points. For example, when polylines are drawn the start point is a construction point and the other points are snap points.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.AddConstructionPoints(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d[])
member.summary: Adds points to the list of construction points.
member.param: An array of points to be added.
member.returns: Total number of construction points.
member.remarks: Construction points are like snap points except that they get snapped to even when point osnap is off. Typically, there are only a few construction points while there can be many snap points. For example, when polylines are drawn the start point is a construction point and the other points are snap points.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.ClearSnapPoints
member.summary: Remove all snap points.
member.remarks: When point osnap is enabled, GetPoint will snap to points in the Rhino model. If you want the user to be able to snap to additional points, then use GetPoint::AddSnapPoints tp specify the locations of these additional points.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.ClearConstructionPoints
member.summary: Remove all construction points.
member.remarks: Construction points are like snap points except that they get snapped to even when point osnap is off. Typically, there are only a few construction points while there can be many snap points. For example, when polylines are drawn the start point is a construction point and the other points are snap points.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.GetSnapPoints

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.EnableCurveSnapTangentBar(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)

true to draw points at the end of the tangent bar.
member.remarks: The tangent bar is drawn by GetPoint::DynamicDraw. If you override GetPoint::DynamicDraw, then you must call the base class function.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.EnableCurveSnapPerpBar(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Controls display of the curve snap perpendicular bar icon.

true to draw points at the end of the tangent bar.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.EnableCurveSnapArrow(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Controls display of the curve snap arrow icon.
member.param: true to draw arrow icon whenever GetPoint snaps to a curve.
true if arrow icon direction should be the reverse of the first derivative direction.
member.remarks: The tangent bar is drawn by GetPoint::DynamicDraw. If you override GetPoint::DynamicDraw, then you must call the base class function.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.EnableSnapToCurves(System.Boolean)
member.summary: If you want GetPoint() to try to snap to curves when the mouse is near a curve (like the center point in the Circle command when the AroundCurve option is on), then enable the snap to curves option.

defines whether the point pick is allowed to happen off object. When false, a "no no" cursor is shown when the cursor is not on the object. When true, a normal point picking cursor is used and the marker is visible also when the cursor is not on the object.
member.returns: true if constraint could be applied.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.Constrain(Rhino.Geometry.Surface,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Constrains the picked point to lie on a surface.
member.param: A surface to use as constraint.

defines whether the point pick is allowed to happen off object. When false, a "no no" cursor is shown when the cursor is not on the object. When true, a normal point picking cursor is used and the marker is visible also when the cursor is not on the object.
member.returns: true if constraint could be applied.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.Constrain(Rhino.Geometry.Brep,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Constrains the picked point to lie on a brep.
member.param: A brep to use as constraint.
When wire_density<0, isocurve intersection snapping is turned off, when wire_density>=0, the value defines the isocurve density used for isocurve intersection snapping.
When face_index <0, constrain to whole brep. When face_index >=0, constrain to individual face.

defines whether the point pick is allowed to happen off object. When false, a "no no" cursor is shown when the cursor is not on the object. When true, a normal point picking cursor is used and the marker is visible also when the cursor is not on the object.
member.returns: true if constraint could be applied.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.Constrain(Rhino.Geometry.Mesh,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Constrains the picked point to lie on a mesh.
member.param: A mesh to use as constraint.

defines whether the point pick is allowed to happen off object. When false, a "no no" cursor is shown when the cursor is not on the object. When true, a normal point picking cursor is used and the marker is visible also when the cursor is not on the object.
member.returns: true if constraint could be applied.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.ConstrainToConstructionPlane(System.Boolean)
member.summary: If enabled, the picked point is constrained to be on the active construction plane. If the base point is set, then the point is constrained to be on the plane that contains the base point and is parallel to the active construction plane. By default this constraint is enabled.
member.param: true if the base point should be used as compulsory level reference.
member.returns: If true and the base point is set, then the point is constrained to be on the plane parallel to the construction plane that passes through the base point, even when planar mode is off. If throughBasePoint is false, then the base point shift only happens if planar mode is on.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.ConstrainToTargetPlane
member.summary: Constrains point to lie on a plane that is parallel to the viewing plane and passes through the view's target point.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.ConstrainToVirtualCPlaneIntersection(Rhino.Geometry.Plane)
member.summary: If enabled, the picked point is constrained to be on the intersection of the plane and the virtual CPlane going through the plane origin. If the planes are parallel, the constraint works just like planar constraint.
member.param: The plane used for the plane - virtual CPlane intersection.
member.returns: true if the operation succeeded; false otherwise.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.ClearConstraints
member.summary: Removes any explicit constraints added by calls to GetPoint::Constraint() and enable the built-in constraint options.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.InterruptMouseMove
member.summary: If you have lengthy computations in OnMouseMove() and/or DymanicDraw() overrides, then periodically call InterruptMouseMove() to see if you should interrupt your work because the mouse has moved again.
member.returns: true if you should interrupt your work; false otherwise.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.OnMouseMove(Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPointMouseEventArgs)
member.summary: Calls the event and can/should be called by overriding implementation.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.OnMouseDown(Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPointMouseEventArgs)
member.summary: Default calls the MouseDown event.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.OnDynamicDraw(Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPointDrawEventArgs)
member.summary: Default calls the DynamicDraw event.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.OnPostDrawObjects(Rhino.Display.DrawEventArgs)
member.summary: In the "rare" case that you need to draw some depth buffered geometry during a GetPoint operation, override the OnPostDrawObjects function. NOTE!! Overriding this function comes with a significant performance penalty because the scene needs to be fully regenerated every frame where the standard DynamicDraw event draws temporary decorations (geometry) on top of a static scene.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.Get(System.Boolean)
member.summary: After setting up options and so on, call this method to get a 3d point.
member.param: If false, the point is returned when the left mouse button goes down. If true, the point is returned when the left mouse button goes up.
member.returns: if the user chose a point; other enumeration value otherwise.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.Get(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: After setting up options and so on, call this method to get a 2d or 3d point.
member.param: If false, the point is returned when the left mouse button goes down. If true, the point is returned when the left mouse button goes up.
If true then get a 2d point otherwise get a 2d point
member.returns: if the user chose a 3d point; if the user chose a 2d point; other enumeration value otherwise.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.Get
member.summary: After setting up options and so on, call GetPoint::Get to get a 3d point. The point is retrieved when the mouse goes down.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.PointOnObject
member.summary: Call this function to see if the point was on an object. If the point was on an object an ObjRef is returned; otherwise null is returned.
member.returns: A point object reference.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.PointOnCurve(System.Double@)
member.summary: Use to determine is point was on a curve.
member.param: If the point was on a curve, then the t is the curve parameter for the point. The point returned by Point() is the same as curve.PointAt(t).
member.returns: A curve at a specified parameter value.

member.name: P:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.DynamicDrawColor
member.summary: Color used by CRhinoGetPoint::DynamicDraw to draw the current point and the line from the base point to the current point.

member.name: E:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.MouseMove
member.summary: Called every time the mouse moves. MouseMove is called once per mouse move and is called BEFORE any calls to OnDynamicDraw. If you are doing anything that takes a long time, periodically call InterruptMouseMove() to see if you should stop. If the view is such that the 2d screen point can't be mapped to a 3d point, the 'point' argument will be Unset.

member.name: P:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.Tag
member.summary: Gets or sets an arbitrary object that can be attached to this instance. Useful for passing some/ information that you may need in a DynamicDraw event since you can get at this Tag from the GetPointDrawEventArgs.

member.name: E:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.MouseDown
member.summary: Called during Get2dRectangle, Get2dLine, and GetPoint(..,true) when the mouse down event for the initial point occurs. This function is not called during ordinary point getting because the mouse down event terminates an ordinary point get and returns a GetResult.Point result.

member.name: E:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.DynamicDraw
member.summary:
Event to use if you want to dynamically draw things as the mouse/digitizer moves. Every time the mouse moves, DynamicDraw will be called once per viewport. The calls to DynamicDraw happen AFTER the call to MouseMove.
If you are drawing anything that takes a long time, periodically call InterruptMouseMove() to see if you should stop.

member.name: P:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.FullFrameRedrawDuringGet
member.summary: In the "RARE" case that you need to draw some depth buffered geometry during a Get() operation, setting this value to true will force entire frames to be redrawn while the user moves the mouse. This allows DisplayPipeline events to be triggered as well as OnPostDrawObjects NOTE!! Setting this value to true comes with a significant performance penalty because the scene needs to be fully regenerated every frame where the standard DynamicDraw event draws temporary decorations (geometry) on top of a static scene.

member.name: E:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.PostDrawObjects
member.summary: Same as the DisplayPipeline.PostDrawObjects, but only works during the operation of the Get() function. NOTE: You must set FullFrameRedrawDuringGet to true in order for this event to be called.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetTransform.AddTransformObjects(Rhino.Collections.TransformObjectList)

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Custom.CustomObjectGrips.OnReset
member.summary: Resets location of all grips to original spots and cleans up stuff that was created by dynamic dragging. This is required when dragging is canceled or in the Copy command when grips are "copied". The override should clean up dynamic workspace stuff.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Custom.CustomObjectGrips.OnResetMeshes
member.summary: Just before Rhino turns off object grips, it calls this function. If grips have modified any display meshes, they must override this function and restore the meshes to their original states.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Custom.CustomObjectGrips.OnUpdateMesh(Rhino.Geometry.MeshType)
member.summary: Just before Rhino shades an object with grips on, it calls this method to update the display meshes. Grips that modify surface or mesh objects must override this function and modify the display meshes here.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Custom.CustomObjectGrips.NewGeometry
member.summary: If the grips control just one object, then override NewGeometry(). When NewGeometry() is called, return new geometry calculated from the current grip locations. This happens once at the end of a grip drag.
member.returns: The new geometry. The default implementation returns null.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Custom.CustomObjectGrips.OnDraw(Rhino.DocObjects.Custom.GripsDrawEventArgs)
member.summary: Draws the grips. In your implementation, override this if you need to draw dynamic elements and then call this base implementation to draw the grips themselves.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Custom.CustomObjectGrips.NeighborGrip(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Get neighbors.
member.param: index of grip where the search begins.

param.name: dr
param.para: 1 = next grip in the first parameter direction.
-1 = prev grip in the first parameter direction.

param.name: ds
param.para: 1 = next grip in the second parameter direction.
-1 = prev grip in the second parameter direction.

param.name: dt
param.para: 1 = next grip in the third parameter direction.
-1 = prev grip in the third parameter direction.

member.param: If true and object is "closed", the search will wrap.
member.returns: Pointer to the desired neighbor or NULL if there is no neighbor.

member.summary: When RelocateEnabled is true, the user can reposition the gumball by tapping the control key while dragging. Once the repostion drag is terminated by releasing the/ mouse button, ordinary editing resumes. The default setting is true.

member.summary: When MenuEnabled is true, the menu "button" is drawn on the gumball. The default setting is true.

member.summary: TranslateXEnabled is true, the X axis translation control is available. The default setting is true.

member.name: P:Rhino.UI.Gumball.GumballAppearanceSettings.TranslateYEnabled
member.summary: TranslateYEnabled is true, the Y axis translation control is available. The default setting is true.

member.name: P:Rhino.UI.Gumball.GumballAppearanceSettings.TranslateZEnabled
member.summary: TranslateZEnabled is true, the Z axis translation control is available. The default setting is true.

member.name: P:Rhino.UI.Gumball.GumballAppearanceSettings.TranslateXYEnabled
member.summary: When TranslateXY is true, the XY plane translation control is available in appropriate views. The default setting is true.

member.name: P:Rhino.UI.Gumball.GumballAppearanceSettings.TranslateYZEnabled
member.summary: When TranslateYZ is true, the YZ plane translation control is available in appropriate views. The default setting is true.

member.summary: When RotateX is true, the X rotation control is available. The default setting is true.

member.name: P:Rhino.UI.Gumball.GumballAppearanceSettings.RotateZEnabled

member.summary: When FreeTranslate is 1, the center translation control can be dragged in any direction and moves the object the gumball controls. member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.HatchPattern.ReadFromFile(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Reads hatch pattern definitions from a file.
member.param: Name of an existing file. If filename is null or empty, default hatch pattern filename is used.
If file doesn't exist, and quiet is false, an error meesage box is shown.
member.returns: An array of hatch patterns. This can be null, but not empty.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.HatchPattern.IsDeleted
member.summary: Deleted hatch patterns are kept in the runtime hatch pattern table so that undo will work with hatch patterns. Call IsDeleted to determine to determine if a hatch pattern is deleted.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.HatchPattern.IsReference
member.summary: Rhino allows multiple files to be viewed simultaneously. Hatch patterns in the document are "normal" or "reference". Reference hatch patterns are not saved.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.HatchPattern.Index
member.summary: Index in the hatch pattern table for this pattern. -1 if not in the table.

member.name: T:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.HatchPatternTable
member.summary: All of the hatch pattern definitions contained in a rhino document.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.HatchPatternTable.Find(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Finds the hatch pattern with a given name. Search ignores case.
member.param: The name of the hatch patter to be found.
true means don't search deleted hatch patterns.
member.returns: Index of the hatch pattern with the given name. -1 if no hatch pattern found.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.HatchPatternTable.Add(Rhino.DocObjects.HatchPattern)
member.summary: Adds a new hatch pattern with specified definition to the table.
member.param: definition of new hatch pattern. The information in pattern is copied. If patern.Name is empty the a unique name of the form "HatchPattern 01" will be automatically created.
member.returns: >=0 index of new hatch pattern -1 not added because a hatch pattern with that name already exists or some other problem occured.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.HatchPatternTable.Document
member.summary: Document that owns this table.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.HatchPatternTable.Count
member.summary: Number of patterns in the table.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.HatchPatternTable.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Conceptually, the hatch pattern table is an array of hatch patterns. The operator[] can be used to get individual hatch patterns. A hatch pattern is either active or deleted and this state is reported by HatchPattern.IsDeleted.
member.returns: If index is out of range, the current hatch pattern is returned.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.HatchPatternTable.CurrentHatchPatternIndex
member.summary: At all times, there is a "current" hatch pattern. Unless otherwise specified, new objects are assigned to the current hatch pattern. The current hatch pattern is never locked, hidden, or deleted.

member.name: T:Rhino.DocObjects.InstanceDefinitionUpdateType
member.summary: The possible relationships between the instance definition geometry and the archive containing the original defition.

member.name: F:Rhino.DocObjects.InstanceDefinitionUpdateType.Static
member.summary: The Rhino user interface uses the term "Embedded" for Static update types. This instance definition is never updated. If m_source_archive is set, it records the origin of the instance definition geometry, but m_source_archive is never used to update the instance definition.

member.name: F:Rhino.DocObjects.InstanceDefinitionUpdateType.Embedded
member.summary: This instance definition geometry was imported from another archive (m_source_archive) and is embedded. If m_source_archive changes, the user is asked if they want to update the instance definition.

member.name: F:Rhino.DocObjects.InstanceDefinitionUpdateType.LinkedAndEmbedded
member.summary: This instance definition geometry was imported from another archive (m_source_archive) and is embedded. If m_source_archive changes, the instance definition is automatically updated. If m_source_archive is not available, the instance definition is still valid.

member.name: F:Rhino.DocObjects.InstanceDefinitionUpdateType.Linked
member.summary: This instance definition geometry was imported from another archive (m_source_archive) and is not embedded. If m_source_archive changes, the instance definition is automatically updated. If m_source_archive is not available, the instance definition is not valid. This does not save runtime memory. It may save a little disk space, but it is a foolish option requested by people who do not understand all the issues.

member.name: T:Rhino.DocObjects.InstanceDefinitionLayerStyle
member.summary: A InstanceDefinitionUpdateType.Static or InstanceDefinitionUpdateType.LinkedAndEmbedded idef must have LayerStyle = Unset, a InstanceDefinitionUpdateType.Linked InstanceDefnition must have LayerStyle = Active or Reference

member.name: T:Rhino.DocObjects.InstanceDefinitionArchiveFileStatus
member.summary: The archive file of a linked instance definition can have the following possible states. Use InstanceObject.ArchiveFileStatus to query a instance definition's archive file status.

member.name: F:Rhino.DocObjects.InstanceDefinitionArchiveFileStatus.NotALinkedInstanceDefinition
member.summary: The instance definition is not a linked instance definition.

member.name: F:Rhino.DocObjects.InstanceDefinitionArchiveFileStatus.LinkedFileNotReadable
member.summary: The instance definition's archive file is not readable.

member.name: F:Rhino.DocObjects.InstanceDefinitionArchiveFileStatus.LinkedFileNotFound
member.summary: The instance definition's archive file cannot be found.

member.name: F:Rhino.DocObjects.InstanceDefinitionArchiveFileStatus.LinkedFileIsUpToDate
member.summary: The instance definition's archive file is up-to-date.

member.name: F:Rhino.DocObjects.InstanceDefinitionArchiveFileStatus.LinkedFileIsNewer
member.summary: The instance definition's archive file is newer.

member.name: F:Rhino.DocObjects.InstanceDefinitionArchiveFileStatus.LinkedFileIsOlder
member.summary: The instance definition's archive file is older.

member.name: F:Rhino.DocObjects.InstanceDefinitionArchiveFileStatus.LinkedFileIsDifferent
member.summary: The instance definition's archive file is different.

member.summary: Explodes the instance reference into pieces.
member.param: If true, then nested instance references are recursively exploded into pieces until actual geometry is found. If false, an InstanceObject is added to the pieces out parameter when this InstanceObject has nested references.
An array of Rhino objects will be assigned to this out parameter during this call.
An array of object attributes will be assigned to this out parameter during this call.
An array of the previously applied transform matrices will be assigned to this out parameter during this call.

member.summary: Determines if this instance definition contains a reference to another instance definition.
member.returns: 0 no 1 other_idef_index is the index of this instance definition >1 This InstanceDefinition uses the instance definition and the returned value is the nesting depth.

member.summary: Determines whether the instance definition is referenced.

param.name: wheretoLook
param.para: 0 = check for top level references in active document.
1 = check for top level and nested references in active document.
2 = check for references in other instance definitions.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.InstanceDefinition.IsReference
member.summary: An object from a work session reference model is reference a reference object and cannot be modified. An object is a reference object if, and only if, it is on a reference layer.

member.summary: Marks the source path for a linked instance definition as relative or absolute.
member.param: The instance definition to be marked.

param.name: relative
param.para: If true, the path should be considered as relative.
If false, the path should be considered as absolute.

member.returns: true if the instance defintion could be modified.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.InstanceDefinitionTable.Delete(System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Deletes the instance definition.
member.param: zero based index of instance definition to delete. This must be in the range 0 <= idefIndex < InstanceDefinitionTable.Count.
true to delete all references to this definition. false to delete definition only if there are no references.
If true, no warning message box appears if an instance definition cannot be deleted because it is the current layer or it contains active geometry.
member.returns: true if successful. false if the instance definition has active references and bDeleteReferences is false.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.InstanceDefinitionTable.Purge(System.Int32)
member.summary: Purges an instance definition and its definition geometry.
member.param: zero based index of instance definition to delete. This must be in the range 0 <= idefIndex < InstanceDefinitionTable.Count.
member.returns: True if successful. False if the instance definition cannot be purged because it is in use by reference objects or undo information.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.InstanceDefinitionTable.Compact(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Purge deleted instance definition information that is not in use. This function is time consuming and should be used in a thoughtful manner.
member.param: If false, then deleted instance definition information that could possibly be undeleted by the Undo command will not be deleted. If true, then all deleted instance definition information is deleted.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.InstanceDefinitionTable.Undelete(System.Int32)
member.summary: Undeletes an instance definition that has been deleted by Delete()
member.param: zero based index of instance definition to delete. This must be in the range 0 <= idefIndex < InstanceDefinitionTable.Count.
member.returns: true if successful

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.InstanceDefinitionTable.UpdateLinkedInstanceDefinition(System.Int32,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Read the objects from a file and use them as the instance's definition geometry.
member.param: zero based index of instance definition to delete. This must be in the range 0 <= idefIndex < InstanceDefinitionTable.Count.
name of file (can be any type of file that Rhino or a plug-in can read)
If true and the instance definition referes to a linked instance definition, that needs to be updated, then the nested defition is also updated. If false, nested updates are skipped.

member.summary: Gets an array of instance definitions.

member.returns: An array of instance definitions. This can be empty, but not null.

member.summary: Gets unsed instance definition name used as default when creating new instance definitions.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.InstanceDefinitionTable.GetUnusedInstanceDefinitionName(System.String)
member.summary: Gets unsed instance definition name used as default when creating new instance definitions.

member.returns: An unused instance definition name string.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.InstanceDefinitionTable.GetUnusedInstanceDefinitionName(System.String,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Gets unsed instance definition name used as default when creating new instance definitions.
member.param: The returned name is 'root nn' If root is empty, then 'Block' (localized) is used.

Unique names are created by appending a decimal number to the localized term for "Block" as in "Block 01", "Block 02", and so on. When defaultSuffix is supplied, the search for an unused name begins at "Block suffix".
member.returns: An unused instance definition name string.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.InstanceDefinitionTable.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Conceptually, the InstanceDefinition table is an array of Instance definitions. The operator[] can be used to get individual instance definition. member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Layer.GetDefaultLayerProperties
member.summary:
Constructs a layer with the current default properties. The default layer properties are:
color = Rhino.ApplicationSettings.AppearanceSettings.DefaultLayerColor
line style = Rhino.ApplicationSettings.AppearanceSettings.DefaultLayerLineStyle
material index = -1
iges level = -1
mode = NormalLayer
name = empty
layer index = 0 (ignored by AddLayer)
member.returns: A new layer instance.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Layer.GetPersistentVisibility
member.summary: The persistent visbility setting is used for layers whose visibilty can be changed by a "parent" object. A common case is when a layer is a child layer (ParentId is not nil). In this case, when a parent layer is turned off, then child layers are also turned off. The persistent visibility setting determines what happens when the parent is turned on again.
member.remarks:
Returns true if this layer's visibility is controlled by a parent object and the parent is turned on (after being off), then this layer will also be turned on. Returns false if this layer's visibility is controlled by a parent object and the parent layer is turned on (after being off), then this layer will continue to be off.
When the persistent visbility is not explicitly set, this property returns the current value of IsVisible

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Layer.SetPersistentVisibility(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set the persistent visibility setting for this layer

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Layer.UnsetPersistentVisibility
member.summary: Remove any explicit persistent visibility setting from this layer

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Layer.GetPersistentLocking
member.summary: The persistent locking setting is used for layers that can be locked by a "parent" object. A common case is when a layer is a child layer (Layer.ParentI is not nil). In this case, when a parent layer is locked, then child layers are also locked. The persistent locking setting determines what happens when the parent is unlocked again.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Layer.SetPersistentLocking(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set the persistent locking setting for this layer

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Layer.UnsetPersistentLocking
member.summary: Remove any explicity persistent locking settings from this layer

member.name: T:Rhino.DocObjects.MaterialRefs
member.summary:
If you are developing a high quality plug-in renderer, and a user is assigning a custom render material to this object, then add rendering material information to the MaterialRefs dictionary.
Note to developers: As soon as the MaterialRefs dictionary contains items rendering material queries slow down. Do not populate the MaterialRefs dictionary when setting the MaterialIndex will take care of your needs.
